title: Client Care Coordinator
description:
Looking for long-term employment?  That's exactly what we're offering...



We're an entrepreneurial bankruptcy firm that’s experiencing continued aggressive growth and we're in need of assistance with file management, client portal management, and engaging in regular
 communication.



You'll hit the ground running quickly and your responsibilities will include:

- Client portal management: you will be responsible for monitoring client's progress in their portals on a daily basis, and this will involve checking task completion, file management, and communicating with clients in the portal.  You will manage between 60 to 100 client portals at any given time.

- File management: you will be responsible for ensuring that all client documents are saved in the correct folders with the correct names.  This will require checking multiple locations daily for new documents and promptly ensuring they're saved in the correct location.

-
 communication: you will provide regular, weekly updates to clients recapping the progress they've made during the week and highlighting next steps.  You will be responsible for
ing clients who have stopped progressing or stopped paying to try to recapture their attention and get them back on track.  You must be prepared to stay completely up to date on all
s and respond to all inbound
s you receive daily

Status tracking: you will track the status of all assigned clients as they progress through various phases while they're assigned to you.  This requires constant attention and must be done carefully.



The ideal candidate will be resourceful, take initiative, be very detail oriented and highly organized.  You should have a customer service background and be ready to join an engaged team.



You must also be able to adapt quickly to change and correctly reassess priorities as new tasks are added.  



Our team is entirely virtual and we regularly chat with each other throughout the day.  We're very supportive and we all love to learn and share what we know.  If you're excited to be part of a team that loves to work hard and succeed together, there will be room for training and development as we continue growing.

title: Instagram DM Sales Closer (Christian Apparel Brand)
description:
Love of God is a rapidly growing Christian clothing brand built on impact, excellence, and authenticity. We’re not just selling apparel — we’re building a movement rooted in faith, depth, and real connection.



We’re looking for a high-performing DM Sales Closer who knows how to build genuine relationships through Instagram and
 messaging — and turn conversations into customers.



This is not entry-level support.



This is relationship-driven sales.



The Role



You will manage conversations through Instagram and
 
 using Meta Business Suite.



Your mission:



• Build trust

• Create real connection

• Handle objections confidently

• Guide conversations toward a natural close



This starts as a part-time position (10–20 hours per week) with room to grow as revenue scales.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



• Responding quickly and professionally to inbound DMs

• Starting conversations with warm followers when appropriate

• Building genuine rapport (no robotic copy-paste responses)

• Answering product questions clearly and confidently

• Handling objections like “It’s too expensive” or “I’ll think about it”

• Following up with warm leads who haven’t purchased

• Tracking conversations and sales generated

• Increasing overall DM conversion rates



Requirements



You must have:



• Excellent written English (natural, conversational tone)

• Proven sales experience (chat or call closing preferred)

• Customer support experience

• Strong emotional intelligence

• Confidence in persuasion without being aggressive

• Reliable internet connection

• Availability that overlaps with U.S. daytime hours



Bonus points if you:



• Have worked with eCommerce brands

• Understand Instagram culture and buyer psychology

• Have experience inside Meta Business Suite

• Have worked in commission-based roles



Compensation



This is a performance-based role.



• Base Pay: $4–$5 per hour (based on experience)

• Commission: 8–10% of sales generated from your tracked conversations



Hours will begin at 10–20 per week and expand as traffic and sales grow.



High performers will earn increased commission and expanded responsibility.



Growth Path



Top performers can grow into:



• Lead DM Closer

• Sales Team Manager

• Community Growth Lead



We reward performance — not tenure.



How to Apply



Please answer the following:



What sales experience do you have?



Have you ever closed a sale through chat? Describe your process.



How would you respond to:

• “I love it, but it’s too expensive.”

• “I’ll think about it.”

title: On-Call Workshop Assistant Virtual Assistant
description:
We are looking for a dependable and tech-savvy On-Call Workshop Assistant VA to provide flexible support during our student workshops. This role is ideal for someone with strong Virtual Assistant experience who enjoys supporting live sessions, managing details, and stepping in when needed. This position is on-call (up to 10 hours per week) and requires availability between 8:30 AM - 1:00 PM PST.



Key Responsibilities:

Provide live Zoom support during workshops, including admitting participants, managing breakout rooms, and troubleshooting tech issues.

Assist facilitators with workshop logistics and student engagement.

Track attendance and maintain accurate workshop records.

Send out announcements, reminders, and follow-up communications as needed.

Support the main Workshop Virtual Assistant and operations team with tasks as assigned.



Qualifications:

Prior experience as a Virtual Assistant; experience supporting workshops or online classes a plus.

Proficient in Zoom and other online collaboration tools.

Reliable, organized, and detail-oriented with excellent time management skills.

Strong communication skills and a warm, professional demeanor with students, facilitators, and partners.

Flexible and responsive, able to adapt quickly when called on.



Role Type: On-call, up to 10 hours per week. Must be available between 8:30 AM – 1:00 PM PST. Remote position.



How to Apply:

Please send your CV, cover letter, and a short note about your availability to 



Thank you!

title: Doc Drawer (US Mortgage Company | Full-Time | Night Shift | Remote)
description:
Work Setup: 100% Remote (Work From Home)

Schedule: Monday to Friday | Night Shift (U.S. Pacific Time)

Employment Type: Full-Time | Long-Term Position



About the Role



We are a U.S.-based mortgage company looking for a Doc Drawer to join our growing operations team.



Your main responsibility is to prepare and generate accurate loan documents before closing. This is a critical position — errors in documentation can delay loan closings, so we are looking for someone who is highly detail-oriented and reliable.



If you are organized, focused, and serious about building a long-term career in the U.S. mortgage industry, this role is for you.



Fresh graduates are welcome to apply. Applicants with 1–2 years of U.S. mortgage experience are strongly preferred.



Training will be provided to the right candidate.



Key Responsibilities:

> Prepare and generate initial and closing loan documents

> Review loan approvals prior to document generation

> Verify borrower information, loan terms, fees, and rates

> Ensure documents meet compliance and investor guidelines

> Coordinate with processors, underwriters, and closing team

> Maintain internal tracking and documentation accuracy

> Ensure loan packages are complete before release



Qualifications

> Extremely detail-oriented (this is non-negotiable)

> Strong organizational and time management skills

> Good written English communication

> Basic to intermediate skills in Google Workspace or Microsoft Office

> Stable internet connection and quiet home workspace

> Willing to work night shift (PST schedule)

> Able to work independently without constant supervision



Preferred but Not Required

> Experience in U.S. mortgage (doc drawing, processing, closing, underwriting)

> Familiarity with mortgage disclosures and closing documents

> Experience working in a remote setup



What We Offer

> Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)

> Stable, long-term position

> Monday–Friday work only (Weekends off)

> Growth opportunity in the U.S. mortgage industry

> Professional and supportive work environment



>> IMPORTANT APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (READ CAREFULLY)



To be considered:

1. Send your application through OnlineJobs.ph

2. Include a DIRECT LINK to your resume (Google Drive / OneDrive / Dropbox)

3. Make sure the link is set to “Anyone with the link can view”

4. Include the word “DOCREADY” at the top of your application message



Applications without a resume link

Applications without the keyword “DOCREADY”

Resume links that require permission



? Will be automatically rejected.



We only review applicants who follow instructions. Attention to detail starts with your application.

title: Account Manager (Remote)
description:
Job Type: Full-Time | Remote



Experience Level: Entry-Level (preferred 1 yr experience with mortgage broker, real estate, escrow or lending company)



Job Description

Account Managers will work closely with our underwriting team, AE sales team and broker client partners to manage timelines, organize complete and legible documentation and maintain accurate records. This role is ideal for fresh graduates or individuals new to the mortgage industry who are eager to learn and grow.



Key Responsibilities

Assist brokers/loan processors with collecting, reviewing, and organizing borrower documentation

Successfully coordinate with brokers/processors and multiple internal operations departments thru various stages of the loan process from submission to funding

Communicate with brokers, processors and third-party vendors to obtain missing items

Upload and manage files in our loan origination system

Maintain accurate records and ensure compliance with company guidelines

Perform data entry, status updates, and basic administrative tasks

Support communication between the processing, underwriting, and sales teams on current updates and status reviews for the file

· Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

· Excellent written and verbal English communication

· Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment

· Basic proficiency with Google Workspace or Microsoft Office

back up data plan in the event internet connection is down

Work Schedule

title: Human Resources/Medicare Specialist
description:
The Mission:



Here at Davis Capital, we are a high-energy Medicare insurance sales agency looking for a "Swiss Army Knife" HR Specialist! This isn't a traditional sit-behind-a-desk HR role!



We need a partner who can own the onboarding and licensing of our agents while being part of a team that is behind the driving force behind our company culture and online presence!





80% Core Responsibility #1: Onboarding and Integration!



This is your most important task! You are the bridge between a new hire and their first sale!

Rapid Onboarding: Lead the charge in getting new agents hired and integrated into our systems immediately!

Platform Expert: You will be responsible for learning and managing Spark, ensuring all agents are compliant and know how to use the system!



Carrier Partnering: Partner with insurance carriers like Humana and WellCare to lead the charge on contracting and licensing!

Compliance Accuracy: Ensure every agent meets necessary requirements so they can sell without delays!



20% Core Responsibility #2: Culture & Online Advocacy!



You are the heartbeat of the company! You make sure our team is having fun and staying engaged!

Culture Lead: Create a fun, high-energy environment by sending out internal "hype" messages and celebrating wins!

Social Media Advocacy: Work with our online advocates/Social Media Manager on Instagram and
 to showcase our culture and make everything "tick" internally and externally!



Generalist Duties: Handle all standard HR Specialist tasks—from policy compliance to employee questions—acting as the "go-to" for everything HR!



Bonus Responsibilities (Where you can truly lead):



Agent Retention & Recognition: Develop "Agent of the Month" spotlights or milestone celebrations to keep our top producers feeling valued and "sticky" to the agency!

Recruitment Marketing: Help us find more "A-Players" by creating job ads and social content that scream "this is the place to be!"



Proactive Compliance Audits: Don't wait for a problem; proactively monitor licensing and carrier status to ensure no agent ever goes "dark" during peak sales seasons!



Internal Knowledge Base: Create "Cheat Sheets" for new agents on how to navigate the carrier portals, making you the ultimate resource for the team!



Virtual Event Coordination: Organize digital "happy hours," sales competitions, or holiday celebrations to keep our remote culture feeling like a family!



Are you certified in Human Resources? If not, what is your experience? Please only join our family if you can lead and follow.



This is a Leadership role. Not a support role!





Medicare Licensing experience is an advantage.



Systems:

Spark Sunfire

BambooHR

Microsoft Teams/Suite

GoHighLevel



Why Choose Us?

title: Full Time Remote Customer Support Assistant
description:
We are building a distributed support team and are looking for a Customer Support Assistant who takes written communication seriously and values consistency in their work. This is a full-time remote position designed for someone who wants dependable income, clear expectations, and the chance to grow within a structured environment over time.



This role is not project-based or temporary. We are looking for someone who wants stability, is comfortable working set hours, and understands that strong support is built on reliability and attention to detail.



You will spend your workday handling customer conversations through written messages. Your responsibility is to provide clear, accurate, and professional responses while maintaining a friendly tone. You will work within defined guidelines, manage several conversations at the same time, and ensure users receive timely and helpful replies. Part of the role also involves flagging recurring issues, technical problems, or useful feedback so the team can improve processes and systems.

Full onboarding and training are provided before you begin working independently.



This role requires strong written English and a typing speed of at least 60 words per minute. You must have a reliable internet connection of 50-100 Mbps or higher. A dependable laptop or desktop computer with at least 8 GB of RAM is required.



You should be available full-time for a consistent schedule of eight hours per day, six days per week. We value people who are detail-oriented, professional in their communication, dependable in meeting expectations, and open to feedback and improvement.



Previous experience in customer support, chat-based roles, or remote work is helpful but not required.



The hourly pay for this position ranges from 4 to 6 USD, depending on experience and performance.

In addition to base pay, there are performance-based bonuses, regular reviews, and opportunities for raises. Tea
mbers who consistently perform well can grow into higher-responsibility and higher-paying roles over time.



Why Join Us?

You’ll be working remotely in a structured environment with clear systems, training, and expectations. This role is ideal for someone who wants long-term stability rather than short-term gigs, and who values growth through consistent performance.



Apply now by sending us a message with all relevant information mentioned above and we look forward to having you!

title: Project Assistant
description:
Are you great at communicating with others? Are you meticulous and organized? Let’s team up.



We believe in people. This is why we only work with clients who serve people. From firefighters, to law firms, to suppliers sending life-saving food to kids dying of malnutrition, the work you do will help make the world a better place.



Our team is made up of people who want to do the best work of their life. People who love to learn, challenge themselves, grow and have some fun along the journey. We also care about each other – we support each other in our own personal goals and vision. We are human beings before employees and we love to bring out the best in each other.



Now, ready to learn more about this opening? Buckle up.



If you work here, you’ll be:

- Challenged to do the best work of your life in a supportive environment.

- Become the best communicator you can become (this is the most important thing we do).

- Have the space to ask questions, voice your feedback and make a difference (and be yourself).

- Help drive our projects and tools, participate in stimulating conversations, and grow with like-minded people.



What you could be working on:

- Oversight of our fast growth projects and understanding the nuances 

- Communicate status, progress, ensuring "nothing slips through the cracks"

- Build and voice your opinion on key project features

- Communicate and help developers understand various tasks

- Testing new features to ensure it meets project needs

- Research, engaging customers via
/chat, proof reading, copywriting, organizing events, etc



You’ll do well in this job if you:

- Are a master at the English language and care about writing well

- Enjoy using and learning about technology and being helpful

- Enjoy working with people who actually care about what they do and will not let you be lazy or do sloppy work.

- Have an opinion and care about best practices and love learning and creating and building.

- Have grit and determination and are someone who will exceed no matter what gets in your way.

- Are attentive to details.



You probably shouldn’t apply if:

- You’re “just looking for extra money.”

- You like working 5 full-time jobs because all you care about is work.

- You get offended easily and take things personally.

- You are not someone with grit and determination who can persevere while being challenged to do great work.

- You get overwhelmed easily, new habits, new learnings and chat messages.



The interview process:

- Since 99% of our work is done via Slack (we don’t do scheduled calls), the entire interview process will be via
. (With lots of questions, sprinkled with a few voice notes)



If you work here:

- You’ll get 13th month salary, Filipino holidays, unlimited time off (we don’t count sick days), a normal working day schedule (no night shifts, although an early start is preferred for time overlap) with some flexibility, a week off during the holidays in December, and the opportunity to grow and become your best self.



A little more about us:

- We’ve been in business for a decade+. Our teams are remote (mostly in the Philippines). Our longest standing tea
mber has been with us for over 14+ years. We've had people quit smoking on our teams with our help, lose weight, learn a new instrument, speak a new language, and more. We all love what we do.



How to begin

- Your mission, should you choose to accept, is to send us an
 with 3 questions you have about this role. If you’re currently in a full-time role and are looking for something new, we’re open to a transition window. We actually care about your happiness.



NOTE: While we like AI, and we use it in certain circumstances, we ask that no AI be used during communication. Communication is the most important thing we do. If I don't see your natural voice from our first interaction, then you're setting an inaccurate representation of who you are and how you communicate. And when I see that change, it's going to come across as a lack of harmony in how you communicate.

title: AI & Web Optimization Specialist
description:
We are seeking a highly analytical and tech-savvy AI & Web Optimization Specialist to join our team. You will not only optimize website speed and landing page aesthetics but also integrate AI workflows and tools to enhance lead generation and scalability. You will collaborate closely with our SEO, design, and strategy teams to ensure every digital asset is a high-converting machine for our local business clients.



Employment Type & Work Schedule



-Part-Time (20 hours per week)

-Must be available during AST (Atlantic Standard Time) or EST/PST/CST



Compensation



Hourly Rate: USD $4/hour (including fees of chosen payment platform)

Invoice: Contractors are mandated to submit invoices that include their preferred payment channel.

Payment schedule: Bi-weekly payment issued every two (2) weeks upon receipt and approval of an invoice for services rendered.

Contractor responsible for all applicable taxes and statutory obligations



Core Responsibilities



Workflow AI Integration: Optimize marketing workflows and website content using AI to increase output quality and speed.

Website Performance: Audit and improve website speed, mobile responsiveness, and Core Web Vitals.

Landing Page Mastery: Design, test, and refine high-converting landing pages using A/B testing and CRO principles.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with SEO specialists to align site structure with search intent and with designers to maintain brand integrity.

Multi-Client Management: Simultaneously manage and track optimization deliverables for 10+ active local business accounts.

Reporting: Provide clear, data-backed reports on performance improvements and ROI.



AI Optimization Responsibilities



AI-Powered Content: Implement AI-assisted content strategies to improve relevance and searchability.

Lead Gen Automation: Deploy and optimize AI chatbots and virtual assistants to capture and qualify leads 24/7.

Process Automation: Identify and implement AI automations for repetitive web and marketing tasks.

AI Search Optimization: Prepare client web entities for AI-driven discovery platforms (SGE, Perplexity, etc.) through structured data and semantic optimization.



Website & Landing Page Responsibilities



Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO): Conduct deep-dive audits to identify friction points in the user journey.

Funnel Optimization: Streamline the path from landing page arrival to lead submission or purchase.

Technical Health: Ensure all sites are optimized for speed, security, and schema markup.

UX/UI Alignment: Implement design changes that prioritize user experience without compromising marketing goals.



Required Skills & Qualifications



Experience: 2+ years in AI optimization, Web Performance, or a Conversion-focused digital role.

Tech Stack: Expert knowledge of AI tools (ChatGPT Plus, Gemini, Claude) and automation platforms (Zapier/Make).

Web Platforms: Proficiency in WordPress (Elementor, Divi, or similar builders) and landing page tools.

Analytical Skills: Strong ability to interpret Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and Heatmap data (Hotjar/Clarity).

Communication: Ability to explain complex technical optimizations in simple, results-oriented terms.



Tools & Platforms



AI: ChatGPT (Custom GPTs), Gemini, Zapier, Claude.

Web/CRO: WordPress, GTM, Hotjar, Google Optimize (or alternatives).

Analytics: GA4, Google Search Console, PageSpeed Insights.

Project Management: ClickUp, Asana, or Slack.



Technical Requirements (Mandatory)



To maintain our standard of excellence in a remote environment, the following are strictly required:

PC / Laptop Requirements

Operating System: Windows 10+ or MacOS 11+

RAM: 8 GB minimum

Storage Space: At least 250GB or 1TB

Processor: i5 or equivalent (i7+ recommended)

Backup PC/Laptop in case of an issue

Verification: You must provide a screenshot of system specifications.



Internet Requirements

Speed: Minimum 50 Mbps stable internet (Fiber preferred).

Verification: Must submit a recent speed test result screenshot.

Redundancy: Must have a reliable backup internet source (Secondary ISP or mobile hotspot).



Backup & Power Requirements

Hardware: Access to a backup laptop or secondary workstation.

Power Redundancy: UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply), generator, or power station to ensure uptime during local power interruptions.



Backup & Power Requirements:

Hardware: Access to a backup laptop or secondary device.

Power: Must have an electricity backup solution (UPS, generator, or power station) to remain online during local power outages.



Work Environment Expectations



A dedicated, quiet, and professional remote workspace.

Punctuality in virtual meetings and proactive communication via Slack/Email.

Commitment to documenting all AI prompts and web optimization workflows.



We want to know more about you



These questions are designed to assess the candidate’s abilities, technical skills, and ability to deliver excellent results.

- Describe your step-by-step process for optimizing a website using AI tools and web performance best practices.

- Which AI platforms, web analytics, or optimization tools do you use most, and how have they improved your projects’ performance?

- Can you provide an example of a project where you significantly improved website speed, user experience, or conversion rates using AI-driven strategies?

- How do you balance automation via AI with manual optimization to ensure accuracy, relevance, and website quality?

- Explain a challenge you faced while implementing AI or web optimization solutions remotely, and how you resolved it.



How to apply



To be considered for this role, please submit the following requirements in full:

- Answer the five (5) screening questions listed in the “We Want to Know More About You” section.

- Confirmation of your ability to work 20 hours/week during AST/EST business hours.

- Complete an internet speed test and provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your results that can be viewed by anyone with the link.

- Provide a shareable link to a screenshot of your PC or laptop specifications with viewers’ access enabled.

- Submit a Portfolio via a shareable link; Examples or case studies showing AI integration, landing page builds, or conversion lifts that can be accessed by anyone with the link.

- Include your CV/resume (PDF format) through a shareable link with viewers’ access enabled.

- Record a 2–3 minute self-introduction video via Loom discussing your previous job roles, industries you’ve worked in, key career highlights, Innovations, why you are the best candidate for this role, and how do you d
 which tasks to automate versus which tasks require manual oversight—and why. Provide a shareable Loom link that can be viewed by anyone.





Incomplete applications or submissions without proper shareable links will not be reviewed.

title: Lead Generation - Cold Caller
description:
We are looking for a reliable outbound cold caller to support our sales team. This is a long-term, hourly role focused on cold calling, qualifying leads, and booking meetings. Your primary goal will be to engage decision-makers, introduce our services, and set up follow-up appointments for our sales team. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a persuasive demeanor, and the ability to handle objections effectively. Experience in lead generation or sales is a plus. If you're motivated to help us grow our client base, we want to hear from you!



Responsibilities:

- Make outbound cold calls to businesses (call lists provided)

- Follow a provided call script

- Ask qualifying questions

- Book qualified meetings or pass warm leads

- Log all call activity in our CRM



What we provide:

- Call scripts and training

- Lead lists

- Clear daily call targets

- Ongoing work (not a short-term project)

- $4–9/hour USD to start (based on experience) + performance bonuses after onboarding



Requirements:

- Previous cold calling or outbound sales experience

- Clear spoken English

- Comfortable making 75–100+ calls/day

- Reliable internet and quiet calling environment

- Available during U.S. business hours



To apply:

1. What experience do you have with cold calling and how many calls per day are you comfortable making?

2. When making calls, do you prefer following a script or improvising? Explain why.

3. What CRM or dialer software have you used before? Rate your comfort level from 1–5.

4. A link to a short video/voice recording introducing yourself and explaining why you’re comfortable with cold calling would be greatly appreciated and encouraged to be considered for this role.

title: Virtual Receptionist VA (Remote) | Fast Hiring – 24-Hour Review
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Senior AI Video Editor & Creative Leader
description:
Senior AI Video Editor & Creative Leader



Full-Time | AI Marketing Division



(EXAMPLE OF OUR CURRENT CONTENT EDITS - 





We’re not looking for another editor.

We’re looking for a leader in AI creative production.



Someone who wants to be at the forefront of hyper-realistic AI advertising.

Someone who doesn’t follow trends — they help shape them.

title: Automotive Technical Support Specialist (Classic Car Parts)
description:
???? AUTOMOTIVE TECHNICAL SUPPORT SPECIALIST

Classic Car Parts | US E-Commerce Company | Direct Hire | Long-Term



?? READ THIS FIRST — THIS IS NOT A TYPICAL CUSTOMER SERVICE JOB ??



We specialize in weatherstripping, rubber seals, and restoration parts 

for classic and vintage American cars — Mustangs, Camaros, Chevelles, 

Impalas, C10s, and hundreds more. Our catalog includes door seals, 

trunk seals, roof rail weatherstripping, window seals, and a rapidly 

growing selection of all types of classic car restoration parts — 

over 100,000 unique SKUs and counting.



Our customers are restoration shops, classic car dealers, and diehard 

car enthusiasts across the US.



When they call, they don't ask "where's my package?" — they ask:

"I installed new door seals on my '69 Camaro and now the doors are 

so hard to close I have to slam them — what's going on?" or "My trunk 

seal isn't sitting right in the corners and I'm getting water in the 

trunk — did I get the wrong part?"



(We also have a few smaller side brands — eBikes, motorcycle parts, 

car decals, hobby parts, and a publishing company — but those are only 

5-10% of your work and are simple customer service. If you can handle 

the car parts, you can handle anything.)



If you have NO IDEA what a door seal bulb is or why orientation 

matters when installing weatherstripping, this job is not for you.

If reading that made you curious (or excited), keep reading.



========================================

WHO SHOULD APPLY (and who should NOT)

========================================



? APPLY if you:

- Are a car guy/car girl — you wrench on cars, watch car builds, 

  or grew up around someone who does

- Have worked in an auto parts store, repair shop, dealership, 

  or automotive call center

- Can hold a real, unscripted phone conversation in English with 

  American customers for 8 hours a day — not just read a script

- Understand what fitment means and why year/make/model matters

- Can troubleshoot a customer's installation problem over the phone 

  using common sense, product knowledge, and the right questions

- Actually ENJOY talking to people on the phone



? DO NOT APPLY if you:

- Have never worked with cars, car parts, or automotive customers

- Are only comfortable on chat and
 (this role is 50%+ phone)

- Struggle with unscripted, fast-paced English phone conversations

- Are looking for a basic VA or data entry role

- Don't know the difference between a disc brake and a drum brake



========================================

COMPENSATION

========================================

- Base: $900–$1,100 USD/month (depending on automotive experience)

- 13th Month Pay: Yes

- Paid Time Off: 10 days/year

- Performance Bonus: Available after 6 months based on metrics

- Payment: Weekly via Wise or PayPal



We pay at the top of the range for people who bring real 

automotive knowledge. If you've worked in auto parts and are 

great on the phone, we'll pay for that.



========================================

SCHEDULE

========================================

- Monday–Friday, 8:00 AM – 4:30 PM US Central Time

  (That's 9:00 PM – 5:30 AM Manila Time)

- Fixed schedule, no rotating shifts



- 100% Work From Home

- Must be based in the Philippines



========================================

ABOUT US

========================================

We're a US-based company running several niche e-commerce brands. Our 

CORE business — and 90-95% of your workload — is classic and vintage 

American car parts. We carry one of the deepest selections of 

weatherstripping, rubber seals, and restoration parts in the industry, 

and our catalog is expanding rapidly into all types of classic car 

parts — mechanical, electrical, trim, body, and more.



We've been in this industry for decades. Our customers are restoration 

shops, classic car dealers, and everyday car enthusiasts across the US 

who are passionate about keeping these vehicles on the road.



A huge part of this role is helping customers select the right 

weatherstripping and seals for their specific car, and then 

troubleshooting installation issues over the phone. Customers will 

call with problems like:

- "I glued on my door seals and they're pulling away overnight"

- "My trunk lid won't latch after I installed the new trunk seal"

- "The roof rail weatherstrip won't sit right in the channel"

- "Which adhesive should I be using for my door seals?"



You need to be the person who can calmly walk them through it.



WE ALSO RUN A FEW SMALLER BRANDS (5-10% of your workload):

? eBike, motorized bike & motorcycle parts (if you know cars, 

  you can handle this)

? Car graphic decals (same car-world customers)

? A paranormal nonfiction publishing company

? Hobby parts



These side brands are MUCH simpler — mostly "where's my order?" and 

"how do I return this?" type questions. No deep technical knowledge 

needed. Think of it as a mental break between the challenging car 

parts calls.



If you can handle the classic car parts work, the rest is easy.



This role is critical to our operation — you'll be the voice our 

customers hear and the person they trust for answers. Because of 

that, our screening process is thorough. We want to make sure this 

is a great fit for both sides.



========================================

WHAT A TYPICAL DAY LOOKS LIKE

========================================



? Check overnight
s and tickets from customers

? Answer inbound call: "I need a complete weatherstrip kit for a 

  '72 Chevelle Malibu 2-door hardtop — what all comes in the kit?"

? Troubleshoot: "I installed the door seals on my '68 Mustang and 

  now the doors won't close without slamming them. Is the seal 

  too thick or did I do something wrong?"

? Walk a customer through proper seal orientation — his trunk seal 

  is installed backwards and that's why it's not seating right

? Help a restoration shop figure out which roof rail weatherstrip 

  they need for a '70 Chevelle — hardtop vs. convertible

? Process a return: customer ordered the wrong trunk seal — verify 

  his year/make/model and help him get the correct one

? Advise a first-time restorer on the right adhesive for his 

  door seals — he used silicone instead of contact cement and 

  everything is peeling off

? Take a phone order from a repeat customer who needs window 

  seals, a firewall pad, and a set of bumper guards

? Answer a customer
 about a paranormal book shipping date

? Help someone pick the right decal size for their car

? Process a return on a hobby parts order

? Answer a basic question about an eBike battery or motorcycle part



The weatherstripping and seal calls are the challenging, rewarding 

core of the work. The side brand questions are quick and simple — 

they break up the day.



========================================

WHAT YOU'LL DO

========================================



TECHNICAL CUSTOMER SUPPORT — CLASSIC CAR PARTS (90-95%):

- Handle ~40–60 customer interactions/day (phone,
, chat)

- Answer inbound phone calls — order questions, fitment verification, 

  installation troubleshooting, returns

- Help customers identify the correct weatherstripping, seals, and 

  parts using year/make/model, body style, and part numbers across 

  our 100,000+ SKU catalog

- Troubleshoot installation issues over the phone — door seals, 

  trunk seals, roof rail weatherstripping, window seals, and a 

  growing range of all types of classic car restoration parts

- Advise customers on proper installation techniques, adhesives, 

  surface prep, and seal orientation

- Process returns and exchanges — determine root cause (wrong part 

  for their application, installation error, or defective product)

- Take orders over the phone



ADDITIONAL BRAND SUPPORT (5-10% of volume):

- Handle basic customer service 
, occasional phone) for our 

  other brands: eBike/motorcycle parts, car graphic decals, hobby 

  parts, and a paranormal nonfiction publishing company

- These are straightforward order support questions — no technical 

  troubleshooting needed

- We provide simple FAQ docs and response templates for these brands



========================================

REQUIREMENTS

========================================



???? MUST HAVE (Non-Negotiable):



- AUTOMOTIVE KNOWLEDGE: You must have hands-on experience or working 

  knowledge of cars and car parts. You understand what year/make/model 

  fitment means. You know basic automotive terminology (not just from 

  Google — from experience). Acceptable backgrounds:

    • Worked in an auto parts store or counter

    • Worked in a repair shop, dealership, or body shop

    • Automotive call center or technical support experience

    • Serious car hobbyist/enthusiast who works on their own vehicles

    • Automotive technology or mechanic vocational graduate



- PHONE FLUENCY (Real, Not Rehearsed): You must be able to carry 

  natural, unscripted English conversations on the phone for hours 

  at a time. This means:

    • You can think on your feet and respond naturally — not read 

      from a script

    • You can handle frustrated customers calmly and professionally

    • American customers can understand you clearly without asking 

      you to repeat yourself constantly

    • You can explain technical concepts in simple terms

    • You've done this professionally before (call center, phone 

      support, phone sales — at least 2 years)



- TROUBLESHOOTING ABILITY: When a customer says "I installed this 

  seal and it's not right," you don't panic. You ask the right 

  questions: What's the year/make/model? Which seal did they install? 

  Is the bulb facing the right direction? Did they prep the surface 

  and use the right adhesive? Can they send a photo? You use logic 

  and product knowledge to solve the problem.



- Reliable internet: minimum 25 Mbps (test at 
 before applying)

- Quiet, dedicated home office for phone calls (no background noise)

- Own computer with quality headset (noise-canceling preferred)

- Available to work US Central Time hours (night shift PH time)



???? STRONG PLUS:

- Any sales or lead generation experience (relevant for advancement)

- Classic car knowledge specifically (American muscle cars, hot rods, 

  vintage imports)

- Experience with or knowledge of weatherstripping, rubber seals, 

  or body/trim restoration

- Experience with help desk software, ERP, or inventory systems

- TESDA automotive certification or related vocational training



========================================

WHAT WE'LL DEVELOP TOGETHER

========================================

You're bringing the automotive foundation and the phone skills. 

We'll build on that with:

- Deep training on our specific product catalog (100,000+ SKUs — 

  we know that takes time, and we're patient with the right person)

- Hands-on knowledge of weatherstripping types, fitment, 

  installation best practices, and common troubleshooting scenarios

- Our internal systems (help desk, VoIP, ERP)

- Our customer base and industry relationships

- Quick orientation on our side brands (eBike parts, decals, 

  publishing, hobby parts) — these are simple and you'll pick 

  them up fast



========================================

TOOLS YOU'LL USE

========================================

- Help desk software (customer tickets and
)

- VoIP phone system (calls through your computer — you'll be on 

  this A LOT)

- ERP/accounting system (orders, quotes, inventory lookup)

- Google Workspace 
, sheets, docs)



========================================

GROWTH & ADVANCEMENT

========================================

This isn't a dead-end role. We're a growing company and we reward 

people who perform.



Here's what growth looks like:

- MASTER THE ROLE: Become the go-to expert our customers trust. 

  Build deep product knowledge across our catalog.

- EARN MORE: As you prove yourself, we expand your responsibilities 

  — and your compensation grows with them. Top performers who take 

  on higher-level work earn significantly more.

- ADVANCE: There are real opportunities to move into higher-paying 

  roles with more responsibility as the business grows. We promote 

  from within.



We're not looking for someone to fill a seat for 6 months. We want 

someone who wants to build a career with us — and we'll invest in 

the right person.



========================================

OUR HIRING PROCESS (Read This Carefully)

========================================



This role demands real automotive knowledge and real phone skills — 

not everyone has both. Our process is designed to find the person 

who does. If that's you, this will be easy.



STEP 1: APPLICATION (below)

- Submit your resume and cover letter

- Complete the 5-question automotive knowledge quiz (below)

- Record and submit your video application (details below)

- You MUST include the word IGNITION somewhere in your cover 

  letter to confirm you read this entire posting



STEP 2: REVIEW & WRITTEN ASSESSMENT

- We review applications and quiz scores

- Top candidates receive a short written assessment: a customer 

 
 scenario where you must help a customer identify the 

  right seal for their car and troubleshoot an installation issue



STEP 3: LIVE PHONE ROLEPLAY (This Is the Real Test)

- We will call you unannounced (within a scheduled window) 

  and roleplay a real customer call scenario:

    ? "Hey, I just installed new door weatherstripping on my 

      1970 Chevelle and the doors are really hard to close now. 

      I have to basically slam them shut. I followed the 

      instructions but something's not right. Can you help?"

- We're evaluating: Can you think on your feet? Do you ask 

  smart diagnostic questions? (Did you prep the surface? What 

  adhesive did you use? Is the seal oriented correctly? Have you 

  tried adjusting the striker?) Are you calm and professional? 

  Can we understand you clearly? Do you sound like someone our 

  customers would trust?



STEP 4: OFFER & PAID TRIAL WEEK

- Start with a paid 1-week trial at full rate

- If we both agree it's a good fit, you're hired permanently



========================================

WHY WORK WITH US

========================================

- DIRECT HIRE: Work with us directly — no agency, no middleman

- STABILITY: We want someone for years, not months. Our business 

  has been running for decades.

- WEEKLY PAY: Get paid every week — no waiting around

- INTERESTING WORK: Classic cars have one of the most passionate, 

  fun communities in the world. You'll talk to people who LOVE 

  what they do.

- VARIETY: Our side brands keep things interesting — one minute 

  you're troubleshooting a Camaro door seal, the next you're 

  helping someone with an eBike order or a book shipment

- REAL ADVANCEMENT: This role has a clear path to higher-paying 

  responsibilities. We promote from within and reward performance.

- YOU MATTER: You won't be ticket #4,782. You'll be a core 

  member of a small team where your work directly impacts 

  the business.



========================================

HOW TO APPLY

========================================



>>> ALL 4 ITEMS REQUIRED — Incomplete applications will NOT 

    be reviewed:



1. RESUME with your relevant automotive and phone-based 

   customer service experience highlighted



2. COVER LETTER that answers:

   - What is your automotive background? (work, hobby, education)

   - Describe a time you troubleshot a technical problem for a 

     customer over the phone — what was the issue and how did 

     you resolve it?

   - Why does this role interest you specifically?

   - (Remember: include the word IGNITION in your cover letter)



3. AUTOMOTIVE KNOWLEDGE QUIZ — Answer these 5 questions 

   in your application:



   Q1: A customer calls and says: "I just installed new door 

       weatherstripping on my '69 Camaro and now the doors won't 

       close without slamming them. What's wrong?"

       Name at least 2 possible causes you would walk them 

       through.



   Q2: A customer says: "I glued my trunk seal on last night 

       and this morning it's already pulling away from the 

       channel." What questions would you ask to figure out 

       what went wrong?



   Q3: What does it mean when we say a weatherstrip seal is 

       installed with the wrong "orientation"? Why does it 

       matter?



   Q4: A customer needs weatherstripping for his 1970 Chevelle. 

       What information do you need from him before you can look 

       up the right parts? (List as many as you can think of.)



   Q5: What does "fitment" mean when we're talking about car 

       parts, and why is it so important for weatherstripping 

       specifically?



4. VIDEO APPLICATION (2–3 minutes max):

   Part A: Pick any classic car (any year, any make) and tell 

   us about it — what you know about it, why you like it, or 

   an interesting fact. We want to see that you can talk about 

   cars naturally and with some passion.

   

   Part B: Pretend you're on the phone with a frustrated 

   customer who says: "I installed a new roof rail seal on my 

   1967 Mustang and it's leaking when it rains. Water is 

   dripping inside right above the door. I used the adhesive 

   that was recommended but the seal just doesn't seem to be 

   sitting right in the channel. What do I do?" 

   — Talk us through how you'd handle this call. What questions 

   would you ask? How would you troubleshoot it?



   Upload to YouTube (unlisted), Google Drive, or Loom and 

   include the link.



========================================

APPLY POINTS: Use exactly 8 Apply Points on your application.

========================================

title: Project Coordinator
description:
Hi !



Before reading further, please watch this short message from our Founder, Raitis:





Important: Applications without a video submission will not be reviewed. Please read all the way through for instructions.



About Us

We are Thrive Courses Studio, a course creation company based in Oakland, CA. We help experts, coaches, authors, speakers, and entrepreneurs turn their knowledge into high-quality online courses that actually sell.



Our work sits at the intersection of creativity and execution. We manage a lot of moving pieces, multiple clients, and high standards. That’s where this role comes in.



Meet our team:





The Role

We are hiring a Project Coordinator to help manage our online course productions from start to finish.



This role starts part-time, with very flexible hours, and has a clear path to full-time for the right person. We are remote-first and results-focused. We care far more about things getting done well than about clocking hours.



You will be the connective tissue between clients, creatives, and internal systems. When you do your job well, projects move smoothly and clients feel supported, informed, and calm.



This Role Is a Great Fit If You:



Are highly organized and detail-oriented

Communicate clearly and follow through

Stay calm when things get busy

Enjoy bringing structure to creative work

Are comfortable working remotely and independently

Like owning outcomes, not just completing tasks

Experience as a project coordinator is helpful but not required. The right person will be trained.



This Role Is NOT a Good Fit If You:



Dislike working on a computer or being on video calls

Avoid responsibility or decision-making

Need constant supervision

Get easily overwhelmed by multiple moving pieces

Prefer routine over variety

We want to be clear and respectful of your time and ours.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



Planning and managing project schedules

Coordinating tea
mbers to keep projects on track

Leading client onboarding and check-in calls (primarily via Zoom)

Communicating with clients to define scope, requirements, and next steps

Managing and organizing video files

Quality control across deliverables

Collaborating with marketing, sales, and video editing teams

We use clear systems, tools, and processes to support you. This is not a “figure it out alone” environment.



What We Value



Ownership and accountability

Clear communication

Attention to detail

Integrity and follow-through

A growth mindset

You’ll have the opportunity to learn directly from the founder and our team, grow your skills, and potentially travel to retreats and events. We actively invest in people who take ownership and want to grow.



Compensation



This is a full-time role with competitive compensation and a clear path to a performance-based pay increase.



How to Apply



To apply, please submit a 2–4 minute video answering these two question:



1) Why would you be a good fit for this role?



2) What is the secret to getting things done?



We are not looking for a Hollywood-level production. A simple phone or laptop video is perfectly fine.



You can record your video using a free tool like Loom and include the link in your application or cover letter.



Applications without a video will not be reviewed.



Thank you for your interest. We’re excited to meet people who are eager to build something meaningful with us.



Schedule:

Choose your own hours

Work Location: Remote

title: Property Manager
description:
Job description

About Us:

We are a small, family-run business managing 8 commercial properties with approximately 140 tenants. We are committed to providing exceptional property management services and fostering strong tenant relationships.



Position Summary:

We are seeking a dedicated Property Manager with 5+ years of experience in commercial real estate to oversee the daily operations of our properties. The ideal candidate will excel at managing tenant relationships and maintaining property standards.



Key Responsibilities:



-Assist all aspects of assigned commercial properties.

-Advertise and fill vacancies through effective marketing strategies.

-Screen tenants and negotiate leases.

-Address maintenance issues promptly.

-Enforce lease agreements and resolve tenant disputes professionally.

-Process accounts receivable and assist with accounts payable.

-Stay updated on market trends, rental rates, and legal requirements.

-Assist in creating site plans as needed.

-Processing 3 day notices and communicating with legal.



Qualifications:



-Minimum 5 years of property management experience in commercial/residential real estate.

-Proficiency in QuickBooks and Yardi property management software.

-Strong understanding of Fair Housing regulations, property maintenance practices, and legal administrative procedures.

-Excellent skills in conflict resolution and customer service.

-Detail-oriented with data entry accuracy and efficiency.

-Experience creating site plans is an advantage.

-Bilingual in Spanish is highly preferred.



Hours may be adjusted to full time if needed. Starting at $5.00 per hour with room to grow.

title: Tax Preparer / Bookkeeper
description:
Company: Core Mind Technology

Employment Type: Full-Time

Work Setup: Remote

Schedule: US Hours



About the Role

Core Mind Technology is seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Tax Preparer / Bookkeeper to manage internal financial operations and support scalable financial systems.



This role ensures clean books, organized reporting, tax support preparation, and smooth coordination between operations leadership and external tax professionals (CPAs/accountants).



This is a systems-focused role, not simple data entry. We are building structured financial workflows that integrate with automation tools, payment processors, and internal reporting dashboards.





Company & Team Structure

This role operates under Core Mind Technology and supports:

- Internal finance operations

- AI automation product divisions

- Digital service divisions

- Leadership-level reporting and financial visibility

You will work directly with operations leadership and coordinate with external accountants/CPAs when needed.





Responsibilities

You will be responsible for:

- Managing and reconciling bookkeeping records

- Categorizing expenses accurately and consistently

- Preparing monthly financial reports (P&L, cash flow summaries, reporting dashboards)

- Reconciling Stripe and other payment platforms

- Supporting tax preparation by organizing documentation and financial records

- Tracking contractor payments, obligations, and financial commitments

- Assisting with payroll bookkeeping coordination (as needed)

- Maintaining clean and organized financial records for compliance readiness

- Helping improve finance SOPs, documentation, and internal workflows

- Supporting audit-readiness and structured reporting systems





Tools & Workflow

You may use tools such as:

- QuickBooks (preferred)

- Google Sheets / Excel

- Stripe

- 
 (contracts + payments)

- Slack / Zoom

- Internal dashboards

- Qwilr





What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for someone who:

- Has 2+ years of bookkeeping experience

- Understands tax categorization, financial reporting, and reconciliation workflows

- Is highly detail-oriented and consistent

- Can work independently without micromanagement

- Is organized, deadline-driven, and reliable

- Communicates clearly and professionally in async environments





Compensation (PECP Model)

Starting Base Rate: $4.50–$7.50/hour (based on experience + work completion)

Payout Schedule: Bi-weekly

Performance Bonuses Available Based On:

- On-time monthly closing

- Accuracy (minimal corrections required)

- Reporting efficiency and clarity

- Process improvements introduced

- Audit-readiness quality



High performers may be eligible for:

- Compensation increases

- Expanded financial oversight responsibilities

- Long-term finance leadership growth track





Ideal For

This role is ideal for:

- Experienced bookkeepers

- Startup finance professionals

- Remote finance specialists

- Detail-oriented accounting professionals seeking long-term growth





How to Apply

Send:

- Resume

- A short summary of bookkeeping + tax experience

- Tools you’ve used

- One example of a monthly reporting workflow you’ve managed

title: Mid-Level AI Automation Engineer (Remote, US Hours)
description:
Company: Core Mind Technology (AI Adoption Partners)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Work Setup: Remote

Schedule: US Hours



About the Role

Core Mind Technology is hiring 3–4 Mid-Level AI Automation Engineers to help build and deploy production-level automation systems for clients and internal products.



This is a builder role, not research-only. You’ll work directly under our AI Team Lead and support the development of scalable AI workflows involving:

- AI voice assistants

- Web scraping systems

- API integrations

- Payment automation

- CRM automations

- Internal SaaS tool development



We’re looking for someone who can independently implement 70–80% of a system, and collaborate with senior leadership for architecture decisions and final production hardening.





Team & Company Structure

You’ll work inside Core Mind Technology’s AI Division.

- Operational reporting: COO

- Technical support: Senior Developers

- Cross-functional collaboration with:

- AI Internship Program participants

- Operations leadership

- Sales & automation teams





Role Type

This position is:

- Full-Time

- Execution-heavy

- Automation-driven

- Build-focused





Responsibilities

In this role, you will:

- Build end-to-end n8n automation workflows (production-ready)

- Integrate APIs including Stripe, Google APIs, CRMs, webhooks, and internal services

- Develop webhook systems, data pipelines, and workflow logic

- Assist in deploying AI agents (voice + chat systems)

- Troubleshoot authentication, integration errors, and automation failures

- Document automation systems clearly for handoff and scaling

- Improve system stability, performance, and reliability

- Support scaling internal AI products and tools

- Contribute to basic UI/UX for internal SaaS tools when needed





Required Skills

You should have:

- Strong experience with n8n / Zapier / Make

- Confidence working with APIs, webhooks, and authentication flows

- Ability to debug integration issues independently

- Strong logical thinking and structured problem solving

- Clear async communication and good documentation habits

- 1–2 years of AI automation experience

- Experience with VAPI or similar voice AI tools





Preferred Skills

Nice to have (but not required):

- Master agent creation and multi-agent workflows

- Web scraping experience

- Experience deploying automation systems in production environments

- Familiarity with uptime monitoring, retries, and workflow resilience





Compensation (PECP Model)

Starting Base Rate: $4.75–$6.00/hour (based on experience + work completion)

Payout Schedule: Bi-weekly

Performance Bonuses Based On:

- Successful deployment of automation projects

- System reliability and uptime

- Speed of implementation

- Reduction of manual work hours

- Contributions to product scalability





Growth Track

This role has a clear long-term path:

Mid-Level ? Senior AI Engineer ? AI Team Lead ? Director of AI Development

Top performers may be eligible for:

- Compensation increases

- Revenue-share discussions

- Leadership responsibilities





Ideal For

This role is ideal for engineers who:

- Enjoy building real AI systems (not just prototypes)

- Like solving messy workflow problems

- Want long-term growth in AI infrastructure and automation

- Prefer execution and ownership over constant meetings





How to Apply

Send the following:

- Resume

- A short description of automation systems you’ve built

- Tools you’re strongest in

- One example of an API integration you’ve implemented

title: AI Automation Internship Program (Remote – US Hours)
description:
Company: Core Mind Technology

Employment Type: Internship

Work Setup: Remote

Schedule: US Hours





About the Internship

Core Mind Technology is offering a hands-on AI Automation Builder Internship designed for individuals who want real-world experience building automation systems used in production environments. This is not a passive internship.





Interns contribute directly to live automation projects inside our AI Division. You will research, build, test, and document automation systems that support real operational workflows. Top-performing interns may be offered long-term roles within the company.





Company Structure

Interns operate within the AI Division under Core Mind Technology.

You will collaborate with:

- Mid-Level Automation Engineers

- Senior AI Team Lead

- Operations Leadership

This structure ensures you receive both technical exposure and practical business insight.





Internship Type

- Remote

- Task-Based

- Performance-Driven

- Execution-Focused

title: Clinical Enrollment Specialist (Patient Onboarding)
description:
About Total Life

Total Life is a mission-based organization dedicated to providing therapy to older adults—a group that is often overlooked by the healthcare system. Our purpose is to fill the gap for Medicare-covered mental health services, making them truly affordable and accessible for one of our most vulnerable populations.

We act as the administrative engine for our therapists, handling the heavy lifting of credentialing, billing, and insurance so they can focus entirely on clinical work. We run a tight ship, driven by data and punctuality, to ensure the physicians who trust us with their patients receive the highest standard of care coordination.



The Role

We are looking for a high-energy, persuasive communicator to join us as a Clinical Enrollment Specialist. This is a sales-driven role that requires a unique blend of "Closing Power" and "Deep Empathy." You aren't just an order-taker; you are a consultant and advocate.

Your primary goal is to convert inbound leads and referrals into booked clinical appointments. You will be responsible for moving hesitant seniors through the funnel by overcoming objections, building immediate trust over the phone, and ensuring they are technologically and emotionally ready for their first session.



Key Responsibilities

Actively manage a pipeline of patient referrals, reaching out via phone, text, and
 to secure booked appointments.

Use persuasive communication to address common hurdles (e.g., "I don’t need therapy," "I’m not good with computers," or "I'm worried about the cost").

Ensure every inquiry is contacted within 15 minutes of submission to maximize conversion rates.

Clearly articulate how Medicare covers our services, helping seniors understand that high-quality care is accessible and often $0 out-of-pocket.

Maintain 100?ta accuracy in the CRM, moving "Deals" from inquiry to "Scheduled" while logging every interaction.

Patiently walk seniors through the telehealth platform, troubleshooting audio/video issues to ensure a seamless first appointment.

Analyze patient needs and therapist specialties to ensure a high-quality clinical pairing that encourages long-term retention.

Execute proactive reminder calls and "warm-up" sequences to ensure patients feel committed to showing up for their scheduled sessions.

Identify common "drop-off" points in the enrollment process and work with the team to refine the sales script and onboarding flow.

Work closely with the clinical team to manage therapist availability and fill gaps in the schedule in real-time.



Requirements

You have a track record of meeting or exceeding targets in a sales, enrollment, or high-volume outreach environment.

You can build instant rapport with older adults, speaking with the clarity and warmth required for this demographic.

You are comfortable working in a CRM-driven environment, managing tasks, and analyzing your own conversion data.

You are technically proficient enough to troubleshoot browser permissions and mic settings for others over the phone.

You believe that mental health care is a right for seniors and are driven to help them overcome the barriers to getting it.



Compensation

$600 a month 

Paid via Wise or similar international payment platform

Long-term opportunity with growth potential

Performance bonuses may be available based on referrals generated



What We Value

Reliability and consistency

Professional communication

Confidence without being aggressive

Strong follow-up skills

Ability to hit daily call targets



Work Schedule

Monday to Friday

Between 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM EST (US Time)

Must be available for 8 hours a day during these hours



How to Apply

Please submit your resume along with a Loom video (under 3 mins) showing:

How you would handle a senior saying: "I've made it 80 years without therapy, I don't think I need to start now."

A brief summary of your most successful "sales" or "enrollment" win.

Why the Total Life mission resonates with you

title: Scheduling Assistant
description:
## Job Title: Nurse Home Visit Scheduler / Adult Foster Care (AFC) Scheduling Coordinator



## Company



**OMNISTARR** – Healthcare Staffing Agency (Massachusetts)



## Location



**Massachusetts (Remote/Hybrid as applicable)**





## Employment Type



Full-time (or Part-time, depending on business need)



---



## Position Summary



OMNISTARR is seeking a highly organized and patient-focused **Nurse Home Visit Scheduler** to coordinate and schedule **in-home nursing visits** for members enrolled in Massachusetts **Adult Foster Care (AFC)** programs. In this role, you will contact the **caregiver and/or member**, confirm availability, and **schedule required nursing visits in the system** while ensuring timely completion and compliance with MassHealth program expectations (including required visit cadence and admission timelines). ([Massachusetts Government][1])



This position is ideal for someone who is confident on the phone, detail-oriented, comfortable working with sensitive health information, and experienced with scheduling in a fast-paced healthcare environment.



---



## Key Responsibilities



### Scheduling & Coordination



* Schedule **RN/LPN in-home visits** for AFC members across Massachusetts, coordinating directly with **caregivers** to identify appropriate dates/times and confirm the visit location.

* Ensure **required nursing visits** are scheduled on time—commonly **every other month onsite** (or more frequently if clinically necessary), coordinated to alternate with care management visits so members receive a monthly touchpoint as applicable. ([Massachusetts Government][1])

* Coordinate **admission/initial visit scheduling**, helping ensure nursing participation is completed within required timeframes when applicable. ([Massachusetts Government][1])

* Communicate scheduled visit details to field nurses (address, caregiver contact, member notes needed for the visit, special instructions such as parking/access, pets, language needs).



### Caregiver/Member Communication



* Call caregivers/members professionally and compassionately to:



  * confirm availability and best contact method

  * verify address and visit readiness (home access, safety considerations)

  * provide appointment reminders and reduce no-shows

* Handle cancellations/reschedules quickly while maintaining compliance with visit requirements.

* Escalate urgent concerns reported by caregivers/members (e.g., clinical changes, safety issues, missed medications) to the clinical team per OMNISTARR protocol.



### Documentation & System Updates



* Enter and maintain accurate scheduling information in the designated scheduling platform/system (appointments, reschedules, notes, confirmations).

* Maintain clean, audit-ready scheduling records that align with program and internal documentation expectations (including supporting workflows tied to required visits). ([Massachusetts Government][2])

* Support visit tracking and operational reporting (scheduled vs. completed visits, missed visits, nurse coverage needs, upcoming due visits).



### Collaboration & Coverage Management



* Coordinate with OMNISTARR nursing staff and AFC agency partners to manage territories, nurse availability, and coverage gaps.

* Support the multidisciplinary nature of AFC services by communicating effectively with clinical staff and care management partners as needed. ([Massachusetts Government][3])

* Assist with schedule optimization to reduce travel burden and improve consistency for members/caregivers.



### Compliance & Confidentiality



* Handle Protected Health Information (PHI) in accordance with **HIPAA** and OMNISTARR policies.

* Follow MassHealth/AFC guidance and internal SOPs when scheduling, documenting, and communicating member-related information. ([Massachusetts Government][4])



---



## Required Qualifications



* High school diploma or equivalent (Associate’s degree preferred).

* 1+ year experience in **healthcare scheduling**, coordination, call center patient scheduling, home health operations, or similar role.

* Strong phone communication skills and professional etiquette (comfortable calling caregivers daily).

* Strong attention to detail and ability to manage high volume scheduling with accuracy.

* Comfort using scheduling software, EHR/EMR systems, Microsoft Office/Google Workspace.

* Ability to maintain confidentiality and work with sensitive health-related information.



---



## Preferred Qualifications



* Experience supporting **home health**, **community-based services**, **long-term services and supports (LTSS)**, or **MassHealth** populations.

* Familiarity with Massachusetts **Adult Foster Care (AFC)** or related programs. ([Massachusetts Government][4])

* Bilingual skills (Spanish, Portuguese, Haitian Creole, etc.) strongly preferred.

* Experience coordinating field staff schedules across multiple territories.



---



## Key Skills & Competencies



* Excellent organization, time management, and follow-through

* Calm, empathetic communication style with caregivers and families

* Problem-solving mindset (last-minute changes, coverage gaps, urgent reschedules)

* Ability to prioritize due/overdue visits and manage competing deadlines

* Team-oriented and dependable



---



## About OMNISTARR



**OMNISTARR is a healthcare staffing agency** that supports Massachusetts healthcare providers by recruiting and placing qualified clinicians—including nurses who conduct **in-home visits** for Adult Foster Care agencies across the state. OMNISTARR partners with care teams to help ensure members receive timely nursing oversight in the community. ([Home Care Alliance of Massachusetts][5])



**Adult Foster Care (AFC)** is a MassHealth-funded program in Massachusetts that supports eligible adults who live with a caregiver in a qualified home setting and receive assistance with daily living needs, along with clinical oversight and care management. ([Massachusetts Government][4])



---

title: Patient Scheduling Assistant
description:
About Us:

We are a dedicated healthcare staffing provider, committed to supporting government programs by offering compassionate and reliable nursing  teams. Our mission is to ensure the elderly patients in these programs receive consistent, high-quality support through timely and well-coordinated visits by our Registered Nurses (RNs) and Case Managers (CMs).



Position Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and compassionate Scheduling Assistant to coordinate and manage visit schedules for our clients and their patients. This role is crucial in ensuring seamless communication between our care team, clients, and the elderly patients we serve.



Key Responsibilities:

• Coordinate and schedule initial, monthly, and annual visits for patients with assigned Registered Nurses and Case Managers.

• Maintain highly accurate and organized Excel spreadsheets for each client, updating visit schedules, notes, and confirmations in real-time.

• Communicate professionally and empathetically with elderly patients, understanding their unique needs and ensuring a respectful and compassionate interaction at all times.

• Liaise with internal teams, care staff, and clients to confirm schedules and resolve any conflicts or changes proactively.

• Prepare and distribute schedules to the care team in a timely manner.

• Handle last-minute adjustments and cancellations efficiently while maintaining service quality.

• Ensure clear and smooth communication across all parties involved, including clients, caregivers, nurses, and internal staff.

Requirements:

• Proven experience in administrative roles, preferably in healthcare scheduling or customer service.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, especially with U.S.-based clients and elderly patients.

• Strong attention to detail and proficiency in Microsoft Excel (creating and maintaining organized spreadsheets).

• Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.

• Compassionate, patient, and empathetic approach, especially when interacting with elderly patients.

• Collaborative mindset and strong team coordination skills.

• Reliable, self-motivated, and committed to delivering high-quality service.

Preferred Qualifications:

• Prior experience in a healthcare or eldercare environment.

• Familiarity with scheduling software or CRM systems is a plus.
