title: Marketing Automation & AI Specialist (HubSpot Expert)
description:
About Total Life

Total Life is a mission-based organization dedicated to providing therapy to older adults—a group that is often overlooked by the healthcare system. Our purpose is to fill the gap for Medicare-covered mental health services, making them truly affordable and accessible for one of our most vulnerable populations.

We act as the administrative engine for our therapists, handling the heavy lifting of credentialing, billing, and insurance so they can focus entirely on clinical work. We run a tight ship, driven by data and punctuality, to ensure the physicians who trust us with their patients receive the highest standard of care coordination.  Check out our website to learn more 



The Role

We are looking for a Marketing Automation Specialist who is more than just a HubSpot administrator. We need a technical architect who can analyze HubSpot data to find growth opportunities and use AI to build smarter, more personalized patient and provider journeys.  You will be responsible for ensuring our "administrative engine" runs at peak efficiency through advanced automation and data-driven insights.



Key Responsibilities

Workflow Engineering: Build and maintain sophisticated multi-branch workflows (e.g., if a therapist is licensed in NY vs. CA, they receive different onboarding sequences).

Lead Scoring & Lifecycle Mapping: Setup and tune "Fit Scores" for therapists and "Urgency Scores" for patients to ensure the enrollment team prioritizes the right leads.

Custom Property Management: Create and audit custom properties to ensure we are capturing specific data points (e.g., "Medicare Part B status" or "Clinical Specialty").

Database Hygiene: Run weekly automated "cleanup" tasks to merge duplicates, fix formatting (Capitalization, Phone formats), and remove unengaged subscribers to protect our sender reputation.

AI Content Personalization: Use AI (via HubSpot's native tools or external APIs) to generate personalized
 "snippets" based on a lead's specific background or location.

Automated Data Enrichment: Build automations (using 
) that take a new lead's
 and "scrape" relevant public data to pre-fill their HubSpot profile before a human ever touches it.

Transcription & Summary: Set up AI workflows to transcribe clinical outreach calls or meetings and automatically push "Key Takeaway" summaries into the HubSpot contact record.

Prompt Engineering: Create and maintain a library of "Master Prompts" used for campaign copy, SMS alerts, and internal documentation.

A/B Testing Infrastructure: Set up "Champion vs. Challenger" tests for every major
 sequence, testing subject lines, send times, and CTA button colors.

High-Conversion Assets: Build and optimize HubSpot Landing Pages and pop-up forms, ensuring they are mobile-responsive and load fast for a senior demographic.

 Deliverability: Conduct monthly audits of SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records and monitor "Postmaster" tools to ensure 99% inbox placement.

Custom Dashboarding: Build "Revenue Dashboards" that show exactly which marketing channel (Google Ads,
, Physician Referrals) is producing the highest ROI.

Cohort Analysis: Track how long it takes a therapist to go from "Lead" to "Fully Credentialed" and identify bottlenecks in the automation funnel.

Funnel Attribution: Set up "First-Touch" and "Last-Touch" attribution models to prove which ads are actually resulting in patient sessions.



Requirements

HubSpot Power User: You should hold HubSpot Marketing Software and Reporting certifications. Experience with HubSpot "Operations Hub" is a massive plus.

AI Native: You must be able to demonstrate a workflow where you’ve used AI to solve a manual data problem or scale a personalization effort.

The "Data Eye": You don't wait for us to ask for a report; you see a dip in conversion rates and bring us a solution based on the data.

Mission Alignment: You are excited about using your technical skills to help seniors access life-changing mental health care.



What We Value

Reliability and consistency

Professional communication

Confidence without being aggressive

Strong follow-up skills

Ability to hit daily call targets



Work Schedule

Monday to Friday

Between 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM EST (US Time)

Must be available for 8 hours a day during these hours





How to Apply

Please submit your resume along with a Loom video (under 3 mins) showing:

A HubSpot workflow you are proud of.

An example of how you used AI to automate a marketing task.

Why the Total Life mission resonates with you.

title: MEDIABUYER SHOPIFY ECOMMERCE STORE
description:
Full-Time Media Buyer Wanted (Shopify E-commerce)



We are currently looking for a full-time Media Buyer who can take full ownership of our Shopify stores and consistently generate profitable sales.



You will receive a ready-to-use Shopify store with no products added.



Your responsibility will be to:

• Conduct product research

• Identify and validate winning products

• Add products to the store

• Write product titles & descriptions

• Source or create high-converting ad creatives

• Launch and test paid ad campaigns (Meta / TikTok)

• Optimize campaigns to reach a minimum of 4+ ROAS

• Analyze data (CTR, CPC, CPA, CVR etc.)

• Scale winning products

• Cut losing products and turn off ads when targets are reached

• Manage daily ad performance and budgets

• Test new creatives and angles continuously



You are expected to work a minimum of 4+ hours per day managing and optimizing campaigns.



Your role is simple:

Take a fresh Shopify store and turn it into a profitable sales machine through paid advertising.



You will not be responsible for:

• Customer support

• Order fulfillment

• Supplier communication

• Backend operations



We handle the store setup.

Your only focus is finding products, launching ads and generating profitable sales.



Requirements

• Proven experience with Shopify product testing

• Experience launching and scaling paid ads

• Ability to consistently reach 4+ ROAS

• Understanding of key ad metrics

• Ability to work independently

• Strong product selection skills

• Experience creating or briefing creatives



Helpful Skills (Not Required)

• Basic landing page editing

• Understanding of CRO

• Experience in fashion e-commerce

• Familiarity with the European / Nordic market

• Ability to spot trends early



We are looking for someone who can take full ownership from product selection to scaling and knows when to cut unprofitable campaigns.



Please wirte 555 on the top of your message

title: Operations Associate
description:
Job Overview:

 We are seeking a proactive and versatile Operations Associate to ensure the smooth functioning of our operations and support business continuity. This role involves training new tea
mbers, stepping in when needed across departments, mastering internal tools, and continuously improving processes. The ideal candidate is highly adaptable, tech-savvy, detail-oriented, and thrives in a dynamic environment.

Participate in training programs, webinars, or courses to enhance personal and team skills.

Suggest and implement innovative solutions to improve operational efficiency.

Support management with ad hoc operational tasks as required.





Qualifications & Skills:

title: Data Engineer (Cloud & GIS Focus)
description:
We’re looking for a hands-on Data Engineer who enjoys building things end-to-end — from designing data systems to deploying and running them in production.

If you like owning your work, solving real-world data problems, and building scalable systems in the cloud, this role is for you.

You’ll help us power analytics, AI, and GIS-driven products with reliable, production-grade data infrastructure.



What You’ll Do

Build & Own Data Systems

- Turn business requirements into scalable data solutions

- Design and build clean, maintainable data pipelines (ETL/ELT)

- Develop batch and streaming workflows

- Improve performance, reliability, and monitoring

- Deploy and maintain systems in production



Cloud & Infrastructure

- Work with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Firebase

- Containerize and deploy services using Docker

- Set up CI/CD workflows with GitHub

- Ensure systems are scalable, reliable, and cost-efficient

- Implement logging, monitoring, and data quality checks



Data & Performance

- Design and optimize PostgreSQL schemas and queries

- Implement validation, observability, and reliability checks

- Support AI and GIS-based data workflows



What We’re Looking For

Must-Have

- 2 years of experience in Data Engineering or similar role

- Strong PostgreSQL experience (schema design & performance tuning)

- Solid Python skills

- Experience with GCP

- Docker experience

- GitHub (including CI/CD workflows)

- Ability to independently deploy and maintain production systems



Nice to Have (Big Plus)

Experience with GIS / geospatial tools such as:

- Shapely

- QGIS

- GDAL

- GeoPandas

- H3

- Google Maps API



Experience working with spatial data or map-based analytics is a strong advantage.



Attach a PDF copy of your resume when you submit your application.

title: SEO Specialist
description:
About the Role



We are hiring a performance-driven Marketing Growth Specialist (SEO-Focused) to drive organic search growth, increase domain authority, and generate qualified inbound leads within the remote staffing and outsourcing space.



This role is primarily responsible for SEO strategy and execution, including keyword research, on-page optimization, technical improvements, and content structuring. Social media will serve as a supporting channel to amplify SEO-driven content and strengthen brand authority.



You will work closely with leadership to ensure measurable growth in traffic, rankings, and inbound lead generation.



Core Focus: Search Engine Optimization (Primary Responsibility – 70–80%)

Organic Traffic Growth

Conduct high-intent keyword research targeting startups, agencies, and international businesses

Optimize website pages, blogs, and landing pages for rankings and conversions

Improve on-page SEO elements (titles, headers, metadata, schema, internal linking)

Implement structured internal linking strategies



Technical & Structural SEO



Conduct technical SEO audits and coordinate fixes

Improve site structure, crawlability, and indexing

Monitor Core Web Vitals and site performance

Identify and resolve ranking issues

Content Authority & Topical Growth

Build topic clusters and pillar content strategy

Create structured content briefs aligned with search intent

Identify content gaps and competitor weaknesses

Strengthen domain authority through backlink opportunities



Secondary Focus: Social Media Support (20–30%)



Repurpose SEO-driven blog content into 
 and
 posts

Support thought leadership positioning

Maintain a consistent organic posting schedule

Track engagement and visibility metrics



(Social is positioned as amplification — not the main growth driver.)



Performance & Reporting



Track keyword rankings, traffic growth, and conversions

Provide clear monthly SEO performance reports

Monitor algorithm updates and adjust strategy

Measure inbound lead growth from organic channels



Requirements



2–4 years of hands-on SEO experience

Proven track record of improving rankings and organic traffic

Strong knowledge of on-page, technical, and content SEO

Experience with tools such as SEMrush, Ahrefs, Search Atlas, Google Analytics

Strong analytical and structured thinking skills

Experience in B2B, staffing, outsourcing, or SaaS is a strong advantage

Ability to work independently and own growth metrics



What Success Looks Like (First 6 Months)



Priority keywords ranking on Page 1

25–40% increase in organic traffic

Clear content cluster structure implemented

Improved internal linking and technical health score

Increased inbound leads from organic search

Consistent authority-building content distribution

title: Financial Analyst with Salesforce Exp
description:
Overview:



We are seeking a highly driven and strategic Financial Analyst to serve as a key partner to the executive leadership team. This role is ideal for a finance professional who combines strong technical expertise with business acumen and thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven environment. The successful candidate will transform complex financial data into meaningful insights, enabling informed decision-making that supports organizational growth, operational excellence, and long-term profitability.



Job Title: Financial Analyst

Location: Fully Remote

Job Type: Full-Time



Key Responsibilities



Executive Financial Partnership

Act as a trusted financial advisor to the CEO by delivering high-impact analysis, forecasts, and strategic recommendations.

Translate financial data into executive-ready insights that drive performance, scalability, and sustainable growth.

Develop financial models to support investment decisions, operational initiatives, and long-term planning.



Strategic Analysis & Business Intelligence



Identify emerging trends, risks, and opportunities through advanced financial and operational analysis.

Research market dynamics, competitor positioning, and industry benchmarks to strengthen strategic direction.

Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate business health and guide leadership decisions.



Syndication Leadership



Oversee syndication processes, ensuring seamless coordination between lenders, investors, and internal stakeholders.

Manage the preparation of documentation, payment processing, and distribution with precision and timeliness.

Safeguard compliance with syndication agreements and applicable regulatory standards.



Commission Oversight



Administer commission structures with accuracy and transparency.

Ensure timely calculations and disbursements while continuously improving process efficiency and controls.

Financial Accounting & Reporting Excellence

Lead Financial Accounting and Reporting activities, ensuring accuracy, integrity, and adherence to best practices.

Prepare executive-level financial reports, dashboards, and presentations that clearly communicate performance, forecasts, and strategic implications.

Strengthen reporting frameworks to enhance visibility and support data-driven leadership.



Operational Efficiency & Systems



Utilize advanced Excel capabilities to build dynamic financial models and automate reporting workflows.

Leverage QuickBooks expertise to maintain reliable financial data and support the full cycle of accounting.

Perform thorough bank reconciliations and implement controls that promote quality and financial accuracy.

Continuously identify opportunities to optimize financial processes and elevate reporting standards.



Required Skills & Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.

Minimum of 3+ years of progressive experience in financial analysis, accounting, or financial management.

Demonstrated expertise in the full cycle of accounting, including reconciliations, reporting, and close processes.

Strong foundation in Financial Accounting and Reporting within a growth-oriented organization.

QuickBooks Certification or advanced working knowledge required.

Proven commitment to quality, accuracy, and strong internal controls.

Exceptional communication skills with the ability to influence and engage executive stakeholders.

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including complex formulas, PivotTables, and financial modeling.

High level of analytical rigor with the ability to synthesize complex data into clear strategic insights.

Strong organizational skills with the capacity to manage multiple priorities independently.



Preferred Leadership Traits



Executive presence with a proactive, solutions-oriented mindset.

Strategic thinker capable of balancing big-picture vision with meticulous execution.

High degree of professionalism, discretion, and integrity when handling confidential financial information.

Adaptable, resilient, and comfortable operating in a dynamic, high-growth environment.

Collaborative partner who builds strong cross-functional relationships.

title: Real Estate Virtual Assistant

title: Remote Executive Assistant to CEO (U.S. Business Operations)
description:

Location: Remote (U.S. time zone overlap required)

Employment Type: Full-Time or Part-Time (Flexible for the right candidate)



About the Role



An active CEO managing multiple business interests is seeking a highly organized and proactive Remote Executive Assistant. This role requires someone experienced with U.S. business systems, professional communication standards, and executive-level support.



The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, discreet, resourceful, and capable of helping streamline day-to-day operations while allowing the CEO to focus on strategic growth.

title: Remote Nurse (RN/LVN) — Charting & Clinical Documentation (Virtual Assistant)
description:
We’re hiring a licensed nurse with aesthetic/dermatology or medspa experience to support our team by completing charting and clinical documentation for patient visits. This is a remote role focused on accurate notes, consistent templates, and HIPAA-compliant documentation.

Responsibilities

* Complete chart notes in our EMR for aesthetic visits (consults + follow-ups)

* Document: HPI, treatment history, allergies/meds, contraindications, consent status, and post-care instructions

* Support procedure documentation (ex: tox/filler, lasers, microneedling, body treatments, skin plans—based on provider protocols)

* Assist with clinical admin as needed: lab uploads (if applicable), follow-up tasks, patient messaging, photo documentation labeling (if used)

* Maintain HIPAA compliance, accuracy, and fast turnaround

Requirements

* Active RN or LVN/LPN license

* Aesthetic / dermatology / plastic surgery / medspa experience (required)

* Strong EMR + medical documentation skills

* Excellent written English, detail-oriented, consistent formatting

* Reliable internet + private workspace

Bonus

* Experience documenting injectables + laser treatments

* Familiar with pre/post-care protocols and contraindications

* Experience with telehealth workflows

Hours/Pay

* Part-time to start with ability to grow

* Compensation based on experience

To apply?Send: license type/state, relevant aesthetic experience, EMR(s) used, availability, and a brief note about your charting workflow.

title: Appointment Setter Needed for Outbound Calls (Remote) - As Soon As Possible
description:
We’re looking for an enthusiastic Appointment Setter who’s high-energy and ready to call outbound leads to book appointments for our agency.



You’ll be handling outbound inquiries, building rapport with potential clients, and scheduling qualified appointments for our consultants. This role is performance-based and ideal for someone who enjoys speaking to people and getting rewarded for results.



Key Responsibilities

- Handle outbound calls with potential clients and answer initial inquiries

- Build rapport, listen actively, and identify client needs

- Schedule appointments and input information into our CRM

- Follow up with leads to maximize the conversion rate from inquiry to appointment

- Maintain an organized call log and provide daily reports



Compensation

- Pay per appointment booked

- Potential monthly earnings: $400–$900, based on performance and volume



Requirements

- Proven experience in appointment setting, sales, or customer service

- Strong verbal and written communication skills

- Ability to work independently and manage time effectively

- Experience with GoHighLevel is a must

- Self-motivated, goal-oriented, and reliable

- Stable internet connection and a quiet workspace



To Apply

Please DM a voice recording introducing yourself and explaining why you’re interested in this role. This recording is mandatory and helps us assess your communication skills and phone presence.



Looking forward to hearing from you.

title: Video Editor & Motion Designer
description:
Feed (
) is a creative video studio that turns founder 
nts, customer stories, and brand ideas into scroll-stopping, story-driven videos that feel human and convert. We specialize in crafting compelling short-form storytelling content.



Note: A portfolio is required for your application to be considered.



We’re looking for a Video Editor to help shape high-quality, story-driven short-form content from raw footage to final delivery. You’ll work closely with the Founder/Creative Strategist to bring ideas to life in a way that feels intentional, human, and visually polished. This role is for an editor who thinks in stories, not just timelines. Here are the types of videos you’ll be expected to make:

- 

- 
/shorts/Cke80ercpkA

- 
/shorts/AuV7_-v6JNg



This position is a full-time contract role for 3 months. As trust and 
ntum builds, there’s a clear path to transitioning into a full-time, long-term role with increased ownership and responsibility.



What You’ll Do

- Own the edit from raw footage to final delivery, shaping narrative structure, pacing, and emotional beats

- Edit short-form videos for TikTok, Reels, and other social platforms with a strong understanding of retention and flow

- Lead visual storytelling through motion graphics and animation, using effects intentionally to enhance the story

- Source and integrate b-roll or stock footage that meaningfully supports the narrative

- Collaborate closely with a Creative Strategist, contributing creative judgment and refining concepts through iteration

- Design and maintain motion assets such as lower thirds and animated information graphics

- Handle color correction and audio polishing to ensure a clean, consistent final product

- Manage files, versions, and deadlines independently in an async workflow



What We’re Looking For

- A portfolio that demonstrates strong storytelling, pacing, and motion design - not just technical edits

- Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects

- Deep understanding of narrative structure

- Strong motion design fundamentals (timing, easing, visual hierarchy)

- Confident audio storytelling skills (music selection, sound design, clean dialogue)

- Ability to make creative decisions independently and explain your reasoning

- Experience working from creative briefs and collaborating asynchronously (Slack, 
)

- Highly organized, reliable, and comfortable managing multiple versions and feedback cycles

- Familiarity with short-form platforms and social-first editing conventions

- Bonus: Photoshop or basic design experience



Salary: $1,500.00 - $2,000.00 per month based on experience

title: Video Editor / Content Creator (Short-Form + Long-Form)
description:
What You’ll Do

1) Edit Short-Form Content (Primary)

* Edit Reels/TikToks/Shorts from raw footage into tight, high-retention videos.

* Create strong hooks, pacing, captions, and pattern interrupts that feel current—not templated.

* Deliver multiple variations when needed (different hooks, text, CTA, length).

2) Edit Long-Form YouTube Content

* Assemble long-form videos with clean storytelling: structure, pacing, b-roll, audio, and color.

* Build compelling intros (no slow ramps), clear chapters, and satisfying endings.

* Produce cutdowns from long-form into short-form content packages.

3) Be Trend-Aware (Creator Brain)

* Track weekly trends: audio, formats, editing styles, 
s, captions, transitions.

* Recommend trend applications that fit each brand (especially medical/aesthetic brands where compliance and tone matter).

* Pitch “content angles” from raw footage (what will work + why).

4) Post-Production Polish

* Captions (burned-in + native), motion graphics, light sound design, subtle VFX when relevant.

* Clean audio (dialogue clarity, leveling), color correction, and consistent brand look.

* Organize assets, project files, and exports in our Drive/frame workflow.

5) Collaborate Like a Pro

* Work closely with our creative lead and account team to hit deadlines and maintain quality.

* Take feedback quickly, do clean revisions, and communicate clearly.

title: Part-Time Marketing Lead (HubSpot, Content, CRM) — Long-Term Role
description:
About the Role

We are a boutique U.S. law firm seeking a part-time Marketing Lead to manage and execute our marketing systems.

This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants a stable working relationship and consistent hours.

You will work directly with the business owner (attorney) and will have ownership over marketing execution, content, and HubSpot management.

This is not a virtual assistant role.

We are looking for someone who understands marketing systems and can think independently.



About the Firm

Our firm focuses on:

• Business Law

• Equine / Equestrian Law (horse industry)

We have been operating for nearly 20 years and are now entering a growth phase, especially in our business law practice.

Our goal is to build consistent lead generation and strong marketing systems over the next 12–24 months.

We are looking for someone who wants to grow with us long-term.



Responsibilities



HubSpot Management (Important)

•
 campaigns and newsletters

• Contact segmentation and lists

• Workflow automation

• Lead tracking and lifecycle stages

• Data cleanup and organization

• Reporting and dashboards



Content & Social Media

• Plan and create content for LinkedIn, Instagram,
, and YouTube

• Repurpose videos into short-form content

• Schedule posts and monitor engagement

• Maintain professional brand tone



Marketing Execution

• Translate business goals into marketing tasks

• Assist with campaign planning and execution

• Identify opportunities to improve marketing performance



Lead Tracking & Reporting

• Update marketing tracking spreadsheet

• Track lead sources and performance

• Provide weekly summary reports

• Monitor results and suggest improvements



Video & Content Support

• Edit recorded videos into reels and short clips

• Assist with scripting and content planning



What We Are Looking For

Required:

• Hands-on HubSpot experience

• Experience managing marketing campaigns

• Strong written English

• Ability to work independently

• Organized and detail-oriented

• Comfortable learning about legal services

• Reliable internet and computer

• Available 25–30 hours per week



Preferred:

• Marketing automation experience

• CRM experience

• Professional services or consulting marketing

• Video editing skills

• Experience working with U.S. clients



Work Hours

• Part-time: 25–30 hours per week

• Must have some daily overlap with U.S. Pacific Time

Schedule can be flexible as long as work is completed reliably.



Compensation

$1,500 – $2,200 per month, depending on experience and skill level

(Part-time equivalent of approximately $18–$25/hour)



Higher compensation may be considered for strong HubSpot experience.



We pay consistently and on time.



Long-Term Opportunity

We are looking for someone to work with for years, not months.

If you are dependable and perform well, this role can grow over time.



How to Apply (Important)

To apply, please include:

1. Your experience with HubSpot (specific tasks you performed)

2. Marketing platforms you have personally managed

3. Your weekly availability

4. Your internet speed

5. A short paragraph describing your marketing experience

6. The word HubSpot in the first sentence of your application

Applications without the word HubSpot will not be considered.



Why You Might Enjoy This Role

• Stable long-term client

• Professional work environment

• Clear expectations

• Opportunity to grow skills

• Consistent hours

• Direct communication with business owner



Please answer the following questions:

• Describe a HubSpot workflow you created.

• How do you track marketing performance?

• How many clients do you currently work with?

title: Sales Expert (Project-Based) – Cold Calling & Appointment Setting Strategy
description:
Sales Expert (Project-Based) – Cold Calling & Appointment Setting Strategy



One-Time Project | Contract-Based

Industry: Healthcare – Men’s Health Clinic



We are seeking an experienced Sales Expert with proven certification and a strong portfolio to support our cold calling and appointment setting team for a Men’s Health Clinic campaign.



This is a one-time, project-based engagement focused on optimizing our cold calling strategy, improving pitch structure, and increasing appointment conversion rates.



Project Scope



You will:

Review our current cold calling scripts and process

Analyze our existing call flow and lead handling

Train our cold callers on how to effectively pitch to cold leads

Provide structured guidance on objection handling

Improve appointment-setting techniques

Recommend measurable KPIs and performance improvements



The goal is to equip our team with a stronger, more effective sales approach that increases booked appointments and overall conversion performance.



Qualifications

Proven experience in sales training or sales consulting

Strong background in cold calling and appointment setting

Experience in healthcare, medical services, or high-ticket services preferred

Sales certification(s) required

Strong portfolio or case studies demonstrating improved conversion results

Ability to conduct structured training sessions and provide actionable feedback



What We’re Looking For

Someone who can quickly identify performance gaps

Practical, real-world strategies (not just theory)

Clear frameworks and repeatable systems

Strong communication and coaching skills



Deliverables

Refined pitch framework

Objection-handling structure

Call flow optimization plan

Training session(s) for the cold calling team

Written recommendations for continued improvement



How to Apply



Please submit:

Your certifications

Portfolio or case studies

Brief summary of relevant experience

Proposed project fee



We are looking to begin as soon as possible.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Do you enjoy turning outreach into real connections and helping a business grow? This role is more than just cold calls and
s. You will help a fast-growing US-based construction franchise by finding leads, qualifying them, following up, and moving them through the sales process. You will work closely with the franchise owner and a supportive team, helping with both sales and operational tasks along the way. If this sounds like a fit for you, we’re excited to review your application and meet you!



What Your Days Might Look Like:

- Conduct targeted research to identify high-value leads.

- Make around 50 outbound calls daily to warm-ish B2B leads.

- Qualify leads and manage follow-ups to keep the sales pipeline moving.

- Maintain CRM data, track all communications, tasks, and pipeline updates in HubSpot.

- Create and optimize scripts,
 templates, and outreach sequences.

- Take on operational tasks as needed to support the business.

- Work closely with the owner to prioritize outreach and identify opportunities for process improvements.



Who We Think Will Thrive in This Role:

- 3+ years of experience in outbound sales or cold calling.

- 1+ year of remote work experience.

- Comfortable working directly with a US-based client and open to feedback.

- Self-motivated, consistent in outreach, and confident in building relationships.

- Strong communication, collaboration, and organization skills.

- Proficient in English, multitasking, and using CRMs like HubSpot.

- Experience in commercial construction or as a team lead is a plus.



Why This Role Matters:

Every call,
, and follow-up helps the business grow. You are not just moving leads. You are helping the franchise succeed while learning and growing your skills in a remote environment.



Salary and Benefits:

- Base salary: 55k PHP per month

- Paid time off and paid holidays

- 100% remote

- Flexible schedule and supportive team



Important Reminder:

This company does not ask for any payments or fees as part of the employment process. If you encounter any request for payment, please ignore it and report it immediately. Make sure all communications come from official company
s 

Candidates who apply for this position may be considered for similar roles depending on their qualifications, experience, and current market needs.



When applying, please send your CV and copy and paste this into your
: “I’m excited to be applying to Job #rec4Wur7vrdBxLYyI!” This will let us know what job you’re applying for and show us that you read this entire job description (attention to detail is everything). Thanks and hope to hear from you soon!

title: Long-Form Video Editor (Fast, Reliable, Full-Time)
description:
We’re hiring an amazing Video Editor to join our team producing clear, professional, educational video content for U.S.-based audience.



This role is for an editor who values clarity, structure, and pacing, not flashy effects or AI-generated shortcuts.



You should be efficient, dependable, and comfortable with fast turnaround times, focusing primarily on long-form editing, with short-form support as needed.



What You’ll Be Editing:

- Edit long-form videos from raw footage to final delivery

- Create short-form clips from long-form content

- Post short-form videos to social media when needed

- Cut, trim, and structure content for clarity and flow

- Clean and balance audio

- Add graphics, overlays, lower thirds, and titles

- Add subtitles / captions when required

- Export videos for YouTube and social platforms

- Follow editing guidelines, naming conventions, and deadlines



What You’ll Do:

- Proven experience editing long-form videos

- Strong sense of pacing and storytelling

- Proficiency with professional editing software (Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, etc.)

- Ability to add graphics, overlays, and subtitles

- Detail-oriented, consistent, and reliable

- Clear communication and dependable internet



Required Experience:

- Proven experience editing long-form videos

- Strong understanding of pacing, storytelling, and clarity

- Comfortable working with large video files

- Experience with professional editing software (Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, etc.)

- Attention to detail and consistency

- Reliable internet and clear communication



How to Apply (Required):

To be considered, submit ALL of the following:

1) Resume (link or attachment)

2) Portfolio or samples showing long-form video editing (YouTube links, Google Drive, Vimeo, etc.)

3) A short note/ application letter explaining:

- Your long-form editing experience

- The software you use

- Your availability for full-time work

4) Subject line or first line must include: “Rockstar Video Editor – [Your Name]”

Applications without long-form samples will not be reviewed.

title: Customer Service Full Time
description:
DRIVEN for Success? Join the Team!



Looking for driven and aggressive individuals who want a long term career NOT a job, if this is you?

Communication and intuitive skills, especially persuasion, to clearly convey the benefits of a product to potential customers needs.

Accountable to yourself, the team and senior leadership to obtain both personal and business Goals.



-Ability to understand client's needs and do what is right for the client

To be clear, I am NOT looking for someone who has the experience in Insurance. I am looking for individuals who want to grow into a permanent position within our organization. I am looking for sales experts!

title: AI Marketing Operations Assistant — Social Media, Ads & KPI Tracking
description:
We are a US-based AI marketing agency managing social media, paid advertising, and growth operations for a luxury automotive concierge platform. We are looking for a sharp, organized, tech-forward assistant who can handle the day-to-day operational tasks that keep our systems running smoothly.

This is not a basic VA role. We use modern AI tools and expect you to learn them quickly. If you are comfortable with spreadsheets, dashboards, and figuring out new software on your own, you will thrive here.

What You Will Do

Your responsibilities fall into three main areas:

1. Ads Monitoring & KPI Tracking (30% of your time)

Log into Google Ads and Meta Ads Manager daily and record key metrics (spend, clicks, CTR, conversions, cost per lead) into a tracking spreadsheet

Take weekly screenshots of all campaign dashboards and send them to your manager every Monday by 9 AM

Flag any unusual changes in performance (a campaign suddenly spending too much, a cost per lead spiking, an ad getting disapproved)

Maintain a weekly KPI log in Notion so performance trends are easy to read at a glance

2. CRM & Pipeline Management (30% of your time)

Monitor GoHighLevel for new buyer and dealer form submissions

Move contacts through the correct pipeline stages based on their activity

Send follow-up reminders when contacts have been sitting in a stage too long

Keep the Notion Dealer Pipeline and Buyer Pipeline databases updated daily

Log all dealer
 replies from Instantly.ai into the correct pipeline stage

3. Social Media & Content Support (40% of your time)

Monitor Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn DMs daily and respond using pre-written scripts

Post weekly updates to Google Business Profile using content provided by your manager

Monitor Blotato for any failed or flagged posts and report immediately

Assist with scheduling content when needed

Research trending audio, hashtags, and content formats in the luxury automotive space weekly and send a brief summary to your manager

Tools You Will Use

GoHighLevel, Notion, Google Ads, Meta Ads Manager, Blotato, Instantly.ai, Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, Google Business Profile, Google Sheets,

Requirements

At least 1 year of experience in a marketing, social media, or operations VA role

Comfortable learning new software tools quickly — we will train you on specifics

Strong written English — you will be responding to real leads using scripts

Highly organized and detail-oriented — you are the person who notices when something is off

Reliable internet connection and available during US business hours (at least a 4-hour overlap with EST or PST)

Experience with any of the following is a strong plus: GoHighLevel, Google Ads, Meta Ads, Notion, cold
 tools

To Apply

Send a 2-3 paragraph message explaining:

The most complex marketing or operations task you have managed independently

Which tools from our list you have used before

Your availability and preferred working hours

Applications without a personal message will not be considered.

title: Lead Development Representative
description:
Company Overview



Join the leader transforming healthcare waste management across America.



MedPro Disposal is the nation's largest privately-held medical waste management company, serving 35,000+ providers across 48 states in a $2+ billion market. Since 2009, we've been the trusted partner helping healthcare facilities save up to 30% on waste management costs while maintaining 99% on-time service.



What we do: We lead with comprehensive medical waste disposal solutions, plus pharmaceutical waste management, secure document destruction, and compliance training services—all powered by innovative technology and a client-first approach.



Why it matters: We handle the critical but complex challenge of medical waste management so healthcare providers can focus on what they do best: delivering exceptional patient care.



Our impact: From physician practices to hospitals, dental offices to long-term care facilities, we're trusted advisors and strategic partners—not just vendors. We combine proven expertise with environmental responsibility and comprehensive protection to solve complex operational challenges.



Ready to grow with us?



Join a fast-scaling, mission-driven company where we Do The Right Thing, roll up our sleeves with a "figure it out" attitude, and win as a team. We're building something meaningful—making healthcare safer, more compliant, and more efficient—one client at a time.



Purpose:

To drive revenue growth by generating qualified leads and sales opportunities through proactive outreach, relationship-building, and seamless handoffs to the sales team—ensuring alignment with the company’s overall growth objectives.



Position Overview:

We're hiring a Lead Development Representative who thrives on phone conversations and has a talent for identifying potential clients. You’ll play a crucial role in reaching out to healthcare providers, qualifying their needs, and passing quality leads to our U.S.-based sales team. Your success directly fuels our business growth.



Key Responsibilities:

-Conduct outbound calls to potential healthcare clients (primarily multi-location clinics and providers)

-Engage with prospects, follow a proven script, and determine their interest in our services

-Send follow-up
s and information to interested prospects

-Document all interactions accurately in our CRM system

-Prepare detailed lead sheets and notes for use by the U.S. sales team

-Assist with tracking orders, resolving basic sales-related issues, and maintaining client records

-Ensure CRM accuracy and submit timely lead status reports

-Maintain consistent communication with the sales team and follow up on lead outcomes



Qualifications

-Bachelor’s degree (preferred but not required)

-1–2 years of outbound sales, lead generation, or cold calling experience in a BPO or remote setting

-Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written)

-Strong attention to detail and data accuracy

-Tech-savvy and experienced with CRM platforms (Salesforce is a plus)

-Goal-oriented and results-driven personality

-Highly organized and dependable, able to work with minimal supervision

-Strong interpersonal skills and a customer-focused attitude

-Experience in B2B sales or working with U.S.-based clients is a bonus



Compensation & Benefits:

$520/month plus commissions

Salary is paid weekly

Paid time off and U.S. holidays

Long-term remote position

Work anniversary bonuses

Opportunity to grow within a U.S.-based, fast-growing company



Application Process

1. Submit your most updated resume to all of these
s:









2. Shortlisted candidates will complete a brief criteria skills assessment after the initial interview.



Equal Employment Opportunity Statement



MedPro Disposal is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic.

WHY THIS ROLE IS UNIQUE

HOW TO APPLY

We are seeking a highly skilled Patient Services Representative with extensive medical billing experience to support our dermatology clients. This role is critical to both patient satisfaction and revenue performance. You will serve as the primary point of contact for patients with billing-related questions, while also identifying and resolving underlying insurance and claims issues.

title: Remote Chat Sales Specialist
description:
Remote Chat Sales Representative

Position Details

Work Location: Fully Remote

Hours: Full-time, 8 hours/day - 6 to 7 days per week

Shifts: Flexible scheduling, both daytime and overnight slots available

Compensation: Starting at $3.00/hour, with performance bonuses and commission on top. Consistent performers can work their way up to $6.00/hour.



About the Role

We're looking for someone who genuinely enjoys talking to people and has a knack for keeping conversations engaging. In this position, you'll be managing live chat interactions on behalf of online businesses - your goal is to connect with customers, understand what they need, and guide them toward a purchase in a way that feels natural, not pushy.

This isn't a scripted, robotic role. We want someone who can read between the lines, match a customer's energy, and make every conversation feel personal.



What You'll Be Doing

Once fully trained, you'll handle between 3 and 8 live chats simultaneously. Day to day, that looks like building genuine rapport with customers, using provided sales strategies to upsell products and services, hitting daily and weekly targets, and always keeping the tone friendly and authentic. Following team guidelines closely is a must.



What We're Looking For

The ideal candidate writes English fluently and naturally - this will be assessed during the application process. You should also be a fast, accurate typist and feel comfortable in a sales-focused environment. Just as important is emotional intelligence: being able to pick up on tone, mood, and intent through text alone.

On the practical side, you'll need a reliable high-speed internet connection, a capable laptop, and a quiet place to work. You should be available across both day and night shifts and bring a professional, mature approach to the role.



What's in It for You

You'll receive full training and ongoing coaching from the team. Pay is sent out weekly through Wise or Payoneer. There's no earnings cap —top performers consistently earn well above the base rate —-and strong performers have a clear path to long-term growth within the team.



How to Apply

Send us a short message that covers why you'd be a strong fit for a sales chat role, a bit about your background, and a description of yourself as a person (a CV is welcome but not required).



Please only apply if your ENGLISH is genuinely FLUENT and you're CONFIDENT you can hold engaging, natural conversations under pressure. We review every application carefully, and those who don't meet the requirements will be declined quickly — we want to be respectful of everyone's time.

title: Part-Time Marketing & Content Role for Small Design Studio
description:
I run a graphic design studio serving small businesses — especially in tech, CPG, and mission-driven organizations. My clients come entirely from word of mouth right now, and I want to change that.

I'm not looking for someone to manage posts. I'm looking for a marketer who can own the strategy and execute the day-to-day — someone who thinks proactively about how to grow a small creative services business, starts with content, and builds from there.



What You'll Own

Content is the starting point, but this role is built to grow into a full marketing partnership. Here's what that looks like:



Content Strategy & Execution

•Develop a content strategy for LinkedIn and Instagram aligned to generating leads and building credibility

•Create content independently — using my portfolio, past work, and context I give you — without needing constant input fro

•Write and format posts, carousels, and captions that sound human and on-brand

•Manage a consistent publishing cadence and track what's working



Marketing Strategy (Where This Grows)

•Proactively bring ideas: new channels, lead gen approaches,
, referral systems — whatever makes sense for a small studio

•Think about the full picture, not just content

•Recommend experiments and share your reasoning



Weekly Collaboration

•One weekly check-in to review what shipped, what's next, and any strategic decisions

•Async updates between calls as needed





What I'll Give You to Work With

I want to be upfront about what you can expect fro
:

•Access to my portfolio and past client work — the raw material for content

•1–2 hours of context per project or content batch — I'll explain the work, the thinking, the story behind it

•Feedback on drafts and direction

•A weekly call to stay aligned



What I won't do: feed you a steady stream of voice memos or raw ideas. You need to be able to generate quality content from a portfolio and occasional conversations — not wait for me to hand you everything.





Who This Role Is For

You're a great fit if you:

•Have real experience marketing a small or service-based business (not just managing social media)

•Can build a content strategy and execute it without being micromanaged

•Write well and can capture a brand voice from examples — AI tools are fine for support, but your writing ability matters

•Are proactive: you bring ideas, flag problems, and move without being pushed

•Understand that for a services business, trust and visibility drive leads — and that content is one of several levers

•Are comfortable with a weekly check-in model and managing your own time between calls



This isn't the right role if you:

•Need constant direction or frequent input to produce work

•Think in terms of posts and engagement metrics only

•Rely on AI to do most of the thinking and writing

•Prefer execution over strategy





Details

•Hours: 10–15 hrs/week to start, can grow to 20+

•Pay: $350–$450/mo USD to start, with growth potential tied to results

•Timezone: Weekly call in my late afternoon / your morning (you manage your own schedule beyond that)

•Platforms to start: LinkedIn, Instagram

•Long-term: scope and pay grow as results build — including other marketing channels





How to Apply

Please answer the following questions. Applications without real answers will not be reviewed.



1.Describe a time you built or owned a content or marketing strategy for a small or service-based business. What did you actually do, and what happened?

2.How do you approach creating content when the business owner isn't giving you much raw material to work with?

3.Share examples of content you've created or strategized — especially for service businesses or creative work.

4.What marketing channels or strategies beyond content would you explore for a small design studio, and why?

5.What tools do you use to manage content strategy and track performance?



Optional but appreciated: A short Loom (2–3 min) walking me through how you'd approach the first 30 days.





This is a long-term role with real growth potential. If you're a marketer who wants ownership and the chance to build something — I'd love to hear from you.

title: Experienced Sales Agents
description:
We are looking to hire permanent full-time Inside Sales Reps to work with our team. As an Inside Sales Rep, you will convert qualified opportunities into new B2B customers and grow existing accounts. This role is for confident sales professionals who can run a structured sales process, handle objections, and consistently close deals. The company sells well-known branded products and not services.



This is a B2B role serving a US customer base, so you will be working North American business hours. This is a home-based position. Candidates must have a quiet workspace, personal computer, stable high-speed internet (minimum 50 Mbps download/upload), and a noise-cancelling headset.



Key Responsibilities

• Close inbound and SDR-qualified opportunities via phone,
, fax

• Manage the sales pipeline end-to-end: follow-ups, proposals, and close

• Meet or exceed monthly/quarterly/annual sales targets

• Maintain accurate CRM records in CRM (notes, call logs, deal stages, next steps)

• Provide feedback on lead quality, objections, and market trends to improve strategy

• Perform other tasks as required by management



Qualifications

• University/college degree is required

• 1+ years experience in inside sales / closing, telemarketing, or appointment setting

• Strong negotiation and objection-handling skills with a proven ability to close

• Excellent English communication skills (spoken, written, comprehension)

• Professional, organized, and confident on the phone

• Self-motivated and able to work independently in a target-driven environment

• Comfortable using computers daily



Compensation

Base salary range is between 25,000 to 30,000 PHP per month (dependent on experience) + generous incentive program. Incentives are targeted at 40,000 PHP extra per month when agents hit minimum criteria, plus additional bonus for order size. Base pay is paid out bi-weekly, whereas bonuses are paid out monthly.



Schedule

Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM–5:00 PM EST



How to Apply

Please submit your current CV and 20-second voice recording. If sending a shared link, please ensure that the link works prior to submission.

title: Video Post-Production Specialist (Color Grading & Brand Continuity)
description:
About Us



NewDay Child Coaching is a premier virtual pediatric practice dedicated to empowering parents through expert-led developmental support. We bridge the gap between clinical expertise and daily parenting. We are currently launching ThriveStart, a high-impact digital curriculum featuring a multidisciplinary team of specialists (PT, OT, and SLP). We are looking for a sophisticated Video Editor who doesn't just "cut footage" but builds a cohesive visual world for our brand.



The Project: The ThriveStart 28-Day Series



We are producing a monthly curriculum consisting of 28 high-quality, 90-second videos. These are divided into four 7-day pillars: Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Speech-Language Pathology, and Integration.



Because our three experts (Amanda, Amber, and Rachel) film in three different locations with varying lighting and backgrounds, your primary mission is Visual Unity. We need the viewer to feel like they are watching a single, seamless masterclass, regardless of who is on screen.



What You’ll Be Doing



Masterful Color Grading: Matching skin tones, white balance, and exposure across three different filming environments to create a "ThriveStart Signature Look."



Precision Content Splitting: Taking 4 master recordings (approx. 2 hours total) and crafting 28 individual 90-second TikTok/Reel-style videos each month.



Creative Brand Integration: Designing and applying consistent captions, "pattern interrupt" graphics, and branded overlays that make our content instantly recognizable.



Audio Uniformity: Ensuring the PT, OT, and SLP segments all have identical loudness and clarity.



Strategic Thinking: For "Integration" days, using creative editing (split-screens or overlays) to visually connect the three disciplines.



You’re the Right Fit If:



You are a Color Expert: You have deep proficiency in DaVinci Resolve or Adobe Premiere Pro and understand how to use Scopes and LUTs to match disparate footage perfectly.



You are a Brand Guardian: You notice if a font weight is slightly off or if a brand color is a shade too dull.



You Love "Social-First" Editing: You know how to make a 90-second educational video feel fast-paced and engaging without losing its professional authority.



You are Systematic: You enjoy building templates and workflows that allow you to produce 28 videos a month with "pixel-perfect" consistency.



Compensation & Commitment



Role: Long-term Monthly Retainer.



Volume: 28 Polished Videos per month.



Rate: Please provide your monthly flat rate for this volume of work. We are looking for a top-tier partner and compensate accordingly for expertise.



How to Apply



To be considered, please submit:



The "Match" Test: A link to your portfolio specifically highlighting a project where you had to make different cameras or rooms look consistent.



Your Toolkit: Which software do you use for color grading and why?



The Strategy: In 2 sentences, how would you ensure that a video shot in a sunny room matches a video shot in a room with artificial light?



Subject Line: Please use "ThriveStart Visual Architect" so we know you’ve visited our site and understand our mission.
salary: negotiable based on talent and experienc

title: Product Lister & AI Graphic Designer
description:
We are Del Cauca, a fashion brand selling clothing for men. Designing and producing our own products, which we sell worldwide. Our main operations are based in Dubai, UAE, while working with a talented remote team from around the world.



We are looking for a detail-oriented Product Lister with strong graphic design skills to join our growing fashion brand. While experience with Shopify is important, the core of this role is being a creative graphic designer who knows how to create high-quality, realistic AI-generated images for a clothing brand.



We’re excited to collaborate with talented creatives who are ready to bring their vision to life and grow with a brand that truly values creativity, and rewards it well. If you’re confident in your skills and ready to showcase your talent, send us your portfolio and a short 1-minute introduction video about yourself. Applications without a video will not be considered.



Key Responsibilities



- Upload and manage products in Shopify (titles, descriptions, variants, pricing, SEO).

- Create high-quality, lifelike AI-generated product images for our clothing collections.

- Work with Higgsfield and Nano Banana Pro to generate realistic fashion visuals.

- Edit and refine AI-generated images in Photoshop to ensure premium, natural-looking results.

- Maintain a consistent brand aesthetic across product pages.

- Optimize product listings for conversions and visual appeal.



Requirements



- Proven experience with Shopify product listing.

- Strong background in Graphic Design (portfolio required).

- Experience creating realistic AI-generated images (fashion experience is a big plus).

- Hands-on experience with Higgsfield and Nano Banana Pro.

- Advanced skills in Adobe Photoshop (retouching, color correction, realism enhancement).

- Strong eye for detail, lighting, textures, and realism.

- Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.



Nice to Have



- Experience in fashion or e-commerce brands.

- Understanding of branding and luxury aesthetics.

- Basic knowledge of conversion-focused product page design.



What We Offer



- Long-term collaboration opportunity.

- Creative freedom within a fast-growing fashion brand.

- Flexible working hours (remote position).



If you are both technically skilled and creatively strong, and know how to turn AI-generated images into premium, realistic fashion visuals, we would love to hear from you.



Please apply with:



- Your portfolio

- Examples of AI-generated fashion work

- Introducing yourself in a 1 minute video



We’re excited to collaborate with talented creatives who are ready to bring their vision to life and grow with a brand that truly values creativity, and rewards it well. If you’re confident in your skills and ready to showcase your talent, send us your portfolio and a short 1-minute introduction video about yourself. Applications without a video will not be considered.

title: L2 Tech Support Engineer
description:
Dear Technology Lover!

We're a small (but VERY efficient) 20-year-old MSP based in Arizona.

As a small company. we're VERY employee-focused, and believe that our tea
mbers are our MOST IMPORTANT ASSET!



Here are some of the things you can expect from working with us:

• Ongoing (monthly) manager review and feedback- you should never guess where you are "standing" and what you, AND THE COMPANY, can do better!

• Paid certifications- we will pay for your courses, and tests and allocate time during business hours to help you achieve your desired goals

• Paid Time Off- it's important to us that you are happy, healthy, and have a work-life balance!

• Bonuses- when the company wins- you win!

• Raises- As we grow, we believe you should as well. We have to stay competitive as an employer to retain our awesome employees!

• Opportunities to grow- In our industry, we can't be on "cruise control"... We need to push our tea
mbers to stay ahead of the technology curve. Help you continually to sharpen your skills with a focus on your career aspirations.

• Paid sick days- We understand life happens. We don't want you to feel that you have to drag yourself to work sick if your body tells you to relax...



You're the right fit if you:

• LOVE learning, working with, and experimenting with new technology

• Get excited when you save someone's day and provide great service

• Are a hard-working fun person, and see yourself being in the IT industry for the foreseeable future

• Want to work in a GROWING environment, with STABLE income, Bonuses, and a great attitude!

• Want the opportunity to advance and learn more!



Some of the responsibilities that your position will include are:

Helpdesk (mostly escalations, but some basic if needed), cyber security related tasks/ audits, cloud hosting and virtualization (HyperV, SonicWall, VPN), MS365 management and automation, BCDR (Axcient), networking (Unifi, Sonicwall), IT projects, Servers maintenance (Windows only), scripts creation, testing new technology and other tasks related to IT.



IMPORTANT:

This position requires AT LEAST 2 years of MSP experience and at least 2 years experience in an L2 position, supervisory, or lead role. 100% clean background check, highly organized, technologically savvy, and can work diligently with little 
veral hiring steps will take place to verify the above requirements, including reference checking, employment verification, technical testing, and more.



Minimum technical level that you will need to be able to pass a test on:

• Explaining to a non-technical person what the "cloud" is

• Consulting with a new client on what BCDR solution you would recommend to an SMB, and why

• Explaining what the differences are between traditional anti-virus and XDR

• Creating a new Virtual Machine on Hyper-V host, from an ISO file located on a different computer on the network.

• Explaining the differences and commonalities between SharePoint and OneDrive.

• Creating an Intune policy that will install Firefox on an Azure-joined VM, and make Firefox the default browser, with the specific home page we'll provide to you during the test.

• Several other situational and technical questions.

• CCNA certificate candidates preferred but not required.



MORE DETAILS:

• A PRE-EMPLOYMENT BACKGROUND CHECK is performed (at our expense). You must have 100% clean background check. Please do not apply if you don't have 100% clean background check.

• Personality is KEY for us. We are looking for an easy-going, yet professional, friendly and HONEST person.

• You will be working from home. This means you must have a quiet work environment and no excessive background noise.

• FAST AND RELIABLE INTERNET SERVICE IS REQUIRED With at least 100Mbps download speed  20+ Mbps upload speed.

• As part of this position requirement, you must have a computer that will be used exclusively for your work with us. This means we will be installing our security software on that computer, will remove admin rights from you, and monitor/ control it for security and compliance reasons. In return, we will pay you additional “rent” fees, on top of your salary, in the amount of several hundred dollars. Details about this “rental” will be discussed during your second interview. There are minimum requirements that your computer must have, in order to be employed with us. You must have a Computer/Laptop with at least i5 minimum 9th gen processor (preferably a newer one) with 16 GB RAM or more or Ryzen 5/7 (MUST include TPM support) as well as Windows 11 OS.

• You must have recently worked on a night shift for 2 consecutive years or more.

• We evaluate/ review employees monthly and provide consistent feedback.

• We offer raises and bonuses according to performance, certifications, attitude, and customer reviews twice/ year.

• Your manager (our IT director) will create a roadmap for your "KPIs" and certifications track. We always push our team to earn certifications and additional knowledge – even allowing “disconnect study time” during business hours!

• On-call rotation (after-hours) for a week at a time, once every 4-5 weeks. It's VERY rare that we get calls after-hours (the average is only twice/ year!).

• We're closed on major US holidays, and at the completion of the first 3 months of employment, you'll qualify for paid holidays.

• Work hours are Mon-Fri at 8 am till 5:30 pm (UTC-07:00 , MST, Arizona time zone)

• Every 4 to 5 weeks, you'll be working 1/2 day on a Saturday (project work/catch-up work) and get 1/2 day off the week after

• Mandatory 1-hour lunch and additional breaks (as you need those) throughout the day.

• Further details and information will be discussed with qualified candidates.



EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

• REQUIRED: Relevant minimum 2 YEARS experience working for an MSP

• REQUIRED: With AT LEAST 2 years experience in an L2 position, supervisory or lead role.

• REQUIRED: Microsoft Azure AD/ M365 experience

• REQUIRED: Experience working with an RMM and PSA software (DATTO preferred)

• Preferred: Cyber Security education/experience

• Preferred: Hyper-V experience



Other tools we use:

Barracuda DNS filter, AutoElevate, Cylance, Infocyte, Syxsense, IT Glue, SonicWall, Unifi, and more



HOW TO APPLY?



send an
 to 
 with the subject line "L2 Tech Support - Feb 2026".



In your
 body, you MUST include the following, and ONLY the following please:

- An attachment of your resume in PDF format

- A confirmation (simple written statement) that you have a 100% clean background with no criminal history.

- A confirmation (simple written statement) that you understand the business hours (MST\ Arizona time zone.



Answer the following questions:

1. How many years of experience do you have working in an MSP company? Name of the MSP company/s you worked with.

2. Do you have at least 2 years experience in an L2 position, supervisory or lead role?

3. Do you have experience working with RMM and PSA software? What applications did you use?

4. Do you have experience working with Virtualization, servers, GPO, TCP/IP, hyper-v/vmware, conditional access, Intune, and Scripting such as PowerShell?

5. Have you recently worked on a night shift for 2 consecutive years or more? What time zone and when?

6. Are you okay with the computer requirements and the rental arrangement described in the job details?

7. Do you have an internet speed of at least 100Mbps download speed and  20+ upload speed?



- No other information/cover letter or attachments should be included, besides a simple salutation and signature if so desired.



NOTE- Please do NOT apply using other methods besides the above. Any applicants who reach out to us via phone, social media, or any method other than the instructions above will automatically be disqualified.

Only those who followed the above instructions will be contacted within up to 2 business days, with further instructions.





We're looking forward to having you join our family!

s per month and knows how to do it without landing in spam.

This is a highly technical, results-driven role. We are not looking for someone who has "used Instantly before." We are looking for someone who can architect an entire cold
 infrastructure from scratch, manage domain health, write converting sequences, and optimize based on data.

What You Will Do

1. Infrastructure Build & Management (40% of your time)

Purchase, configure, and warm up sending domains (Google Workspace or Microsoft 365)

Set up and maintain a rotating mailbox system across multiple domains to maximize deliverability

Configure SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records correctly for every domain

Monitor domain health and sender reputation daily — replace burned domains immediately

Manage the Instantly.ai account including campaign settings, sending limits, and warm-up schedules

2. List Building & Enrichment with Clay AI (30% of your time)

Build targeted lead lists of luxury automotive dealership owners, GMs, and decision-makers across all 50 US states

Use Clay AI to enrich each contact with relevant data (dealership name, brands carried, location, recent activity)

Use Clay's AI column feature to write hyper-personalized first lines for every contact based on enriched data

Maintain clean, deduplicated lists — no bounces, no duplicates, no unsubscribes re-entered

Source additional data from Apollo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, or other tools as needed

3. Sequence Writing & Optimization (30% of your time)

Write or refine 3-5 step
 sequences with strong subject lines, personalized openers, and clear CTAs

A/B test subject lines, CTAs, and
 length systematically

Monitor open rates, reply rates, positive reply rates, and bounce rates daily

Optimize sequences based on data — kill what is not working, scale what is

Send weekly performance reports to your manager with clear metrics and recommendations

Target Metrics You Are Expected to Hit

Open rate: 40%+

Reply rate: 3-8%

Bounce rate: under 3%

Spam complaint rate: under 0.1%

Volume: 50,000–150,000
s/month at scale

Tools You Must Know

Clay AI, Instantly.ai, Google Workspace, Apollo (or equivalent), Notion or Google Sheets for reporting

Requirements

Minimum 2 years of hands-on cold
 experience at high volume (100k+
s/month)

Proven experience with Clay AI for list enrichment and personalization — this is non-negotiable

Deep understanding of
 deliverability: SPF, DKIM, DMARC, domain warm-up, mailbox rotation

Experience managing 20+ sending domains simultaneously

Strong analytical mindset — you make decisions based on data, not gut feeling

Excellent written English for sequence copywriting

Bonus: experience in automotive, real estate, or B2B SaaS outreach

To Apply

Send the following:

Screenshots or a brief description of the largest cold
 campaign you have personally managed (volume, industry, results)

Your process for setting up a new domain from purchase to first send — walk me through it step by step

Your experience with Clay AI specifically — what enrichment columns have you built and what personalization have you generated with it?

Your hourly rate and availability

Vague applications will be ignored. We need specifics. Show us you know what you are doing.

A Note on This Hire

This person is arguably your most important hire after the deal closes. The cold
 machine is what signs dealers, and signed dealers are what triggers your 20% revenue share. A mediocre cold
 person sends 10,000
s and gets 50 replies. A great one sends 100,000 and gets 5,000 replies. The difference in dealer signups — and your income — is enormous.

If your current developer is flaking, this job post is the replacement. The right person for this role can handle the Instantly infrastructure setup that Andrew was supposed to do, plus run the ongoing campaigns, for a fraction of the $4,000 one-time fee. Worth considering.

title: AI-Powered Content Creator & Video Editor — Luxury Brand (Reels, Carousels, Avatars)
description:
About the Role

We are a US-based AI marketing agency producing high-volume, high-quality content for a luxury automotive concierge brand. We need a creative, tech-savvy content creator who is comfortable using AI video tools and can produce polished, on-brand content at speed.

This is not a traditional video editing role. We use AI-first tools (Higgsfield, CapCut, Canva) to generate the raw content, and we need someone who can refine, caption, format, and prepare it for posting across Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.

What You Will Do

1. AI Video Editing & Formatting (50% of your time)

Receive AI-generated video clips (Reels and Avatar videos) from the content pipeline

Add captions, lower thirds, music, and brand overlays using CapCut or a similar tool

Format each video for Instagram Reels (9:16), TikTok, and YouTube Shorts

Ensure every video matches brand standards (dark, cinematic, luxury aesthetic — no bright colors, no cheesy fonts)

Export and upload to the content approval folder by the agreed deadline

2. Carousel & Graphic Creation (30% of your time)

Use Canva (or similar) to produce 5-7 slide carousel posts using provided copy and brand templates

Maintain strict brand consistency — fonts, colors, and layout must match the brand guide every time

Create story graphics and quote cards as needed

3. Content Research & Trend Monitoring (20% of your time)

Monitor trending Reels formats, sounds, and editing styles in the luxury automotive and lifestyle space weekly

Send a brief weekly report to your manager with 3-5 trend observations and recommendations

Occasionally research specific car models to pull reference footage and specs for content

Tools You Will Use

CapCut, Canva, Higgsfield (we will train you), Google Drive,
 (for content approvals), Blotato (for scheduling)

Requirements

Portfolio of at least 5 short-form video edits (Reels or TikTok style) — this is non-negotiable

Strong eye for luxury aesthetics — you must understand what "premium" looks and feels like

Experience with CapCut or DaVinci Resolve for short-form video editing

Comfortable working with AI-generated video content

Able to meet deadlines consistently — content must be ready for approval 48 hours before scheduled posting

Experience with Canva for carousel and graphic creation

Bonus: experience with Higgsfield, RunwayML, or similar AI video tools

To Apply

Send the following:

A link to your portfolio or at least 3 examples of short-form video edits you have produced

A 1-2 paragraph description of your editing process for a typical Reel

Your hourly rate and availability

No portfolio = no consideration. This is a creative role and your work speaks for itself.

title: Personal Injury Case Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced, organized, and proactive Case Manager that also speaks SPANISH to join our growing personal injury team. The Case Manager will be responsible for handling a caseload of pre-litigation files from intake through settlement or trial support. This role is central to ensuring that each client’s case progresses smoothly, efficiently, and in full compliance with California legal requirements.



Key Responsibilities:



Case Intake & Client Onboarding



Conduct initial intake calls with potential clients at any time

Explain the representation process, gather facts, and assess case viability

Ensure all necessary intake forms, authorizations, and documents are completed

Open and set up new case files in case management system



File & Case Management



Serve as primary point of contact for clients throughout the life of the case

Maintain organized and up-to-date digital files using firm case management software

Track all case deadlines, SOLs, medical treatment status, lien info, and key events

Draft letters of representation and send to insurance companies, employers, and medical providers

Coordinate communications with insurance adjusters, medical providers, and other parties



Medical & Records Management



Assist clients in locating appropriate medical providers

Monitor medical treatment and keep detailed notes of client progress

Request and follow up on medical records and bills

Organize medical records chronologically and summarize treatment history

Track and negotiate medical liens (e.g., MedPay, health insurance, hospital liens, third-party)

Insurance & Settlement Support

Submit demands with supporting documentation under attorney supervision

Track offers, counteroffers, and communicate updates to clients

Prepare case summaries for settlement negotiations

Draft settlement memos, disbursement breakdowns, and closing documentation



Required Qualifications:



Minimum 2 years of experience in personal injury law (case manager, paralegal, or similar role)

Knowledge of California personal injury laws and procedures

Strong understanding of medical terminology and records

Excellent communication and client service skills

Strong time management and organizational abilities

Proficiency in legal case management software (e.g., Filevine)

Fluent in English; bilingual in Spanish is a strong plus

Familiarity with pre-litigation and litigation processes
