title: CSR - Field Office Liaison
description:
About AppAid

AppAid is a dedicated Social Security advocacy group committed to assisting individuals with disabilities who are unable to work full-time. Our mission is to guide and support clients through the Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) and Supplemental Security Income (SSI) application and claims process, ensuring they receive the benefits they deserve.



As our company continues to grow, we are building a long-term talent pipeline. This entry-level role is designed for individuals who will start in applications and customer service and grow into a Case Manager role, with clearly defined tiers and increasing responsibility over time.



Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant experience preferred.

Prior experience working with or for the Social Security Administration is highly preferred.

Strong and clear communication skills with the ability to explain complex information clearly and empathetically.

Excellent organization, attention to detail, and time-management skills.

Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.

Proficiency with Microsoft Office and related software tools.

Strong problem-solving skills and professionalism.

High level of integrity and commitment to ethical standards.



Key Responsibilities:

Call SSA Field Offices to:

Confirm AppAid’s representation status on client cases

Verify whether documents (applications, forms, medical records, etc.) were received

Follow up on outstanding or missing items requested by SSA

Request and document claim status updates (Title II and Title XVI)

Follow specific instructions provided by assigned Case Managers, including targeted follow-ups, verification requests, and documentation priorities

Accurately document all SSA interactions in Salesforce and related systems, including:

Field office contacted

SSA agent name

Information provided and next steps

Identify discrepancies or issues (e.g., missing forms, unestablished applications, incorrect representation) and escalate them to the assigned Case Manager or Team Lead

Track follow-ups and ensure timely callbacks or re-contacts with SSA as needed

Adhere to SSA communication protocols and AppAid documentation standards

Maintain professionalism and clarity when communicating with government offices

Support the Case Management team by reducing administrative and follow-up workload



Required Equipment (Must Have Your Own):

Windows:

Minimum Intel i5 processor

128GB SSD

16GB RAM

Windows 10

Mac:

Apple M2 chip or newer

256GB SSD

16GB RAM

Backup power station

Reliable internet connection with ethernet connection 

Reliable backup internet connection



Compensation & Growth:

This position serves as the primary entry point into the Case Management department and is designed to develop foundational SSA knowledge, documentation accuracy, and client advocacy skills. High performers in this role will be considered for promotion into a Case Manager position.

Starting pay & rates to be discussed upon interview. 

This position does not include benefits.



Schedule:

8-hour shift: 6:00 AM – 3:00 PM PST

1-hour unpaid lunch (required for all contractors)

mbers, clients, and external agencies.

title: Sales Coordinator
description:
Sales Coordinator (Construction & Outdoor Living)



We are seeking a detail-oriented, proactive Sales Coordinator to serve as the backbone of our sales department. In this role, you will bridge the gap between our field sales team and our clients, ensuring that every project starts with a precise quote and a seamless communication experience.



The ideal candidate has a "measure twice, cut once" mindset and thrives in the fast-paced environment of the construction or home improvement industry. Looking for a "plug and play" type of candidate.



Key Responsibilities



1. Quote Creation & Estimating Support



Transform field measurements and design sketches into professional, accurate quotes.



Liaise with the technical team to confirm material costs (e.g., aluminum extrusions, motorized components).



Ensure all quotes comply with current pricing structures and lead-time estimates.



2. Calendar & Workflow Management



Manage the sales team’s schedule, including site visits, client consultations, and follow-up meetings.



Coordinate between sales, project managers, and installers to ensure realistic project timelines.



3. CRM & Data Integrity



Maintain and update our CRM system (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, or Jobber) with meticulous accuracy.



Track leads through the sales funnel, ensuring no prospect "falls through the cracks."



Generate weekly reports on sales activity, conversion rates, and pending quotes.



4. Business Correspondence



Draft and send professional
s, proposals, and contracts.



Act as the primary point of contact for client inquiries regarding quote status or scheduling.



Maintain a high standard of brand voice in all written communication.



Qualifications & Skills



English Proficiency: C2 Level (Mastery/Native-Equivalent) or higher. This role requires impeccable written and oral English to handle complex negotiations, technical documentation, and high-level business correspondence.



Industry Experience: Minimum 2 years in a coordinator or administrative role within the construction, HVAC, or outdoor living industries.



Technical Savvy: High proficiency in CRM software and Microsoft Office (specifically Excel for price calculations).



Communication: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with a knack for professional "soft-selling" through follow-ups.



Organization: The ability to juggle multiple project folders and deadlines without losing sight of the details.



Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to identifying potential scheduling conflicts or quoting errors before they reach the client.



Why Join Us?



You’ll be joining a team that values precision and premium craftsmanship. This is not just a "paper-pushing" role; you are an essential part of the design-to-build process, helping homeowners and commercial clients turn visions into reality.

title: Operations Coordinator
description:
Role Overview



As the Operations Coordinator, you are the central hub of our project lifecycle. Your primary mission is to ensure that after a sale is made, the transition to installation is seamless, professional, and on schedule. You will be responsible for precise order auditing, managing the installation calendar, and maintaining clear, proactive communication with our customers.



Key Responsibilities



Order Review & Auditing: Conduct a thorough review of all incoming orders for accuracy before they go to production. Ensure measurements, material specs, and pricing align with the contract.



Installation Scheduling: Manage the master calendar for our installation teams. Optimize routes and timing to ensure maximum efficiency.



Customer Liaison: Act as the primary point of contact for customers regarding their installation timeline. Provide updates on lead times and confirm all appointments via phone and
.



Team Coordination: Communicate daily schedules to the installation crew, ensuring they have the necessary project details and documentation for each job site.



CRM Management: Keep all project statuses updated in real-time within our CRM to ensure the sales team and management have full visibility.



Requirements & Qualifications

Fluency in English: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills are mandatory for client-facing interactions.



Scheduling Expertise: Proven experience managing complex calendars or logistics.



Attention to Detail: Ability to spot errors in technical orders or contracts.



Construction Background: Familiarity with construction terminology, permitting, or site requirements is a significant plus.



Tech Savvy: Proficiency with CRM software, Google Calendar/Outlook, and basic project management tools.

title: SEO Specialist Website Migration and Brand Transition
description:
About the Project



I am currently rebranding and migrating from my shopify website and brand to a website hosted with Next.js. 



This is a critical transition. The existing website has domain authority, indexed pages, backlinks, and search rankings that must be preserved during the migration.



I am looking for an experienced SEO specialist with proven knowledge in website migrations, domain changes, technical SEO, and backlink preservation to manage this process properly and strategically.



This will start as a part time project focused on the migration. For the right candidate, this can turn into a long term full time SEO and growth role.



Project Objective



Successfully migrate from old website to new website without losing:



Search engine rankings

Domain authority

Backlink equity

Organic traffic

Indexed pages

Keyword positions



Responsibilities



Develop and execute a complete SEO migration strategy (rough strategy in plan)

Perform a full SEO audit of the existing website on shopify.

Create a detailed URL mapping plan from old domain to new domain

Implement and verify 301 redirects correctly

Ensure proper canonical tags and metadata are migrated

Update internal linking structure

Submit updated sitemap to Google Search Console

Manage Google Search Console property updates

Monitor crawl errors and indexing issues post migration

Preserve and transfer backlink authority

Identify high value backlinks and ensure proper redirect mapping

Monitor traffic and rankings during and after migration

Develop a post migration SEO recovery and growth plan



Additional Responsibilities After Migration



On page SEO optimization

Technical SEO improvements

Backlink acquisition strategy

Content strategy and keyword planning

Ongoing SEO reporting and analytics

Competitor analysis



Required Experience



Shopify Analytics and Next.js optimization.

Proven experience handling full domain migrations

Strong technical SEO knowledge

Experience with Google Search Console and Google Analytics

Understanding of 301 redirects and link equity transfer

Experience auditing backlinks

Ability to use SEO tools such as Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog or similar

Clear understanding of indexing, crawling, and site architecture

Ability to provide a structured migration plan before execution



Preferred Experience



Experience rebranding ecommerce or B2B websites

Experience working with modern frameworks 

Understanding of site performance and Core Web Vitals



Work Setup



Part time project based role for migration phase. or gig. 

Opportunity to transition into long term SEO position, in house internal team. 

Flexible hours but must meet deadlines

Clear reporting and structured communication required



How to Apply



Please include the following:



Description of a website migration you have personally managed



Results from that migration including traffic and ranking outcomes



The step by step approach you would take for this project



Tools you use for technical SEO and backlink analysis



Your expected hourly rate



Start your application with the word MIGRATION



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be considered.



This is a high importance transition. I am looking for someone strategic, experienced, and detail oriented who understands how to protect and grow digital assets during a brand change.

title: Job Title: GoHighLevel & Digital Marketing Assistant (Music Niche + Project Bonuses!) Salary: Base + Project Commissions
description:
We are a digital marketing agency based in the New England / NYC Metro area.



We take on general business clients (landscapers, contractors, power washers, etc.), but our primary and fastest-growing niche is the music industry. We build digital infrastructures for recording studios, elite retail music shops, and custom guitar builders whose clients include famous rockstars (Andy Powell, Todd Rundgren, Vernon Reid, Sammy Duet, and more).



Our Vibe: We go with a rockstar vibe. We are very chill, we have fun, and we take care of our team—but when it's time to work, we are dead serious about heavy execution.



We are looking for a talented, hungry, and loyal GHL & Admin Virtual Assistant to manage the backend of the business while we are out closing sales.



The Goal:

We are looking for someone to start Part-Time (approx. 4 to 6 hours a day / 20-30 hours a week) as a true "jack of all trades." We have a lot of leads and business coming in. We need you to hold down the fort. If you get the work done efficiently, the agency gets busier, and your hours will scale up. As we grow, you grow with us, and we will reward your loyalty.



The Compensation (Base + Bonus):



Expected Pay Range: Approx $200 - $400/month Part-Time, capping around $750 on busy months.



Paid Trial: We will start with a short, paid trial task to make sure we work well together.



Base Pay: A guaranteed monthly base pay for your part-time hours to handle day-to-day admin operations.



Project Bonuses (The Real Money): Every time we close a new client, we will assign you the build-out. Upon successful completion of their backend/website, you will receive a flat cash project bonus on top of your base pay. This protects the business, but heavily rewards you for execution.



What You Will Do:



GoHighLevel (GHL): Build out landing pages, sales funnels, SMS/Email automations, and manage CRM pipelines for new clients.



E-Commerce & SEO: Basic Shopify setup/management and implementing basic SEO foundations (like Google Business Profiles) for our clients.



Design & Video: Use Canva Pro, CapCut, and Premiere to create engaging social media assets.



AI Execution: Utilize Gemini, ChatGPT, and other AI tools to speed up content creation and copywriting.



Admin & Organization: Keep our Google Workspace (Drive, Docs) perfectly organized. Manage onboarding checklists and task management.



Who You Are:



You are a problem solver. If you don't know how to do something, you don't wait for us—you YouTube it, Google it, and figure it out.



You have solid English. You don't have to be perfect, and you don't have to be amazing at everything—you just have to be willing to execute and get the job done.



You are highly organized and work fast.



Requirements for Interview:



We will conduct a face-to-face video interview via Google Meet. You must have a strong internet connection and a working webcam.



HOW TO APPLY (Read Carefully):

To prove you read this entire post and have high attention to detail, you must put the word "ROCKSTAR" in the subject line of your application/message. If you do not include this word, your application will be instantly deleted.



Include a link to your portfolio or examples of GHL pages / Canva designs you have built. Let's grow together.

title: SEO Specialist
description:
Virtualee & Co. is a boutique operations and business management agency helping Founders, CEOs, and Solopreneurs scale efficiently and reclaim their time. We are looking for a results-driven SEO Specialist to join our team.



If you are analytical, proactive, and focused on improving rankings and traffic, we’d love to work with you.



Key Responsibilities

SEO Strategy & Execution

- Conduct in-depth keyword research focused on high-intent, service-related terms

- Identify ranking opportunities and competitor gaps

- Optimize website pages (metadata, headings, internal linking, content structure)

- Improve on-page SEO and content relevance

Technical SEO

- Conduct site audits and fix basic technical issues

- Improve website speed and Core Web Vitals

- Ensure proper indexing and crawlability

- Implement basic schema markup where applicable

Content Optimization

- Provide SEO recommendations for blog posts and landing pages

- Optimize existing content for ranking improvements

- Develop content briefs based on keyword strategy

Link Building & Authority Growth

- Support backlink acquisition strategies

- Identify relevant directories, partnerships, and outreach opportunities

Reporting & Analytics

- Track rankings, traffic, and conversions using Google Analytics and Search Console

- Provide bi-weekly or monthly performance reports

- Recommend adjustments based on data



Qualifications

- Minimum 1–2 years experience in SEO

- Strong understanding of on-page, off-page, and basic technical SEO

- Experience using Google Analytics and Search Console

- Familiarity with tools like SEMrush, Ahrefs, or similar

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

- Self-starter who takes initiative and works independently



What Success Looks Like

- First-page rankings for agreed priority keywords

- Consistent increase in organic traffic

- Improved keyword positioning month-over-month

- Clear reporting with actionable insights

- Stronger domain authority and backlink profile



Bonus If You Have Experience With

- Squarespace

- Core Web Vitals optimization

- Local SEO optimization

- B2B or service-based businesses

description:

This role goes far beyond admin it blends operations, sales strategy, content coordination, and business development.



You’ll work directly with the founders, educators, and students  to keep the business running smoothly while actively identifying ways to grow our brand, student base, and partnerships.



Key Responsibilities:



Operations Management



Oversee GHL backend workflows, booking flows, automations, and task tracking



Monitor educator scheduling, vendor communication, gift bag + certificate logistics



Check daily employee hours, confirm vendor pricing, manage receipts/documents



Keep backend systems clean, organized, and up to date



Sales & Business Growth



Handle inbound and outbound sales activities (must understand sales psychology)



Track student pipeline, upsells, retention and overall class metrics



Conduct cold outreach to schools, publications, barbershop owners, and partners



Build & nurture relationships to grow brand presence and secure collaborations



Track basic business numbers (e.g. profit margins, class revenue vs. expenses)



Marketing & Content Coordination



Schedule and track content (YouTube, Instagram, TikTok,
, Ads)



Collaborate with content team (video editor, designers) and maintain calendars



Plan content shoot days with Francis, ensure footage is uploaded and categorized



Research content ideas, trends, and articles related to barbering + education



Organize student photos, reviews, and media for publishing



Must-Have Requirements:



5+ years experience in operations, business management, or sales coordination



University Degree - Business related



Fluent in English (verbal & written)  must be confident on video and voice



Highly organized, with ability to manage many moving parts and prioritize



Excellent systems thinker, can build efficient workflows and track key metrics



Comfortable using and learning AI tools to increase productivity



Experience or strong understanding of sales funnels and client journey mapping



Willing to take initiative and solve problems proactively



Familiar with GHL (GoHighLevel), or quick learner with similar platforms



Willing to do cold outreach, build rapport, and turn conversations into partnerships



Willing to learn and manage social media posting tools, basic editing, scheduling



 Hours:



40 hours/week to start. 



10AM – 6:00PM EST. Occasionally must be available during off hours and on weekends if issues arise  For example sometimes we may need you to work and schedule calls at 7pm EST. Or work for an hour at 6pm due to class schedule issues. You can then start later or finish earlier on another day to balance out the hours. 





Pay:



Competitive hourly rate (based on experience)



Bonuses for performance & revenue growth



Long-term opportunity with leadership potential



 Bonus if You Have:



Experience in education, beauty/barbering, or online coaching businesses



GoHighLevel Experience/knowledge 



Worked with creators, content teams, or online sales funnels



Additional: We will require 2 legitimate work references & University Degree PDF + verification



Real Estate Investing / Renovations knowledge & experience

title: Recruitment Specialist
description:
This role is for an experienced Recruiter responsible for managing the entire recruitment lifecycle for various departments and clients. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with hiring managers, clients, and candidates to ensure an efficient and effective hiring process.



Key Responsibilities:



Manage full-cycle recruitment from job intake to placement

Write and post job ads across different platforms

Source candidates using LinkedIn, Indeed, OnlineJobs.ph, and other job boards

Use LinkedIn headhunting to find and engage passive candidates

Screen resumes and conduct initial and final interviews

Coordinate interviews between candidates and clients

Maintain strong communication with hiring managers and clients

Track candidates and update recruitment pipelines

Ensure a positive experience for both candidates and clients

Support cross-functional teams and help improve recruitment processes





Key Qualifications:





At least two years of experience in a recruitment company, preferably VA recruitment

Strong experience with full-cycle recruitment (end to end)

Proven experience using Indeed, LinkedIn, OnlineJobs.ph, and similar platforms

Strong skills in headhunting and candidate sourcing

Strong communication skills in English

Experience working with cross-functional teams

Ability to manage multiple roles simultaneously

Familiarity with Canva or similar editing tools

Organized and detail-oriented

Great team player with a collaborative mindset and proactive attitude

title: Short-Form Video Editor & Posting VA (TikTok / Reels / UGC)
description:
We are hiring a highly reliable Video Editor & Posting VA to handle large-scale daily editing and publishing of short-form content across multiple accounts.



This is a high-output execution role. Your responsibility is to turn raw footage into platform-native videos and get them posted accurately, quickly, and consistently.



You will be expected to help process up to 100 posts per day across accounts.

If you are not comfortable working at this volume, this role will not be a good fit.



Core Responsibilities



You will manage the full pipeline from raw files to live posts.



Daily tasks include:



Accessing iCloud folders to retrieve raw video files



Editing videos to match provided references or campaign style



Making content look native to TikTok (CapCut-style editing)



Adding captions, cuts, zooms, timing, and on-screen text



Syncing footage to sounds, music, or voiceovers



Matching lip-sync to audio when required



Finding the correct sound or music when needed



Exporting videos in platform-ready format



After editing:



Remotely controlling company phones from your computer



Uploading videos to the correct accounts



Attaching the correct sound or audio track



Writing or pasting captions and hashtags



Ensuring formatting matches TikTok best practices



Verifying successful upload



Marking posts as completed in the CRM



Technical Requirements



You must be comfortable operating within a structured, high-volume workflow.



Required skills:



Strong CapCut editing skills (mobile-style editing)



Familiarity with TikTok Studio and posting tools



Understanding of TikTok trends and native content style



Ability to work inside iCloud file systems



Experience with remote phone control software



Ability to troubleshoot issues independently



Strong organizational skills across many files and accounts



Comfortable updating spreadsheets or CRM systems



High-speed internet and reliable computer setup



What “Native TikTok Editing” Means



Content should look like it was created inside TikTok itself, not traditional editing software.



You should be comfortable with:



Fast-paced retention editing



Platform-style text overlays



Proper vertical framing



Trend-aligned timing and sound usage



Clean edits that feel authentic, not overproduced



Who This Role Is For



You are:



Extremely detail-oriented



Fast and dependable under heavy daily workload



Comfortable with repetitive but precise tasks



Technically confident and organized



Able to work independently with minimal supervision



Focused on accuracy and consistency



Who This Role Is NOT For



Do not apply if you:



Cannot handle high-volume output



Are new to CapCut or TikTok editing



Miss deadlines or overlook details



Need constant direction



Prefer slow-paced or purely creative work

title: CGI Designer (AI + Motion-First)

nts that stop thumbs and spark sharing.



If you think in spectacle, scale, and motion — and you move fast — we want to see your work. 



If interested, please fill up this form: 

DO NOT send us a private message. Thank you!

title: Social Media & Marketing Operator
description:
MARKETING & SOCIAL MEDIA OPERATOR (Full-Time, EST Hours Required)



Location: Remote

Hours: 25 - 40 hrs/week

Required: Eastern Time Work Hours (non-negotiable)

Pay: $4-$7/hr

Performance bonuses tied to growth milestones



About The Role



We are a growing real estate brand looking for a Marketing & Social Media Operator who can help us grow multiple accounts with structure, consistency, and strategy.



This is not just a posting role.



We are looking for someone who understands:

Instagram & YouTube specifically

Creative to come up with ideas on a continual bases

Keep up with trends for growth

Content positioning and strategy

Audience growth

YouTube optimization

Organized execution across platforms



If you only want to schedule posts, this is not for you.



Platforms You’ll Help Manage

You will contribute to:

Builder Instagram

Real Estate Business Instagram

Two Personal Brand Instagram accounts

Realtor / Real Estate YouTube channel



Output Expectations

Instagram: 3–4 posts per week per account

YouTube: 1-2 video per week

Topic research

Script outline support

Thumbnail creation

SEO basics (titles, descriptions, tags)

Content Ideas (new and what is currently working in market)



You will NOT do any video editing. We have a Video Editor on staff but you will coordinate with a video editor to make content.



What We Value

Strategic thinking before execution

Organized workflow (ClickUp, Asana, Trello, etc.)

Strong English communication

Experience with YouTube SEO and thumbnails

Canva design ability

Proactive communication

Long-term commitment

CONTINUAL LEARNER



Required Availability



You must be able to work:

Between the hrs or 9AM–5PM Eastern Time, Monday–Friday. Your schedule may vary but you need to be able to work between these hrs.



If you cannot work these hours consistently, please do not apply.



*Application Instructions*

At the top of your application, write:



OPERATOR



Then include:

Links to 2–3 accounts you’ve helped grow

Direct links to posts, reels, or thumbnails you created

Brief explanation of your role in those accounts

**Please include links to video posts and NOT just graphics and flyers**

**I want to see creativity and how your posts did with growing the account**



Growth Opportunity

This role can grow into a long-term Marketing Manager position.



Bonuses are available when growth milestones are met or exceeded (follower growth, channel performance, consistency).

title: Virtual Assistant for Social Media
description:
Virtual Assistant – Social Media Operations



Remote | Part-Time | Ongoing



We are looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to manage and support our LinkedIn and social media operations. This role is ideal for someone who understands engagement strategy, content scheduling, and professional brand management.



This is not a “post and log off” role. We need someone who understands how to maintain presence, drive engagement, and keep systems organized.

- Upload and format posts properly (spacing, tagging, formatting, links)

Planning & Organization

Ideal Candidate

- Comfortable flagging important issues rather than ignoring them

- Understands brand voice consistency

- Experience responding to ad comments is a plus



What We’re Looking For

- Must have experience in Google Suite, Slack, ClickUp

- Must have experience in Meta Business Suite, Meta Ads Manager, LinkedIn Ad Manager, TikTok Ad Manager, TikTok, LinkedIn,
, Instagram, YouTube

- Not just execution-focused — someone who thinks

- Strong attention to detail

- Comfortable working with structured systems and processes

- Ability to handle volume while maintaining quality



Hours & Compensation

- Part-time (hours flexible, but daily check-ins required)

- Ongoing role

- Compensation based on experience

title: Customer Experience Virtual Assistant (Phone Based)
description:
Are you someone who takes pride in handling customer interactions the right way—calmly, professionally, and consistently? Do you do well with clear expectations, scripts, and processes, and enjoy improving quickly through feedback? If so, Maid In America Cleaning Services, based in Clarksville, TN, wants to hear from you.



We’re seeking a Customer Experience Virtual Assistant to serve as a frontline point of contact for our customers and a dependable executor of structured processes. Working closely with our sales and customer experience teams, you’ll be responsible for answering inbound calls, handling customer requests, following defined scripts, and routing issues accurately.



This role is process-driven and phone-heavy, especially during training. The work can be fast-paced at times, but it is highly structured. Your ability to stay calm, follow instructions precisely, and take coaching seriously will have a direct impact on customer satisfaction and team efficiency.



What You’ll Do



- Answer & Handle Inbound Customer Calls: Be the first point of contact for customers and new inquiries, answering calls promptly, professionally, and calmly while following provided phone scripts.

- Follow Scripts & Decision Trees: Handle common customer needs—such as scheduling questions, reschedules, basic service inquiries, and initial issue intake—by following clear scripts and escalation rules exactly.

- Route Requests Accurately: Determine when a request can be handled directly and when it should be escalated to the appropriate tea
mber, ensuring clean handoffs and no dropped balls.

- Create a Positive Customer Experience: Make customers feel heard, cared for, and confident that their request is being handled, even when issues or complaints arise.

- Document Interactions & Updates: Log accurate notes and updates in our systems so the internal team always has clear context and next steps.

- Support Structured Administrative Workflows: Execute defined backend processes (task tracking, updates, file movement, and follow-through) by following SOPs and checklists without skipping steps.

- Receive Coaching & Improve Quickly: Actively apply feedback on calls, scripts, and workflows, improving speed, accuracy, and confidence over time.



Who We’re Looking For



- Process-Driven & Detail-Oriented: You’re comfortable following scripts, checklists, and SOPs exactly, and you don’t skip steps or “freestyle” your work.

- Calm & Professional on the Phone: You communicate clearly and confidently, stay composed with customers, and can handle questions or mild frustration without getting flustered.

- Highly Coachable: You take feedback seriously, apply it quickly, and improve fast—especially when it comes to phone scripts and customer handling.

- Reliable & Consistent: You show up on time, follow through on tasks, and can be counted on to do things the right way every time.

- Comfortable with Structure: You prefer clear expectations, defined processes, and knowing exactly what “good” looks like in your role.

- Tech-Comfortable: You’re comfortable working inside tools like Slack, shared documents, and task systems—or you can learn them quickly with instructions.

- Strong Communicator: Whether by phone, chat, or written notes, you communicate clearly, professionally, and respectfully.



Our Core Values



- Communication

- Connection

- Quality

- Service

- Teamwork



If you share these values, we want you on our team to help drive our company forward.



Important Note: Screening Step



SERIOUS APPLICANTS ONLY:

Complete our personality test to see if there’s a mutual fit:


/p/fzxN5FC9302s 

Give honest answers; there are no right or wrong results.



Submit your application with the subject line beginning with the core value we’ve listed that you most resonate with.



IMPORTANT: When applying, please use AT LEAST 5 Apply Points



Skills & Requirements

- Fluent English: Strong spoken and written English is required. This is a phone-based role, and customers must be able to understand you clearly and comfortably.

- Customer Service Experience: Prior experience handling customer inquiries or support requests over the phone is required.

- Process & Administrative Competence: You’re comfortable following multi-step processes, documenting information accurately, and keeping systems up to date.

- Attention to Detail: You consistently capture the right information, follow instructions precisely, and avoid careless errors.

- Coachability: You’re open to feedback, willing to be corrected, and able to apply coaching quickly—especially when learning phone scripts and customer-handling expectations.

- Technical Readiness:

  - Reliable computer with backup power options

  - Quality headset and microphone

  - Quiet workspace suitable for phone calls

- Ability to Work Monday-Friday, 8AM-5PM CST.

- Reliable Internet & Backup Options: Stable internet connection with a backup plan to ensure consistent availability and responsiveness.



Why Join Maid In America Cleaning Services?



- Impactful Role: Your quick execution and initiative will directly affect customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.

- Growth-Oriented Culture: We embrace new ideas, reward proactive thinking, and train daily for continual improvement.

- Supportive Team: Collaborate with a group that values each other’s contributions and thrives on a feedback-rich environment.



If you’re passionate about productivity, eager to work in a fast-paced setting, and confident in your ability to deliver high-quality results quickly, apply now and become an integral part of the Maid In America family!



Apply Today: Submit your application per the instructions above. We look forward to learning more about you!

title: Client Care Coordinator (US NATIVE ACCENT) ASAP
description:
We’re looking for a proactive, detail-oriented Client Care Coordinator to join our healthcare support team. This role is ideal for someone with strong administrative skills, a solid understanding of medical procedures, and a genuine commitment to providing outstanding client service. You’ll play a key role in streamlining insurance processes and supporting patients with clarity, compassion, and care.



What You’ll Do: 

Accurately and promptly handle pre-authorization requests

Manage insurance tasks such as verification, claims processing, and follow-ups

Upload and track billing documentation across multiple platforms

Use DSL systems to maintain patient records and coordinate care

Communicate clearly and professionally with patients, providers, and insurance companies

Apply your medical knowledge to ensure accurate documentation and guide patients effectively



What We’re Looking For: 

Experience in healthcare administration, insurance coordination, or medical office support

Familiarity with DSL systems and insurance billing platforms

Strong understanding of medical terminology and patient care workflows

Excellent verbal communication skills with a neutral US ACCENT

Highly organized, reliable, and able to manage multiple priorities



Bonus Points: 

Certification in medical billing or healthcare administration

Hands-on experience with pre-authorizations and insurance claims

Warm, empathetic communication style

Comfortable working independently and collaboratively



If you’re ready to make a meaningful impact in a patient-centered environment and bring precision to every interaction, we’d love to hear from you.



Please send your resume and a short video introduction (minimum 2 minutes). Thank you!

Please send your resume and a short video introduction (minimum 2 minutes). Thanks!

title: Operations Virtual Assistant
description:
Maid In America Cleaning Services is hiring an Operations Virtual Assistant to protect schedule integrity, data accuracy, and operational consistency.



This is a behind-the-scenes execution role. You will not be customer-facing. You will work inside defined systems and SOPs to ensure our operational engine runs cleanly and efficiently every day.



If you enjoy structured work, moving quickly without sacrificing accuracy, and taking pride in clean execution, this role will feel natural to you.



What You’ll Do:



1. Scheduling & Job Management (Primary Responsibility)

You will own scheduling preparation and system accuracy for our TN locations.



This includes:

- Creating and modifying clients, jobs, and visits in Jobber

- Preparing future-day schedules for review and approval

- Creating training tasks in Jobber for new tea
mbers

- Re-sequencing jobs and rebalancing teams within defined guardrails

- Maintaining week-to-week schedule consistency whenever possible

- Flagging and correcting conflicts or inefficiencies early

- Executing same-day scheduling adjustments exactly as directed



2. Data Accuracy & System Integrity

You will ensure operational data is accurate, complete, and reliable.



This includes:

- Updating customer notes, job frequencies, and service details

- Invoicing customers promptly after service completion

- Calculating cost-of-service data after jobs

- Preparing timesheet and tips reports for payroll

- Logging complaints and rectified cleans accurately

- Creating and publishing weekly operational reports

- Manual KPI data entry

- Verifying work-to-labor ratios using company tools



3. Administrative Support

You will support operational structure and remove administrative friction.



This includes:

- Supporting the Assistant Operations Manager with administrative execution

- Maintaining internal trackers and shared documents

- Following established documentation and checklists consistently



What This Role Requires

- High pace with high accuracy

- Comfort with structured, repeatable tasks

- Strong attention to detail

- Clear communication when issues arise

- Strong adherence defined systems and guardrails

- Ability to work independently within clear expectations



This role involves a high volume of operational tasks that must be completed correctly and consistently. As the company grows, volume will increase — and this role grows with it.



Who We’re Looking For



Detail-Oriented & Reliable

You take pride in doing things correctly and thoroughly.



High Throughput Executor

You can handle volume without losing structure or focus.



Process-Driven

You work well inside defined systems and appreciate clear expectations.



Accountable Communicator

You flag issues early, own mistakes quickly, and ask for clarification when needed.



Tech-Comfortable

You’re comfortable using tools like Slack, Google Suite, Chrome extensions, and scheduling platforms. Experience with Jobber is a strong plus.



Experienced in Fast-Paced Admin or Scheduling

Background in administrative, dispatch, logistics, scheduling, or operations-heavy roles is

preferred.



Work Requirements

- Monday–Friday, 8AM–5PM U.S. Central Time

- Reliable internet with backup

- Dedicated workspace

- Backup power options in case of outages

- Fluent written English



Our Core Values

- Communication

- Connection

- Quality

- Service

- Teamwork



If these values resonate with you, we want to hear from you.



Important Screening Step (Read Carefully)



SERIOUS APPLICANTS ONLY:

1. Complete our Culture Index survey: 

2. Submit your application with the subject line beginning with the core value you most resonate with (ALL CAPS).

3. Use a minimum of 5 Apply Points when applying

4. In your application message, include one sentence describing the most repetitive task you have performed at a high standard for 6+ months.



Applications that do not follow all instructions will not be reviewed.

title: AI Video Content Editor
description:
Hello! A bit about us: We develop apps & looking for a reliable VA to create short AI generated videos for TikTok/reels. We use these videos to promote apps organically and use as ads. This is a straightforward role where you'll follow clear instructions, but there's room to grow if you show initiative in optimizing processes or suggesting ideas.



Key Responsibilities:



• Follow detailed workflows/scripts provided; report daily progress.

• Ideation: Use ChatGPT to brainstorm video concepts (with guidance & training!)

• Image Generation: Create images using tools like Nano Banana Pro

• Video Generation: Animate images into 8 second clips using AI tools like Veo 3, Kling AI, etc

• Basic Editing: Assemble clips and add captions using free tools like CapCut or Edits.

• Produce 10+ videos per day (batches of 4 clips per video, with retries for quality).



This role starts simple! Just execute the steps accurately and efficiently. But if you excel, you can take it above and beyond: Suggest tool improvements, automate parts (e.g., n8n), or handle posting/analytics for growth into a senior creator role.



Requirements:



• Basic experience with AI tools (ChatGPT, Midjourney, or similar—training provided if needed).

• Comfortable with English prompts and instructions.

• Reliable internet and computer for video rendering.

• Attention to detail; ability to handle retries without frustration.

• Bonus: Experience with automation (n8n/Zapier).



Work Schedule: Flexible, part-time to full-time (20-40 hours/week), no timezone requirements but some overlap with PST preferred.



Salary: $4-7/hour starting, based on experience. Performance bonuses for high-quality output and innovations.



APPLICATIONS INCLUDING YOUR **BEST** AI-GENERATED VIDEO WILL GET PRIORITY AND AN AUTOMATIC INTERVIEW. If you don't have a quality AI video to submit, provide your resume/portfolio and why you'd excel in this role.

title: Senior Shopify Store Manager
description:
Part-Time · Remote · 20 Hours per Week ? Option to Full-Time



We are a fast-growing D2C footwear brand scaling through performance marketing. We are looking for a Senior Shopify Store Manager who takes full ownership of our Shopify storefronts and continuously optimizes the on-site experience to support paid traffic performance and conversion.



You will work closely with the Founder and Creative team to ensure the stores perform at a high level and support our US market expansion.



Important: We operate two Shopify stores (German-speaking and English-speaking). You must be comfortable managing and optimizing both.



Your Responsibilities



Shopify Store Ownership:

 • Manage and optimize both Shopify stores on a daily basis

 • Ensure product pages, collections and landing pages are fully optimized

 • Maintain clean store structure, navigation and merchandising

 • Implement CRO improvements based on data and user behavior

 • Work confidently within Shopify Markets for international setup and optimization



Product Management & Backend Operations:

 • Conduct product research and support new product opportunities

 • Create and fully set up new products in Shopify backend

 • Manage pricing updates and variant creation

 • Add and maintain upsell and cross-sell products

 • Build and optimize backend product pages

 • Create and structure collections

 • Upload and manage product media

 • Occasionally create simple product images when needed

 • Ensure all product data is accurate and properly structures



Performance & Optimization:

 • Identify friction points in the customer journey

 • Support paid traffic performance through on-site improvements

 • Monitor site speed, UX and mobile performance

 • Test and implement new conversion improvements

 • Provide structured recommendations based on data



Data Analysis & Insights:

• Analyze Shopify data to identify top-performing products and revenue drivers  

• Review customer purchase behavior (e.g., first product vs. repeat purchases)  

• Monitor refund and return patterns and flag risk areas  

• Identify opportunities to improve AOV, CVR and product mix  

• Provide regular insights and actionable recommendations based on store data  



Execution & Quality Control:

 • Ensure all store updates are accurate and error-free

 • Manage apps, integrations and basic theme adjustments

 • Plan and support product launches

 • Coordinate with suppliers when onboarding new products

 • Escalate technical issues when needed

 • Maintain high attention to detail across the storefront



Collaboration:

 • Work closely with the Founder

 • Communicate via Slack and Notion

 • Participate in weekly check-ins when needed



???? Your Profile:

 • Senior-level Shopify store management experience (3–5+ years)

 • Strong hands-on experience with Shopify Markets

 • Deep knowledge of product setup and backend operations

 • Strong understanding of CRO and D2C customer journeys

 • Experience managing multi-store environments (preferred)

 • Highly detail-oriented with zero tolerance for errors

 • Strong analytical mindset and KPI understanding

 • Reliable, proactive and ownership-driven

 • Experience in fast-paced D2C environments

 • Fluent in English (written & verbal)



???? Why Join Us?

 • High ownership and real performance impact

 • Work directly with the Founder and growth team

 • Fast-scaling D2C environment

 • Clear processes with room for optimization

 • Option to move into a full-time role after 1–2 months



???? Compensation:

 • $375/month

 • Part-Time · 20 Hours per Week

 • Option to Full-Time: $750/month

title: Full Stack Digital Operations Specialist
description:
To act as the technical bridge between marketing traffic and sales conversion, ensuring 100% system uptime, peak performance, and automated lead flow.

I. The Three Pillars of Responsibility

1. The Web Master (Infrastructure & Performance)

• Performance Engineering: Maintain "Green" Core Web Vitals using WP Rocket and Imagify.

• Technical SEO & Hygiene: Conduct weekly SEMrush audits to prune toxic backlinks, repair 404 redirects, and manage Rank Math (Schema/Breadcrumbs).

• Integrity & Security: Manage site backups, template migrations, and plugin environment updates to ensure zero downtime.

• Design , Build, test, and deploy high-converting landing pages using Elementor.

• Build and edit website using themes 

2. The Funnel Architect (Automation & GoHighLevel)

• Lead Capture: Manage WP-Forms to GoHighLevel (GHL) API integrations.

• Nurture Automation: Design and manage multi-step "If/Then" workflows in GHL using
 and SMS triggers.

• Customer Journey: Optimize the path from lead entry to booked appointment/sale, ensuring no "leaks" in the funnel. Team objectives

3. The Project Orchestrator (Management & Strategy)

• Vendor Management: Act as the technical lead for Fiverr contractors, providing clear briefs and quality control.

• Data Oversight: Track daily/weekly KPIs; analyze performance dips and present strategic pivots to the team.

• Operational Flow: Maintain project boards and internal documentation to ensure team transparency. Google work space.

________________________________________

II. Integrated Skill Matrix

This matrix identifies the evolution of the role from basic execution to strategic mastery.

Skill Category Level 1: Fundamental Level 2: Professional Level 3: Expert

WordPress & Elementor Text/Image edits & basic page layout. Custom responsive layouts & mobile optimization. Theme hooks, template migrations, & API integrations.

SEO & Performance Basic Meta Tags & keyword placement. Rank Math Schema, Redirect repair, & Imagify. Solving SEMrush "Toxic Backlink" & Core Web Vital fails.

GoHighLevel (GHL) Form-to-CRM setup & daily API testing. Multi-step "if/then" triggers & lead nurturing. Full funnel tracking & customer journey optimization.

Project Operations Task list updates & basic reporting. Fiverr contractor coordination & budget tracking. Strategic brainstorming & KPI-driven team pivoting.

________________________________________

III. The 8-Hour Optimized Workflow

To maximize the specialist's output, their day is divided into "Reactive" (Maintenance) and "Proactive" (Growth) tasks.

• Hour 1: System Health Check (The Audit)

o Test WP-Form to GHL API connections.

o Review SEMrush for urgent performance alerts or new toxic links.

o Check site speed reports.

• Hours 2–4: Deep Work (The Build)

o Build/Update landing pages in Elementor.

o Design and sequence new GHL workflows or nurture campaigns.

o Implement Rank Math Schema markup and breadcrumb logic.

• Hour 5: Vendor & Team Sync (The Coordination)

o Brief Fiverr contractors and review pending deliverables.

o Daily brainstorm with team on KPI progress and bottleneck removal.

• Hours 6–7: Content & SEO Hygiene (The Polish)

o Clean spam backlinks and fix redirects.

o Optimize images (Imagify) and refine WP Rocket settings.

o Draft lead magnets or technical content updates.

• Hour 8: Reporting & Strategy (The Close)

o Analyze daily KPIs and update project boards.

o Set priorities for the next 24 hours.

o Submit EOD Progress Report.

________________________________________

IV. Immediate Focus: Rank Math Integration and other software.

As part of the onboarding, the specialist will utilize the provided course to master Schema Markup and rank math. This will transform the website from a simple "brochure" into a data-rich entity that Google prioritizes in Local Search.

title: Multiple Client Controller
description:
Remote Controller – Real Estate Portfolio Clients

BEC CFO & CPA

Full-Time | Overseas | Remote

About BEC CFO & CPA

BEC CFO & CPA is a U.S.-based accounting and advisory firm specializing in real estate entrepreneurs and investor-driven businesses. Our clients operate across fix-and-flips, rental portfolios, wholesaling, novation deals, seller financing, and multi-entity structures.

We deliver more than bookkeeping. Our team provides structured, decision-ready financials that allow clients to understand profitability, cash flow, investor obligations, and risk—without needing to manage accounting complexity themselves.

________________________________________

Position Overview

The Remote Controller is a full-time member of the BEC CFO & CPA team who provides part-time controller-level services across a portfolio of assigned real estate clients.

This role sits between bookkeeping and CFO advisory and is responsible for financial accuracy, balance sheet integrity, reporting clarity, and process documentation. The Controller ensures financials are correct, explainable, scalable, and repeatable before being escalated to CFO-level discussions.

This role does not involve routine data entry. It is a review-, analysis-, and systems-driven position.

________________________________________

Core Responsibilities

1. Portfolio-Level Financial Oversight

• Act as Controller for a portfolio of real estate clients on a part-time allocation basis

• Review monthly bookkeeping completed by internal teams for accuracy and completeness

• Identify, correct, and document errors, misclassifications, and structural issues

• Ensure financials are client-ready and CFO-ready

2. Real Estate Accounting Expertise

• Oversee accounting for:

o Fix & flip projects

o Rental portfolios

o Wholesale and assignment transactions

o Novation deals

o Subject-to and seller-financed arrangements

• Ensure proper tracking of:

o Property-level income and expenses

o Rehab and construction costs

o Investor contributions, distributions, and liabilities

o Loans payable, accrued interest, and equity balances

3. Balance Sheet & Structural Integrity

• Maintain clean, supportable balance sheets across multiple entities

• Review and manage:

o Intercompany transactions

o Due to / Due from accounts

o Investor capital and liability accounts

• Identify structural weaknesses and recommend corrective entries or workflow changes

4. Advanced Excel & Financial Analysis

• Use advanced Excel skills to:

o Analyze large transaction datasets

o Build and maintain reconciliation workpapers

o Create review checklists, pivot tables, and exception reports

o Support cleanup projects and historical corrections

• Translate Excel-based analysis into actionable accounting adjustments and insights

5. SOP Documentation & Process Development

• Create and maintain clear, repeatable Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for:

o Recurring accounting workflows

o Client-specific nuances

o Real estate transaction treatments

• Document judgment calls and accounting logic so work can be consistently replicated

• Identify opportunities to standardize processes across clients and teams

6. Reporting & Client Readiness

• Review and finalize monthly financial packages

• Ensure reports are:

o Accurate

o Timely

o Understandable for non-accountant business owners

• Proactively flag risks, trends, or data gaps

7. Client & Internal Collaboration

• Serve as the controller-level escalation point for assigned clients

• Clearly explain financial outcomes and issues when needed

• Coordinate with Accounting Managers, Bookkeepers, and QC Specialists

• Support CFO-level conversations by ensuring financial data is defensible

8. Quality Control & Continuous Improvement

• Adhere to internal SOPs, QC standards, and documentation requirements

• Identify recurring issues and propose efficiency or quality improvements

• Ensure all work meets BEC CFO & CPA quality benchmarks before client delivery

________________________________________

Required Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

• 5+ years of progressive accounting experience

• Strong command of:

o Accrual accounting

o Balance sheet management

o Reconciliations and adjusting entries

• Exceptional Excel skills, including:

o Pivot tables

o Lookups (XLOOKUP / VLOOKUP)

o Complex reconciliations

o Large dataset analysis

• Demonstrated ability to create clear SOPs and process documentation

• Advanced proficiency in QuickBooks Online

• Proven experience reviewing and correcting the work of others

________________________________________

Preferred Experience

• Real estate accounting experience (strongly preferred)

• Experience supporting multiple clients simultaneously

• Prior Controller, Senior Accountant, or Accounting Manager role

• Experience with investor-funded or multi-entity businesses

• Experience working remotely with U.S.-based clients

________________________________________

Skills & Professional Attributes

• Strong analytical thinking and sound judgment

• Systems-oriented mindset with documentation discipline

• High attention to detail and accountability

• Clear, professional written and verbal communication

• Ability to manage multiple client priorities effectively

• Comfortable working independently within structured workflows

________________________________________

Work Structure & Expectations

• Full-time remote position

• Provides part-time controller services to multiple clients

• Assigned a defined client portfolio with structured capacity expectations

• Required overlap with U.S. business hours

• Performance measured by accuracy, clarity, timeliness, documentation quality, and client confidence

________________________________________

Why Join BEC CFO & CPA

• Exposure to sophisticated real estate accounting across diverse client portfolios

• Strong internal structure, SOPs, and leadership support

• A firm culture that values quality, clarity, and accountability

• Opportunity to grow into senior controller or advisory leadership roles

title: Product Research Analyst
description:
ABOUT US:

BIFL is a profitable US e-commerce company selling high-quality, durable products on Amazon, Walmart, and eBay. We're growing fast and need a Product Research Analyst to find profitable products and analyze market trends. You'll work with a small team, earn competitive salary, receive fully paid training, and have clear opportunities to advance to senior positions.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Product Research: Research Amazon, Walmart, and other platforms for items with strong demand and low competition.

2. Purchasing Research: Research retail websites for sales, clearance, and liquidation to identify low-priced products to buy.

3. Competitive Analysis: Analyze competitor pricing, reviews, product specs, and sales velocity to determine profitability.

4. Data Analysis: Use AzInsight, Keepa, Sellify, and Marter to calculate profitability and predict pricing trends.

5. Reporting: Document findings in spreadsheets with clear recommendations on whether products are worth sourcing.



HARD SKILLS (TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS):

- Proficiency with Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, formulas, data visualization)

- Ability to read and interpret charts, graphs, and data visualizations

- Fluent written English (ability to document findings clearly)

- Familiarity with e-commerce platforms (Amazon, eBay, Walmart) OR willingness to learn quickly

- Analytical mindset (background in engineering, data analysis, accounting, or similar fields preferred but not required)



SOFT SKILLS (BEHAVIORAL REQUIREMENTS):

- Detail-oriented and accurate with data entry and analysis

- Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision

- Deadline-driven and able to manage multiple research projects simultaneously

- Patient and methodical (product research involves repetitive analysis)

- Responsive to feedback and willing to adapt methodology based on guidance



TRAINING PROVIDED:

- We provide comprehensive paid training on product research tools, our analysis methodology, and marketplace seller strategies. You don't need prior e-commerce experience—just analytical thinking and a willingness to learn.



TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:

- Desktop or laptop computer with a mouse (not a trackpad-only device)

- Stable, high-speed internet connection (recommended: 5+ Mbps)

- Google Chrome or Firefox web browser

- Backup plan for internet outages (e.g., mobile hotspot, nearby internet cafe)

- Headphones for training sessions and communication

- Quiet, distraction-free workspace



Preferred:

- Dual monitors (increases research efficiency)





COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:

- Starting salary: 32,000 PHP/month (~$550 USD) for full-time (40 hours/week)

- Commission/Performance-based bonuses after 90 days based on productivity

- Career path: Advance to Senior Researcher (40K-50K PHP/month) in 12 months with strong performance.

- Paid Time Off: 21 guaranteed days + up to 10 additional days earned through performance.

- 13th month bonus (pro-rated based on hire date)

- Paid training period during first 4 weeks



SCHEDULE:

Monday-Friday, 8:00 PM - 4:00 AM Manila Time

We understand this is an evening shift in the Philippines and appreciate the scheduling to interact with our U.S. tea
mbers.



In your application, please include:

- Confirm availability: State clearly that you can commit to 40 hours/week, Monday-Friday, 8PM-4AM Manila Time.

- Current employment: Are you currently working elsewhere? If so, explain how you'll manage both jobs without overlap.

- Screening task (required): Put your favorite color in the Subject line



To ensure we review your application promptly, please use OnlineJobs.ph's messaging system. We don't monitor
 for job applications.

title: Outbound Phone Sales Representative
description:
We are seeking a motivated, confident, and results-driven Outbound Phone Sales Representative to conduct high-volume cold call outreach to businesses in the USA.

In this role, your primary objective is to identify decision-makers, qualify opportunities by generating interest in our products and services, and book or hand off sales-ready leads to our team.

This position is ideal for someone who is confident on the phone, thrives on targets, and can demonstrate success in outbound cold-calling roles. If you are hungry, persuasive, and excel in a fast-paced sales environment, this opportunity is for you.



What You’ll Be Doing

• Make high-volume outbound cold calls daily to clinics and healthcare facilities. 

• Navigate gatekeepers to consistently reach decision-makers, including:

Administrator / Executive Director

Procurement or Purchasing Manager

Director of Care (DOC)

Director of Nursing

Office Administrator

• Generate interest and position our company as a trusted supplier

• Book meetings and create handoffs for the closer or account executive

• Maintain accurate and detailed CRM records including notes, follow-ups, and lead status

• Schedule meetings using a shared calendar aligned with executive availability

• Follow up professionally via phone, voi
, and

• Learn and clearly communicate product positioning and value relevant to Canadian healthcare settings

• Arrive on time and maintain consistent daily activity

• Work Monday to Friday, 8 AM to 5 PM EST



Requirements

• Minimum 2 years of outbound phone sales experience (cold calling required; B2B healthcare a strong asset)

• Proven results supported by metrics (meetings booked, connect rates, conversions, pipeline influenced)

• Confident phone presence with strong objection-handling skills

• Comfortable with rejection and maintaining daily consistency

• Experience reaching decision-makers and managing multi-touch follow-up

• Ability to quickly learn and explain products in a regulated or clinical environment

• Highly organized and capable of managing a pipeline independently

• Strong English communication skills (spoken and written)

• Comfortable handling voice calls and speaking with business owners

• Reliable high-speed internet connection

• Self-motivated and results-driven



Preferred (Nice to Have)

• Experience selling into clinics, LTC facilities, pharmacies, or healthcare environments

• Experience with CRMs and dialers (HubSpot, Salesforce, Zoho, etc.)

• Familiarity with healthcare purchasing environments, group purchasing, or RFP processes



Skills & Traits We’re Looking For

• Competitive, resilient, and consistent

• Clear and professional communicator

• Strong time management and follow-through

• Curious and coachable mindset

• Comfortable improving scripts and objection handling over time



Work Setup

• Remote work (home office required)

• Quiet work environment

• Late-model computer

• Noise cancelling headsets

• hands-free headset

• High-speed internet required

• Availability during U.S. business hours when needed

• You will be required to use a screen tracking software will be used



Compensation

• Starting Base Salary: $35,000 PHP/month

• Commission/Benefits/Salary Raise: Available after 3-month probation period

• Unlimited earning potential based on performance



How to Apply:

• You must submit a recent copy of your CV

• You must submit a 3–5-minute recording of why you feel you would be the best applicant for this positon.

title: Civil Engineer - Land Development
description: Position Description: USA/State of Florida based Engineering office is seeking a Civil Engineer to work on Land Development engineering projects. Candidates should have experience with site civil design and permitting and applicable software applications including site, grading, utility and hydrology modeling programs, storm drainage programs, AutoCAD, and Civil 3D. Projects will include a variety of land development site designs. In addition to strong technical experience, other responsibilities will include research, coordination, cost estimating, permitting for land disturbance and preparation of bid packages as well as technical specifications. Position Requirements: - Minimum 3 years experience working on land development projects in the United States - BS degree in Civil Engineering - Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills - Outstanding organizational skills - Strong sense of urgency and self-initiative to meet client deadlines - Ability to work both independently and as part of a team - Ability to manage multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously - High level of proficiency in AutoCAD Civil 3D Desired Qualifications: - Experience with detail site layout and grading; drainage and stormwater management design; utility design; and erosion and sediment control design - Experience with codes and regulations, interpreting plans, designing stormwater facilities, site grading and permitting for land disturbance Qualifications Education Required Bachelors or better in Civil Engineering or related field. Ideally the candidate can work USA EST time zone 8 am - 5 PM EST

title: VA + Sales ($1,500+ Monthly)
description:
Right off the bat, we're paying a much higher rate than normal for a VA. Which means we are looking for someone in the top 10% of VA's. Please don't apply if you can't perform at the level we are expecting.



I own a pickleball coaching company in the US.



We:



1) help people get introduced to pickleball through our beginner clinics.

2) help people who already play pickleball get better at pickleball through lessons



I am looking for an assistant to do the tasks I am currently doing so I can free up my time to coach more lessons instead of doing admin tasks. As well as for me to get to spend more time to train and be with my family.



In order to do well at this job you need:



1) Attention to detail. If you aren't good at this, please don't apply. We are providing a higher than normal rate for a VA to get someone who is very good at this job. Attention to details are essential. If you aren't good at this, don't apply. It will be obvious.

2) A great attitude. I know people say this all the time but you will need a great, can-do attitude. Otherwise, this won't be a good fit.

3) Strong work ethic. If you're not a hard worker, again, it will be obvious.

4) Energetic. You will be talking to and helping customers a lot over the phone. If they can't feel your energy and excitement to help them, you're not a good fit.

5) Professional. This is a business. You need to be professional and represent the company well when speaking with customers.

6) Punctual. If you're not on time, keeping up with tasks, calling people, etc. this is definitely not the job for you. And this isn't the job to learn this skill on. If you're not punctual there are so many tasks that will expose this. And it won't be good for either of us and will waste both of our time.

7) Highly organized with excellent time management skills.

8) Speak Native English. You don't need to be a native of the US. But you need to speak English so well that you could be. When someone calls in they need to not be able to tell you're not from the US. We want them to feel like you actually live in the US and can help them. You need to know American vernacular, slang, etc. and be able to speak the language flawlessly. Again, if you can't do this it will be noticeable.

9) Write English well. You'll also have to text a lot. So written skills are a must as well.



You would be responsible for doing the things I'm doing currently:



Sales

We have people call in and text in a lot about pickleball lessons. We run a lot of marketing including ads. You need to be able to speak to these leads on the phone and help them. When you’re doing sales for us, you’re really just being helpful. But you do need to know how to overcome objections, talk about benefits, build rapport, etc. You also need to know how to set follow ups in CRM’s and follow up with them on time, when appropriate, etc.



Post Lesson Management

When our coaches give a lesson, there’s post lesson work to do like scheduling the next lesson for the students who are taking another lesson, following up with the students who aren’t taking the next lesson and see about getting them into another lesson soon, follow up with the ones who weren’t sure about taking the next lesson and talk to them about it, and then find other students in our CRM wanting to take a lesson that could fill the spots.

You’ll also need to help do the admin tasks of the post lesson work like scheduling the next lesson in our scheduling software, scheduling a court with the facility, checking the students paid, tagging me to do payment deposits for the next lesson, and other things.



Student Management

There’s also other things you’ll need to do to make sure the business is running smooth like answering calls from existing students and helping them with anything they need, students cancelling and rescheduling, them asking when their next lesson is, etc.



Marketing

From time to time I will need help with marketing. Including
 management, blog post management (I’ll probably write most of these, I just need you to collect some data for me to put in there, so you’ll be doing research), newsletter management eventually, etc.



Reporting

I’ll also have you do some financial reporting as well most likely. But I’ll set you up for success on how to do this.



And anything else

There will be a lot of other things I’m sure that come up. Your job is just to help me make this thing run.



You're basically a VA/Sales/Scheduling/Customer Support/Marketing/General Tasks/Rock Star.



You're a suped up front desk person that does it all with a can-do attitude that supports me as the owner and our coaches in critical tasks.



Things you need to know:

- We are going to ask you to learn pickleball. The more you know and have experienced pickleball the more passionate, helpful, and equipped you are to help us run this business. Yes, this means you are going to get involved in pickleball where you live and we will pay you to do so. You’re also going to be watching pickleball a lot during your down time. Again, we want you to immerse yourself in the game. And you’ll need to be watching videos and reading articles as well. Whenever there are no critical tasks and there’s a bit of free time in your work day, you’ll be using that to dive more into pickleball so you can really understand our business and be ablle to help our customers more fully.



Hours:

- Mon – Fri: 9am – 5pm EST

- Sat: On call 9am – 5pm (just need to answer phone calls to help players if they have an issue, no need to do other tasks)

- Sun: Off



60 day trial period – there will be a 60 day trial period. This will be to assess if you are truly a good fit for the role.



Questions for you to answer in your application:



1. Monthly fee you require for full time (keep in mind, if people have the same skillsets we will obviously choose the person with the more competitive rate. So, even though we are paying quite high, price yourself at what you feel comfortable making so you're competitive)?



2. At this rate you mentioned above, am I your only client?



3. At this rate you mentioned above, are you able to work 40 hours a week at a minimum and likely more?



4. Are you good with being on call on Saturday (work should be somewhat rare, it would only be tasks that need to be done that Saturday and can't be done on Monday, like if a student gets locked out of the building and calls in for help. Leads, post lesson, management, marketing, etc. can all be done Mon - Fri. On call is really just emergencies only. We want you to have work life balance.)?



5. Are you open to a few test days (you would get paid) to see if we work well together?



6. Do you play pickleball, tennis, ping pong or any other sports?



7. Why do you think you'd be a good fit for this project?



8. What makes you think you’d be good at the sales portion of the job?



9. Have you used Slack before?



10. What kind of software do you use that makes being a VA essential in your opinion?



11. Please provide a 2 minute or longer video on:



a) Your history using English

b) Any other information you think would be helpful



And that’s it!



We look forward to your applications.

title: Digital Marketing Assistant
description:
Who we are:

ColdBru is a next-gen DTC growth team that partners with DTC brands to drastically improve their growth trajectory when other options don't move the bottom line. Our purpose is to help people learn, grow and be the best versions of themselves through the journey of entrepreneurship. We are committed to being the unfair advantage behind our partner brands, and launching a group of our own brands to operate.



We value being fast, data-driven, customer-centric, and adaptable in our approach.

Simply put, ColdBru is the unfair advantage behind its partners' bottom-line growth.



What you'll do (EST time zone overlap required):

Support our growth team in the trenches of performance marketing and AI-powered customer experience optimization.



Execute day-to-day performance tracking and reposting across Meta, Google Ads, and TikTok campaigns - you'll be the one catching data discrepancies before they become problems and keeping our reporting bulletproof.



Assist with campaign setup and launches across multiple advertising channels, helping our media buyers move fast without breaking things.



Manage AI customer service tools across multiple client accounts - you'll be optimizing AI systems, reviewing AI responses for brand consistency, and escalating the complex stuff that needs human touch.



Generate performance summaries and insights that actually matter, not just vanity metrics (we're all about that bottom-line impact).



Help maintain marketing calendars, campaign schedules, and project timelines so nothing falls through the cracks.



Support various growth experiments and initiatives - when we need to test something new, you'll be right there helping make it happen.



The Growth Marketing Assistant will work closely with our media buying and growth teams.



We move fast and details matter - if a campaign is off by even 1% in tracking, you catch it. If an AI response doesn't sound like our client's brand, you fix it. You're the safety net that lets our team swing for the fences without worrying about the fundamentals. If you get this, put your go-to productivity hack in ALL CAPS in the first line of your application.



Who you are:

You have some experience in digital marketing, social media, or performance marketing and you're hungry to level up fast.



You're obsessed with getting things right the first time and have an eye for details that others miss. You can juggle multiple projects without dropping the ball and actually enjoy the puzzle of troubleshooting data discrepancies.



You're looking to learn from a world-class team and want hands-on experience with the tools and strategies that drive real growth at scale.



Nice To Have/Bonus Skills:

- Experience with Google Analytics,
 
, or other marketing analytics tools

- Familiarity with AI customer service platforms or chatbot management

- Knowledge of Google Ads, TikTok Ads, or other advertising platforms beyond Meta

- Experience with project management tools (Asana, 
, Notion)

- Basic understanding of marketing automation



Where we're going:

We're a team of handpicked individuals hell-bent on profitable growth for the sake of it, we get up in the morning energized to crack the latest growth problems wide open just cause it sounds fun. We wouldn't settle for anything less and don't take 'No' for an answer. No task is too big or too small, if it's needed to achieve profitable growth we find a way to do it or get it done. We aren't on a hiring spree and will only onboard someone on the same wavelength. That being said, if you think you can outperform and don't have all the experience above, we're open to chatting - ownership and follow-through are what we really care about.



Benefits:

Learn from a world-class team leading the space

In 6 months you'll learn more than other people learn in 3 years

Essentially unlimited self-improvement budget (online courses, and other educational experiences)

Retreats

Flexible working hours

Flexibility to work from anywhere in the world (need to overlap with PST work hours)

Performance incentives

A coffee stipend, if you work at ColdBru you don't pay for coffee. Period.

A wellness budget, we care about your physical and mental well-being, this stipend is there to help you with it, however you see fit.

No meetings Friday, and if you get all your work done by Thursday, take Friday afternoon off!



To apply
 
 & put coffee as your word to be considered
