title: Accounting Clerk – (AR/AP Support) *DIRECT HIRE*
description:
Do not apply unless you can work CST work schedule.



Must have accounting experience!



Job Summary:

We are seeking a diligent and detail-oriented Accounting Clerk to join our client services team. This role will focus on supporting Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, and Month-End accounting activities for multiple clients. The ideal candidate will be responsible for executing day-to-day transactional accounting functions and ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of financial information, including reconciliations, payment processing, and collections.

This is a client-facing support role within a fast-paced outsourced accounting environment, requiring a high level of organization, communication, and integrity.



Key Responsibilities:

Accounts Receivable (AR):

• Generate and send invoices on behalf of clients.

• Record and post cash receipts accurately into accounting systems.

• Process and apply credit card payments.

• Conduct collection follow-ups and track outstanding balances.

• Maintain AR aging reports and escalate issues as needed.



Accounts Payable (AP):

• Post supplier/vendor invoices to appropriate accounts and periods.

• Reconcile vendor statements and resolve discrepancies.

• Prepare and execute scheduled payment runs (checks, ACH, wires).

• Actively follow up with clients or vendors to request missing bills.

• Ensure job completion entries are accurate in the accounting system.



Monthly Accounting Activities:

• Complete and review bank reconciliations and credit card reconciliations.

• Perform Syncore bank reconciliation and assist with month-end close in Syncore.

• Reconcile client QuickBooks data with Syncore to ensure accuracy.

• Investigate and resolve variances between systems or transactions.

• Assist with general ledger adjustments and journal entries as required.





Please record a video of yourself answering the questions listed below.

1. What are the top two strengths you believe every virtual accountant should have?

2. Can you walk me through how you prioritize tasks when supporting multiple clients or managing competing deadlines?

3. What challenges have you faced in your role as an accountant, and how have you dealt with them?



Please ensure that you include the links to both your video and resume in your cover letter.



Thank you!

title: Creative Strategist
description:
???? Who Are We?

Hey there!

We’re a fast-growing eCommerce brand group operating multiple Shopify stores and scaling aggressively across the US and Europe with high-performing Meta 
 & Instagram) ads.

We’re not an agency.

We own the brands.

That means ideas move fast, get tested with real traffic, and scale based on performance—not opinions.

We’re expanding our creative team and looking for a Senior Performance Creative Strategist to help turn attention into measurable results at scale.

???? The Role – What You’ll Own

As our Creative Strategist, you’ll own the performance creative engine of the brand.

Your focus is ads:

UGC-style, direct-response creatives

Hooks, angles, messaging, and structure

Testing, iteration, and scaling loops

You’ll work closely with media buyers, editors, and creators to ensure our creatives don’t just look good—but perform.

???? Who This Is NOT For

This role is not for you if:

You’ve never worked on high-performing paid ads for Shopify-based eCommerce brands

You’re junior or still learning the basics of Meta ads

You only write copy but don’t analyze performance data

You rely fully on others to tell you what to create

You’re uncomfortable with fast iteration, ownership, and accountability

This is a senior, performance-driven seat.

???? Who We’re Looking For

You’re a strong fit if you:

Write killer ad scripts tailored to awareness levels

Know how to guide UGC creators, influencers, and video editors

Can reverse-engineer winning ads by reading the data

Understand psychology, storytelling, and persuasion

Think in hooks, angles, retention, and iteration

Translate data into clear creative actions

Take ownership of outcomes—not just tasks

Are disciplined, fast, and process-oriented

???? What You Bring

3–5+ years experience in creative strategy & copywriting (DTC or agency)

A portfolio of high-performing Meta ads

Strong understanding of consumer psychology

Experience working with influencer content, UGC, and editing teams

Comfort managing or contributing to $300K+/month ad accounts

Ability to collaborate cross-functionally and work independently

???? Your Day-to-Day Responsibilities

Develop creative briefs aligned with product goals and audience psychology

Research competitors, analyze account performance, identify hooks & angles

Write ad copy for video, static, and carousel formats

Build storyboards and creative outlines for production

Guide influencer recordings (A-roll / B-roll) and give revision feedback

Collaborate with editors to refine execution

Analyze performance data (CTR, hold rate, CPA, ROAS)

Propose, test, and iterate new creative formats continuously

???? Why Join Us?

???? We’re brand owners your ideas go live fast

???? Creative work here directly impacts revenue

???? Remote-first, high-performance culture

???? Unlimited paid training, mentorship, and resources

???? Access to Loom libraries, templates, and AI tools

???? Paid vacation after 1 year

No bloated teams.

No endless meetings.

Just clarity, execution, and iteration.

???? Hiring Process

We move fast and respect your time:

1?? Loom video – introduce yourself and your experience

2?? Short creative task

3?? Interview & offer

???? What’s Next?

If this role resonates, choose ONE core value below and include its number in your application:

CORE VALUES

1?? Results Obsessed

2?? Attention to Detail

3?? Accelerated Excellence

4?? Relentless Ownership

5?? Prepared to Win

6?? Collaborative Innovation

7?? Never Not Growing

Apply now—and let’s build ads that actually convert. ????



Performance Creative Strategist – Pre-Screening Questions



1- How many years of professional experience do you have in creative strategy for performance marketing?

(Multiple choice)

0–1





2–3





4–5





6+



2- How many years of 

hands-on experience creating or managing Meta 
 & Instagram) ads do you have?

(Multiple choice)

0–1

2–3

4–5

6+



3- Have you owned or led a creative strategy for a performance-driven DTC brand or agency account?

(Yes / No)



4- What was the largest monthly ad spend you’ve actively worked on?

(Multiple choice)

Under $50K

$50K–$150K

$150K–$300K

$300K+



5- Which best describes your creative workflow?

(Multiple choice)



I mainly execute briefs given to me

I contribute ideas but don’t own results

I analyze performance data and proactively propose new creatives

I fully own creative testing, iteration, and scaling decisions



6- Briefly describe a winning ad or creative concept you worked on and  what data signaled it was working 

(Short answer – 3–5 sentences max)





7- Do you have prior experience advertising products in the wellness or lifestyle space?

(Yes / No)

(Optional – nice to have)





8- Which KPI do you prioritize FIRST when evaluating a new creative? Why?





Please answer all questions carefully. Short, clear, and honest answers are appreciated.

title: Senior Media Buyer – Performance Marketing Lead (Meta & Paid Social)
description:
Senior Media Buyer – Performance Marketing Lead (Meta & Paid Social)



## Overview



We are seeking a highly strategic, senior-level Media Buyer with deep expertise in Meta advertising to lead paid acquisition efforts across live events, info products, high-ticket offers, and e-commerce campaigns.



This is not an entry-level execution role. We are looking for a performance leader who understands full-funnel economics, scaling frameworks, creative testing methodology, attribution strategy, and revenue forecasting.



The ideal candidate has managed significant ad spend, understands aggressive scaling environments, and can think beyond campaign setup into business-level growth strategy.



---



## Core Responsibilities



### 1. Strategic Campaign Leadership



* Architect, launch, and scale Meta campaigns across cold, warm, and retargeting funnels.

* Develop scalable acquisition strategies for:



  * Live events (virtual and in-person)

  * Challenges and launches

  * High-ticket backend offers

  * E-commerce initiatives

* Own CPA, CPL, ROAS, and overall funnel profitability.



### 2. Performance Optimization & Scaling



* Monitor performance daily and make data-backed optimization decisions.

* Lead structured creative testing frameworks (angles, hooks, formats, offers).

* Scale winning campaigns while protecting margins.

* Identify bottlenecks in funnel performance and collaborate cross-functionally to improve conversion rates.



### 3. Data & Attribution Oversight



* Ensure accurate tracking implementation (Meta Pixel, Conversions API, custom events).

* Oversee setup and validation via:



  * Meta Events Manager

  * Google Tag Manager

  * GA4

  * Third-party attribution tools (Hyros or similar)

* Interpret cross-platform data to identify real performance drivers.

* Build forecasting models based on blended CAC and LTV.



### 4. Reporting & Executive Communication



* Deliver weekly and monthly performance reports with strategic insights.

* Provide clear recommendations for:



  * Budget reallocation

  * Creative direction

  * Funnel adjustments

  * Scaling decisions

* Communicate performance at a business level, not just platfor
trics.



### 5. Cross-Department Collaboration



* Work closely with:



  * Creative team (ad hooks, UGC, video frameworks)

  * Funnel team (landing page optimization)

  * Sales team (lead quality feedback loop)

* Translate data insights into creative and messaging improvements.



### 6. Platform & Industry Mastery



* Stay ahead of:



  * Meta algorithm shifts

  * Policy updates

  * Creative trends

  * AI-based optimization tools

* Implement advanced scaling methods including cost cap, bid strategies, and audience expansion models.



---



## Requirements



* 5+ years experience managing Meta paid media.

* Experience managing $25K+ per month in ad spend (preferred $50K+).

* Proven track record scaling live event, launch, or high-ticket funnels.

* Strong understanding of funnel economics and customer acquisition strategy.

* Deep knowledge of:



  * Meta Ads Manager

  * GA4

  * GTM

  * Conversions API

* Advanced analytical and forecasting capability.

* Experience operating in performance-driven, fast-paced environments.



---



## Preferred Experience



* Experience scaling info product or coaching brands.

* Experience in event-based marketing funnels.

* Familiarity with GoHighLevel, ClickFunnels, or similar ecosystems.

* Knowledge of creative strategy and direct-response frameworks.

* Experience leading junior media buyers or contractors.



---



## What Success Looks Like in This Role



* Consistent improvement in CPA and ROAS.

* Scalable creative testing systems implemented.

* Clear attribution visibility across funnel.

* Predictable lead flow for events and backend offers.

* Strategic recommendations that directly impact revenue growth.

title: Experienced Video Editor
description:
I’m looking for a skilled Video Editor to work on longform YouTube lore content (story-driven, immersive, high-retention videos).



What to send when you D
:



- Your portfolio (required)

- A brief summary of your editing experience

- Your topic interests (lore, gaming, sci-fi, fantasy, horror, history, etc.)



Based on your portfolio and interests, you’ll be assigned to one of my channels that best fits your style.



Important: Messages without a portfolio and topic interests will be ignored. Either DaVinci Resolve or Premiere Pro is required.



If you love storytelling through editing and understand YouTube pacing, I want to hear from you.

description:

- Edit longform, story-driven lore videos

- Focus on pacing, atmosphere, and viewer retention

- Work on one of multiple YouTube lore channels

- Strong sense of storytelling and rhythm

title: Call Center Agent
description:
Join Our Team as a Call Center Agent!



Do you love talking to people and get *thrilled* at the thought of changing lives? Do you feel energized helping others achieve their goals while working hard to reach as many people as possible every day? If this sounds like you, keep reading!



We are looking for a dynamic Inside Sales Agent to join our digital marketing agency, which focuses on serving small businesses. As an extension of our clients, you'll be calling and texting prospects, booking appointments, and getting them excited about changing their lives. This is a remote position, requiring fluent, native English proficiency, and a clear accent. We prefer candidates with 2-3 years of call center experience who excel in both written and verbal communication and possess exceptional technological skills.

title: Senior Performance Media Buyer (Meta-Focused) – Lead Generation & Sales Scaling
description:
We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Performance Media Buyer with a proven track record of scaling lead generation and online sales campaigns, with primary expertise in Meta Ads 
 & Instagram). MUST HAVE EXCELLENT ENGLISH SPEAKING AND WRITTING SKILLS.



This role is for a strategic manager—not a beginner media buyer. You must have recent, hands-on experience launching, optimizing, and scaling Meta campaigns under current platform best practices (Advantage+ structures, creative testing frameworks, conversion tracking, etc.).



Google PPC experience is required as a secondary platform. Experience with TikTok, LinkedIn, and other paid acquisition channels is strongly preferred.



Key Responsibilities:

-Plan, launch, and scale Meta ad campaigns for lead generation and direct response sales

-Build and optimize campaign structures using modern Meta best practices (Advantage+ campaigns, CBO, broad targeting, creative iteration systems)

-Develop and test ad creatives (graphics and video concepts), ad copy, and hooks aligned with specific offers

-Optimize funnels for performance (CTR, CPL, CPA, ROAS, CVR)

-Analyze data daily and make structured optimization decisions

-Set up proper tracking: Meta Pixel, Conversion API, custom events, UTM tracking

-Build and manage Google PPC campaigns (Search, Display, YouTube) to support overall acquisition strategy

-Collaborate on offer positioning and landing page optimization

-Scale winning campaigns while maintaining efficiency targets

-Provide clear performance reporting and actionable insights



This role requires someone who understands how to turn cold traffic into leads and customers profitably, not just someone who can “run ads.”



Required Experience

-5+ years running Meta Ads at scale

-Demonstrated experience managing at least $5K–$20K+ USD monthly ad spend

-Proven success scaling campaigns beyond initial testing phase

-Deep understanding of:

-Conversion optimization

-Creative testing frameworks

-Campaign budget optimization (CBO/Advantage+)

-Audience expansion strategies

-Retargeting structures

-Attribution and tracking setup

-Hands-on experience with Google Ads (Search required; Display/YouTube preferred)

-Strong analytical skills (CTR, CPC, CPA, ROAS analysis)

-Experience working with funnels, webinars, info offers, e-commerce, or lead gen businesses preferred

- MUST HAVE EXCELLENT ENGLISH SPEAKING AND WRITTING SKILLS



Can grow to a FULL TIME job quickly.

title: Webflow Developer
description:
About Us

Junk Punks is a fast-growing junk removal company operating across multiple U.S. markets. We are focused on building strong local brands through high-converting websites, SEO, and professional online presence. We are looking for a skilled Webflow Editor to help improve our website and build optimized location pages.



Job Overview

We are hiring a detail-oriented and experienced Webflow Editor to help manage, improve, and scale our website. Your main responsibility will be creating and optimizing location-based service pages using a proven template to support our expansion.

Once the template is finalized, you will be responsible for consistently producing high-quality city and county pages.



Key Responsibilities

Edit and manage pages in Webflow

Create SEO-optimized location and service pages

Build pages using existing templates

Improve layout, spacing, mobile responsiveness, and UI

Optimize page speed and structure

Format content for readability and conversions

Upload images, update text, and organize site sections

Follow branding and style guidelines

Work closely with management to implement updates



Required Qualifications

Proven experience using Webflow

Experience editing and building service business websites (home services preferred)

Strong understanding of SEO basics for location pages

Good English writing and editing skills

Attention to detail

Ability to follow templates and systems

Reliable internet and availability



Preferred Qualifications (Bonus)

Experience with junk removal, landscaping, cleaning, or home services websites

Understanding of local SEO

Experience with schema markup

Basic graphic editing skills (Canva/Photoshop)

Familiarity with Webflow CMS



What We Offer

Consistent long-term work

Clear systems and templates

Opportunity for pay increases based on performance

Growth opportunities within our company

Stable weekly hours



Work Schedule

Flexible hours

Minimum 15–25 hours per week

Potential for full-time based on performance



Pay

$5 per hour (starting rate)

Performance-based raises available

title: SOCIAL MEDIA & YOUTUBE MARKETING MANAGER (REAL ESTATE)
description:

Our goal is to grow a strong personal brand on:



- Instagram

- YouTube

-

title: Social Media & YouTube Marketing Manager (Real Estate)
description:
We’re looking for a strategic Social Media & YouTube Marketing Manager, not just a content poster.



This is a long-term, full-time role for someone who understands brand building, YouTube growth, video strategy, ads, and AI-powered marketing—someone who can think ahead, analyze data, and help grow a recognizable real estate brand with minimal supervision.



This role is not task-based. You will own the marketing direction, especially for YouTube and social platforms.



CORE FOCUS AREAS (VERY IMPORTANT)

- Brand Building – 60%

- Video Editing & Content Execution – 30%

- Other - 10%



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



1. YouTube

YouTube is our #1 growth channel.

You will be responsible for end-to-end YouTube management, including:



Long-form YouTube Content:

- Create high-converting thumbnails

- Write SEO-optimized titles, descriptions, and tags

- Use VidIQ for keyword research, optimization, and competitive analysis

- Upload, schedule, and publish videos

- Track performance, analytics, CTR, watch time, retention, and growth

- Continuously improve content based on data



YouTube Shorts:

- Repurpose long-form content into Shorts

- Edit, format, caption, and schedule Shorts

- Optimize hooks, pacing, and visuals for engagement



YouTube Ad

- Manage YouTube ad campaigns

- Support creative testing, hooks, thumbnails, and targeting

- Monitor performance and suggest improvements



2. Instagram &

You’ll manage and grow our presence across Meta platforms with a marketing-first mindset, not just posting.

- Create and edit Reels (intermediate level required)

- Design and schedule posts, carousels, and stories

- Write captions with strong hooks and CTAs

- Applicants must use Real Estate SMM

- Boost posts and manage sponsored content

- Handle Meta Ads at an intermediate level:

· Campaign setup

· Scheduling

· Basic optimization and monitoring

- Ensure consistency in branding, tone, and visuals



3. Google Presence & Analytics

- Manage Google My Business:

· Posts

· Updates

· Reviews

· Products/services

- Monitor Google Analytics and performance data

- Track how content and traffic support brand visibility and lead generation



4. Marketing Manager Responsibilities

You are not just executing — you are thinking like a manager.

- Plan content calendars aligned with business goals

- Propose campaigns and growth ideas

- Analyze what’s working and what’s not

- Report insights clearly and simply

- Coordinate with leadership on strategy and priorities



5. AI & Innovation

We expect you to use AI intelligently, not blindly.

- Use tools like ChatGPT, Canva AI, AI video tools, etc.

- Speed up workflows while maintaining quality

- Suggest better systems, tools, and processes

- Stay updated on trends in AI, marketing, and content creation



BASIC REQUIREMENTS

- Minimum 2 years of experience in Social Media Marketing or Digital Marketing

- Real estate experience is a strong advantage

- Proven experience managing YouTube channels

- Strong understanding of branding and content strategy

- Intermediate video editing skills (Reels, Shorts)

- Intermediate experience with Meta Ads

- Comfortable working independently with minimal supervision

- Strong communication, organization, and time management skills



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR

- Someone who thinks strategically

- Someone who understands YouTube as a growth engine

- Someone who cares about branding, consistency, and results

- Someone who takes ownership and doesn’t wait for instructions



- This role is not for beginners

- This role is not for task-only executors



COMPANY OVERVIEW

We are a BC, Canada–based real estate team focused on modern marketing, strong branding, and long-term growth. We value ownership, creativity, and people who think ahead.



HOW TO APPLY

To apply, please:

Send your resume / CV

Include portfolio links:

YouTube channels managed

Don't use "Rockstar VA" in your application. Read carefully again to find the correct term to use.

Thumbnails you’ve created

Reels / Shorts

Ads or campaigns you’ve worked on



We’re not looking for “just an SMM.”

We’re looking for someone who can build a brand and grow an audience.



- IMPORTANT: SKILLS TEST / TRIAL TASK -

We’ve hired many SMMs before, and not everyone performs at the level they claim.

Because of this, we will hire based on performance, not interviews.

Shortlisted applicants will complete a practical test.

The fastest and highest-quality submission will be hired.

title: Paid Ads Specialist
description:
ABOUT ERPS GROUP



ERPS Group is a high-level financial and business advisory firm helping medical and wellness practice owners build wealth strategically. We specialize in tax strategy, financial structuring, and business optimization.



We are scaling aggressively — and we need a performance-driven Meta Ads Specialist who understands how to generate qualified leads at scale.



This is not a beginner role.

This is for someone who lives inside Meta Ads Manager.



ROLE OVERVIEW



We are looking for a highly specialized Meta Ads Manager expert who can manage the full paid advertising lifecycle — from strategy and creative scripting to real-time optimization and scaling.



You will own performance.



Your job is simple:

Generate high-quality leads at profitable acquisition costs.



WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR

???? META ADS STRATEGY & EXECUTION (PRIMARY FOCUS)



• Full campaign architecture (TOF / MOF / BOF funnel design)

• Complete setup inside Meta Ads Manager (not boosting)

• Pixel, Conversion API, event tracking configuration

• Custom audiences, lookalikes, exclusions

• Retargeting sequencing based on behavior

• Creative testing frameworks

• Scaling winning ads without breaking performance



You must understand:



• Learning phase mechanics

• Budget reallocation strategy

• Campaign structure best practices (CBO vs ABO)

• Attribution settings

• Advantage+ vs manual control

• Audience expansion impact

• Daily and hourly optimization



???? PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION



You will:



• Track performance daily (and hourly when necessary)

• Monitor ROAS, CPL, CTR, CPM, Frequency

• Identify fatigue quickly

• Kill losing ads fast

• Reallocate budget aggressively to winners

• Optimize based on data — not guesswork



You must understand:



• Creative fatigue patterns

• Frequency thresholds

• Landing page conversion bottlenecks

• Audience saturation

• Scaling without spiking CPL



???? CREATIVE & SCRIPT STRATEGY



This is NOT just technical media buying.



You must:



• Write ad scripts

• Craft hooks

• Write high-converting copy

• Understand buyer psychology

• Know how to structure problem-solution ads

• Brief designers and video editors clearly



You should know how to build:



• UGC-style ads

• Authority positioning ads

• Direct response ads

• Retargeting ads

• Webinar funnels

• Lead magnet funnels



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



• 3+ years managing Meta Ads Manager at scale

• Proven ability to lower CPL and improve ROAS

• Experience running conversion-based campaigns

• Strong understanding of tracking & attribution

• Experience with lead generation funnels

• Comfort analyzing data independently



BONUS IF YOU HAVE:



• Experience in financial services or medical niche

• Experience with webinar funnels

• Experience scaling past $10K–$50K/month in ad spend



WHAT THIS ROLE IS NOT



? Not a boosting role

? Not a beginner media buyer

? Not someone who waits 7 days before optimizing

? Not someone who needs hand-holding



We move fast.

We optimize daily.

We expect performance thinking.



COMPENSATION



Full-Time

$1,500/month

Remote





WHO YOU ARE



• Analytical

• Fast-moving

• Data-driven

• Confident in decision-making

• Comfortable owning results

• Strategic, not reactive



TO APPLY



Please send:



1?? Your resume

Why you are a Meta Ads Manager expert



What results you have generated



How you approach scaling and optimization

title: Graphic Designer
description:
About the Role



We are a Canadian print and design company looking for a full-time Graphic Designer with strong experience in print production and scalable mockup creation. This role is ideal for someone who understands how designs move from concept to print and can efficiently produce reusable mockups for high-volume and repeat projects.



Responsibilities

• Prepare print-ready artwork for marketing materials, signage, packaging, and branded assets

• Create and maintain scalable mockups (templates that can be quickly adapted across sizes, locations, and variations)

• Set up files correctly for print production (bleed, trim, margins, CMYK, resolution, export settings)

• Adapt and resize designs and mockups for multiple formats and specifications

• Follow brand guidelines and ensure consistency across repeat jobs

• Handle high-volume, production-driven work with strong attention to detail

• Manage revisions, approvals, and production tasks using Notion

• Communicate clearly to ensure accuracy before files are released for print



Requirements

• 5+ years of experience in graphic or multimedia design

• Strong proficiency in Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop (InDesign a plus)

• Solid understanding of print production fundamentals

• Proven ability to create reusable, scalable mockups (not one-off designs)

• Experience working with structured brand systems

• Comfortable in deadline-driven, production-heavy workflows

• High attention to detail and quality control

• Clear written communication and reliability

• Ability to work EST hours (10:00 AM – 6:00 PM)



Nice to Have

• Large-format print or signage experience

• Packaging or promotional product mockups

• Light digital or social design support

• Experience working with international clients



What We Offer

• Stable, full-time remote role

• Clear instructions and structured workflows

• Long-term opportunity with a growing print company

• Professional, respectful working environment



How to Apply



Please include:

1. A short introduction

2. A link to your portfolio (mockups and print work preferred)

3. Your expected monthly salary

4. Confirmation of availability for EST hours

title: Commercial Insurance Service Representative
description:
Commercial Insurance Service Representative 



Company:  Ensign Partners

Location:  Remote (Philippines)

Schedule:  Full-time, Long-term role



Ensign Partners brings simplicity to complexity by integrating financial, tax, insurance, and advisory expertise under one roof. Our clients receive one coordinated plan, one trusted team, and a clear path forward.

We are a values-driven firm built on professionalism, trust, and long-term relationships. Every role at Ensign matters. We believe exceptional client experiences are created through consistency, accuracy, and people who take pride in doing things the right way.



Position Overview

Ensign Partners is seeking a detail-oriented and service-minded Commercial Insurance Service Representative to support our commercial insurance operations.



This role is responsible for servicing commercial insurance accounts, processing policy changes, preparing marketing submissions, and issuing certificates of insurance with accuracy and timeliness. You will work closely with producers, account managers, and carrier partners to ensure client needs are handled efficiently and to Ensign’s high standards.



This position is ideal for someone who values structure, ownership, precision, and being a trusted contributor within a professional team environment.



Key Responsibilities:

-Issue certificates of insurance accurately and in a timely manner

-Process endorsements, policy changes, cancellations, and reinstatements

Required Qualifications:

Why Join Ensign Partners, Ensign Partners is intentional about building a workplace where people are trusted, supported, and held to high standards. This role is essential to delivering the consistent, high-quality experience our commercial clients expect.

title: Junior Media Buyer / Google Ads Specialist
description:
Time allotment:

4-8 Hours per week to start (during the trial phase), on activities pertaining to the day-to-day management, optimization, and performance tracking of digital advertising campaigns across various Google Search and Google Social (Performance Max, Demand Gen, YouTube, Display). Bing competency is nice, but not required. 



Key Role Competencies Needed: 



Lower CPA & ROI Improvement: Through continual testing and optimization, reduce cost-per-conversion while maintaining or improving lead/conversion quality.



Actionable Insights and Up To Date On Best Practices For Google Ads: Provide the broader team with clear, data-driven insights and next-step recommendations at the end of each week and month. 1-2 narratives per month per account (and per platform).



Launch Ads With Singer Preferences: Propose and test new ideas to maintain strong performance and stay up to date with evolving platform algorithms. Minimum 1  Google snapshot report per account per month.



Tracking and Communications: All edits to client accounts must be tracked in our internal Google Sheet and communicated clearly so account managers can relay the changes to the client. 



Attention to Detail: to follow the input and directions of the ad specifications and be able to quality check. It is expected that the agent will demonstrate competency in English and spell-check submitted work. 



Setting Up Google Conversion Events Via Tag Manager / GA4: Must be proficient in not only using Google Ads Manager, but also Google Tag Manager and GA4 (Google Analytics).



Expectations:

Minimum work time allocation of 4 hours per week. This will be extended if we choose to work together after the trial phase to a minimum of 10 hours. 



Time off requests require a minimum of two weeks' notice



Tasks labeled and identified as urgent are a priority - these are tasks marked urgent in the Task Tracker spreadsheet and must be completed within 1 business day unless otherwise notified. If the agent cannot complete the task within 24 hours, it must be documented in writing to their manager (sent notification via Slack).



For an item to be urgent, management must also send a Slack message to the agent, notifying the contractor of the task and its deadline.



Present a narrative of ALL accounts advertising on Google and Bing BEFORE the end of the week, every month. No exceptions.



At MINIMUM - 2 optimization/learnings or AB tests per account that were done in the last 30 days, and WHY. What was changed, what do we hope to improve,s and what does improvement look like.



AT MINIMUM - 1 future suggestion (optimizations and/or AB test) for the month ahead. For every account with Google/Bing spend. 



Communication with Sr. Media Buyer/Manager via Slack regarding any well-being time-off and the expected return date. If illness extends beyond the expected return date, communicate the new expected return date via Slack. 



Attendance is required for four (4) monthly team calls, currently on Tuesdays.



If something is incorrect or appears to be done inefficiently, communicate that to management. 

Accountabilities:



The Junior Media Buyer must adhere to the company's privacy and data protection policies, ensuring that no sensitive data is shared outside approved channels. All information, reports, and data insights generated within this role are confidential.



Report work-related issues or questions to the Senior Media Buyer or Account Manager.



Minimum one monthly performance review per client account.



Launch, optimize, and monitor campaigns.



Bi-weekly review of search term reports and placement performance for Google Ads for new client accounts, and monthly after a client has been with Singer for (3) months.



Responsibilities:



Weekly Tasks



Performance Tracking & A/B Testing



Monitor cost-per-acquisition (CPA). This may be any single (or combination of) lead, lead magnet download,
 opt-in, or other custom events.



Monitor ongoing A/B tests (e.g., new audiences, creative variations, bid strategies) to determine what’s working and where adjustments are needed.



Issue Identification & Troubleshooting



Flag any campaigns underperforming against KPIs (e.g., low click-through rates, high CPA, limited reach).



Flag any ad policy rejections and submit appeals.



Collaborate with the Senior Media Buyer or Account Manager to recommend quick fixes or optimizations.



Documentation & Reporting



Update internal project management and CRM tools (such as our internal activity tracker) with all significant changes, findings, and next steps.



Mark all tasks completed in our internal task tracker AS THEY ARE completed. 



Use time tracking/screenshot software to track your efforts AS WELL AS fill in the Singer Time Allocation sheet at the end of each week.

Submit the invoice by the 7th of the next month, for the prior month. Invoices will be paid via Net21. 



Monthly Tasks



Performance Review & Reporting



Compile and analyze the previous month’s results, focusing on primary KPIs (e.g., cost per Qualified Prospect, cost per Prospect).



Develop or contribute to a monthly performance report, detailing successes, challenges, and recommended optimizations.

Deep-Dive Analysis



Examine secondary KPIs (e.g., click-through rate, cost-per-click, demographic metrics) to identify additional areas for improvement.



Review search term reports (for Google Ads) to add or exclude keywords as needed.



Budget & Strategy Adjustments



Evaluate whether budget shifts among platforms or campaigns are needed based on month-end data. Make recommendations to the Senior Media Buyer.



Propose changes or new tests for the upcoming month (e.g., new ad creatives, expanded audience segments).



A/B Test Results & Iteration



Assess the outcomes of the previous month’s A/B tests; roll forward winning strategies and retire underperformers.



At a minimum, 1 A/B per month per account. Action must be logged.



Tests must have follow-up/results logged.



At a minimum, 1 optimization per month per account. Action has been logged.



Document key learnings and share with the broader team to inform best practices.



To be considered for this position, please message me on OnlineJobs.ph messenging with your CV/resume, in 1-2 paragraphs why you would be well-suited for this positions and let me know your favorite dessert or baked good :) 



Assist in Reports 



Write a narrative on the accounts' performance at each time interval (mid-month, month, quarterly) as laid out in the End of Month Report Google Sheet.



3 bullets on the performance of the ad platforms over the past month. What worked, why? What didn’t why?



2 bullets on adjustments for the upcoming month



A/B test suggestion



Optimization suggestion



Creative/offer suggestions



1 bullet on which sub demos are responding / not responding



Age, gender, DMA’s, and particular ad group.



Audit Search Terms 



Monthly audit of search terms and site links for mature accounts, and bi-weekly audits for new accounts. 



Schedule & Tracking Requirements



Complete the weekly time allocation timesheet at the end of the week. 



Task tracker (Ad Activity Tracker) - This is used to prioritize your tasks and estimate time.



Time Allocation sheet (hourly tracker). Used to verifythe time to complete.



Submit the monthly invoice by the 7th of the following month.  Payment is net 21.



Be available for ad hoc calls between 9 am EST and 2 pm EST Tuesday - Thursday. Advanced notice WILL be given for these calls. 



When time-off is required, please inform the Senior Buyer two (2) weeks in advance and ensure time off is documented in the Singer “OFF” calendar



In the event of sudden illness or injury, designate someone to
 the manager or message him directly via Slack.





Payments And Payment Exceptions To Agents:



Payments can be made via “Wise,” and the employer will cover transfer fees. We can accommodate other payment platforms upon request and management approval.



Payment will be made within 21 days of the agent's submission of the monthly invoice. 



Invoices must be sent within 7 days of the prior month's end.



Late invoices will be paid on the next monthly cycle. 



We compensate for hours submitted and require time-tracking screenshots.



If there is a time discrepancy, it is at the Senior Manager's discretion. 



Agents must have written directions to go over their weekly allocated hours (8 per week to start).



Bonuses / Paid time off (PTO) are not included in this offer, but may be awarded for exceptional work and effort. 



Promotions: Singer believes in promoting from within and cross-training our support staff to improve their long-term opportunities, both inside and outside Singer. 



Our core belief: We work with real people who have lives and other responsibilities. We aim to work with all support staff to strike a balance in their own lives between Singer responsibilities and other commitments. As you grow with us, if you want more hours, let us know, and we can try to accommodate. If the reverse, and you need less, let us know. We can also respect all religious and national holidays, but must be given (2) weeks' advanced notice. 



Please allow me to respond in 2-3 business days.

title: E-Commerce Manager – Amazon, Walmart, Wayfair & Shopify and more
description:
About Us



We operate multiple product divisions with established manufacturing, strong margins, and differentiated products.



Plastair – Manufactured hose assemblies and industrial products, primarily B2B and OEM driven



DeeVa – Consumer and therapeutic products, including branded DTC and marketplace sales



PlastairFyre – Outdoor and metal products with growing ecommerce potential



These divisions already have real products, customers, and supply chains in place. What is missing is a unified, disciplined ecommerce engine that can scale profitably across marketplaces and DTC without daily owner involvement.



Role Overview



We are seeking a senior E-Commerce Manager to own and scale our ecommerce business across Amazon, Walmart, Wayfair, and Shopify. This is a management and decision-making role, not a task execution role.



You will be responsible for building and leading the ecommerce function, making commercial decisions, hiring and developing a capable team, and delivering profitable growth. You will operate with a high degree of autonomy and are expected to treat the business as if it were your own.



Core Responsibilities



Team Building and Leadership



Design the ecommerce org structure required to win across marketplaces and DTC



Hire, onboard, and manage internal tea
mbers and external specialists



Set clear roles, expectations, KPIs, and accountability for all ecommerce functions



Coach and develop the team so execution does not depend on any single person



Make hiring, performance, and replacement decisions as needed



Ecommerce Ownership and Execution



Full ownership of ecommerce revenue, profitability, and growth



Define ecommerce strategy across Amazon, Walmart, Wayfair, and Shopify



Build, hire, and manage internal staff and external partners (ads, creative, catalog, operations)



Own marketplace and DTC performance, pricing, promotions, margin, and inventory health



Establish SOPs, KPIs, and reporting for all ecommerce functions



Oversee day-to-day ecommerce operations while staying focused on strategy and outcomes



Make data-driven decisions at the SKU, category, and channel level



Reduce owner involvement by fully owning decisions and execution through your team



What This Role Is



A management and leadership role



Accountable for profit and sustainable growth



Focused on decision-making, prioritization, and accountability



A long-term role with room to grow into full ownership of the ecommerce division



What This Role Is Not



Not a consulting or advisory position



Not a task-only execution role



Not a part-time or side engagement



Required Experience



Proven experience managing ecommerce channels (Amazon required, others preferred)



Demonstrated ownership of revenue outcomes, not just tasks



Experience building and managing teams



Strong understanding of ads, listings, pricing, inventory, and fulfillment



Comfortable making decisions with imperfect information



Experience reporting on and improving metrics such as revenue growth, margin, ACOS, ROAS, conversion, and inventory turns



What We’re Looking For



Someone who is comfortable being accountable



Someone who makes decisions and stands behind them



Someone who thinks like an owner, not an assistant



Someone who values systems, structure, and execution discipline



Someone who wants to build something long-term



How to Apply



To be considered, please submit:



Your resume



Links to ecommerce brands, stores, or marketplaces you directly managed, including specific results



Optional: a short Loom video introducing yourself and one relevant case study

title: Senior Graphic Designer
description:
???? We’re Hiring: Senior Graphic Designer

(English Required)



EverGrowth Agency is hiring a Senior Graphic Designer to join our fast-paced, performance-driven creative team.

We build high-converting social media ads and digital campaigns for growth-focused brands. We are looking for someone experienced, proactive, and detail-oriented — someone who doesn’t need hand-holding and can confidently own their role from day one.

This is not an entry-level role.



???? Communication Requirement (Important)

Strong English communication skills are required.



You must be able to:

Communicate clearly with our internal team

Participate confidently in client calls (in English)

Avoid spelling and grammar mistakes in design assets

English proficiency is non-negotiable.



???? Who We’re Looking For



We’re seeking a Senior Graphic Designer who:

Has a strong portfolio of client or agency work

Has experience creating performance-driven social media ads

Works quickly without sacrificing quality

Is highly detail-oriented and thoroughly checks their work before submitting

Can manage a heavy workload and meet deadlines consistently

Takes initiative and solves problems without waiting for instructions

Is reliable, responsive, and proactive



We are looking for someone who gets things DONE.



???? Core Responsibilities

Design high-performing static creatives for paid social campaigns

Support visual elements for video ads when needed

Follow brand guidelines across multiple client accounts

Collaborate closely with media buyers and account managers

Participate in internal meetings and client calls (in English)

Review all designs carefully for spelling, grammar, and formatting accuracy

Manage multiple projects simultaneously with speed and organization





???? Required Tools & Skills



Must Have:

Canva

Strong typography, layout, and hierarchy skills

Experience designing for paid ads (Meta, YouTube, Google Display)

Agency experience

Understanding of performance marketing concepts

Basic motion graphics skills





? What We Will Be Evaluating



During the hiring process, we will assess:

Design quality

Speed and turnaround time

Attention to detail (especially English spelling/grammar)

Ability to take initiative

Ability to manage workload without constant supervision

Resume

Remote

Full-time

???? What Success Looks Like

Minimal to no spelling/grammar errors in English

Strong alignment with brand guidelines

Clear communication with team and clients

Ability to handle workload independently

Proactive problem-solving





If you are a senior-level designer who works fast, communicates clearly, and takes ownership — we’d love to hear from you.

title: Agency Virtual Assistant
description:
Overview

We are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented virtual assistant to support a busy agency. Your job is to keep communication clean, schedules protected, and projects moving from concept through delivery. You will support scheduling, follow-up, client coordination, and internal tracking so the team can stay focused on execution.



Key Responsibilities

Scheduling and calendar management

Schedule meetings with clients and the team

Coordinate availability across internal tea
mbers and clients

Send confirmations, reminders, agendas, and Zoom links

Reschedule as needed and keep calendars accurate and up to date

Client communication and coordination

Send follow-up
s after meetings to confirm next steps and deadlines

Request missing materials from clients and keep the team informed on what is outstanding

Maintain a professional and responsive tone in all communication

Project tracking and follow-through

What Success Looks Like

title: Ecommerce Design & Marketing Execution Assistant (Canva) — Prayer Scarves
description:
About Prayer Scarves

Prayer Scarves is a Christian creative brand that designs scripture-covered scarves to encourage intimacy with God. Our heart is to help people return to the Word through every season—waiting, grief, spiritual warfare, healing, motherhood, leadership, and quiet growth.



Customers often use Prayer Scarves as:

 - a prayer companion in devotion and worship

 - an encouragement gift for someone in a hard season

 - a reminder to keep showing up in the secret place

 - a layer of comfort and focus while waiting on God

 - a tool for women who encourage others in Christ (mentors, intercessors, leaders, friends)



This is a message-centered brand with real products—and the visuals we create help carry that message to the right person at the right time.



Who This Role Is For

This role is best suited for someone who:

 - is a practicing Christian and feels comfortable working with Scripture-centered content

 - is creative and can build strong visuals without needing templates

 - can take examples, references, and written content—and turn it into cohesive, usable assets

 - social media graphics (launches, promos, announcements, review posts)

 - Pinterest pins (by theme and season)

 - Shopify website banners and light visual updates

 -
/SMS campaign graphics (headers, dividers, promos)

 - marketplace listing images (Amazon/Etsy/Shopify/TikTok)

 - customer review visuals

 - seasonal refresh sets across platforms





Listing Support (Execution + Testing)

You will also support product listings by:

 - updating listing images

 - reordering listing image sequence (when provided/approved)

 - applying approved seasonal copy blocks (provided)

 - reordering bullet points (provided/approved)

 - adding review-based callouts

 - flagging basic performance drops (CTR/clicks) for review



Requirements

 - Canva is a must (strong layout + typography + readability)

 - Comfortable designing with text-heavy content

 - Organized file handling + consistent delivery

 - Able to follow direction while bringing creative skill to execution



Nice-to-Haves (Plus Skills)

Not required, but a plus if you have experience with:

 - Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop/Illustrator) — we use both Canva + Adobe

 - Amazon listing images and/or A+ Content

 - Shopify theme sections / simple banner swaps

 - Pinterest best practices (pin formats, seasonal organization)

 - Basic e-commerce creative testing mindset (image order, clarity, CTR awareness)

 - Short-form video thumbnails or simple video formatting (optional)



How to Apply

Please send:

 1. A short intro (why this role fits you) Please begin your application with a favorite bible verse and why it’s a favorite (in your own words ????)

title: YouTube Channel Manager
description:
We are Degold Media, a growing YouTube automation company. We're looking for a reliable, organized, and ambitious Channel Manager to oversee 5 YouTube channels full-time. This is a long-term position with room to grow into a leadership role as we scale. We provide all the tools, systems, and team — you bring the structure and accountability.



 Job Details:



You will manage 5 YouTube channels and the teams behind them (editors, scriptwriters, voice actors, thumbnail designers)

You will directly manage 2–3 full-time production freelancers on a daily basis

Your daily workflow includes: assigning tasks, tracking deadlines, reviewing finished videos for quality, and uploading/scheduling content on YouTube

You are the bridge between the team and ownership — making sure every video goes from script to publish smoothly and on time

Full-time role: 8 hours/day, must be available every day (including weekends when needed)





Requirements:



Available every day — this is not a side gig, we need someone fully committed

Strong English — written and spoken (you'll be communicating with the team daily)

Comfortable using project management tools (Trello, Notion, Google Sheets, or similar)

Excellent communication skills — you'll be following up with tea
mbers, giving feedback on edits, and reporting progress

Able to review video quality — you don't need to edit, but you need a good eye for what looks right and what doesn't





 Salary:



Base pay: $300–$400/month depending on experience

Bonuses: Performance-based bonuses as channels grow

Growth: Opportunity to manage more channels and move into a Head of Operations role as we expand





 Perfect For You If:



You're a natural organizer who loves checklists, deadlines, and keeping things running smoothly

You want a long-term position with a growing company, not just another freelance gig

You're ambitious — you don't just do the minimum, you look for ways to improve systems and help the team get better





 How to Apply:

Send me a message with:



A short video of yourself (1–2 minutes) — film yourself talking about who you are, your experience managing teams or YouTube channels, and why you'd be a good fit for this role. This is required — we want to hear your English and get to know you

Your portfolio or any proof of work — YouTube channels you've managed, project management experience, or anything that shows you can handle this role

Your availability — confirm you can commit to full-time (8hrs/day, available daily)

title: Video editor / Thumbnail Designer
description:
### Long-Term YouTube Video Editor Opportunity (Ongoing Work)



I’m looking for a skilled video editor to collaborate with me long term across multiple creative projects. This will begin on a per-video basis and can grow into a larger monthly arrangement over time if we’re a strong fit.



I am not looking for a quick one-off freelancer. I am looking for someone who would eventually prefer steady collaboration with one person rather than constantly searching for the next gig.



### Projects You’ll Be Editing



Primary focus:



Seek Consciousness — breathwork, focus, personal growth, and discussions around psychedelics and expanded awareness. If you are not comfortable working with this subject matter, this will not be a good fit.



Additional variety:



Leviticus Tattoo — art, culture, studio life

Minneapolis HiFi — high-end audio, music immersion, events



These add creative variety and different tones of content.



### Expected Volume



Starting around 10–20 videos per month including:



• YouTube long-form videos

• Podcast edits

• Clipping shorts and reels from longer content

• Educational and talking-head style videos



Volume will grow over time.



### Editing Style



I am looking for someone who can handle intentional, message-driven content with strong pacing and emotional awareness. Clean cuts, thoughtful timing, and professional polish are important.



Heavy effects are not necessary. Subtle enhancements, light motion graphics, visual aids, and tasteful creative additions that support the message are welcome.



If you also have YouTube thumbnail experience, please mention that and include samples.



### What I Value



• Reliability

• Clear communication

• Positive attitude

• Good heart

• Openness to growth

• Comfortable communicating via Zoom,
, and messaging



Bonus points if you are personally interested in meditation, mindfulness, or spiritual growth. This role can be an opportunity to deepen your own understanding while helping create meaningful content.



### Optional: AI Tools Experience



If you have experience using AI tools to improve workflow (for example ChatGPT, Descript, Runway, ElevenLabs, transcription tools, caption tools, or YouTube optimization tools), please briefly explain how you use them in your editing process.



This is not required, but openness to learning and using tools that improve efficiency is a plus.



### Selection Process



I will select a few of the strongest candidates and pay them to edit one or two sample videos. From there, I will choose the best long-term fit.



This will start a little bit smaller and grow with both of us.  As I create more content and we figure out how to increase our reach and bandwidth.  



I'm a very zen and chill person and I am an artist as well which helps both in my creative work and my interactions with coworkers.



### When Applying



Please include:



1. 3–5 YouTube videos you have edited

2. How you charge (per video, hourly, etc.)

3. Your typical rate

4. Whether you are open to growing into a larger ongoing role

5. If you read this fully, include the word “clarity” in your response



I am looking to build something meaningful and consistent over time. If that aligns with you, I’d love to hear from you.
salary: 300-750 a Month with room to grow

title: Content & Local SEO Assistant (20 Hrs/Week part time to full time)
description:
About the Company:

Key Nautilus is a growing US-based lead generation agency focused on the home services industry (concrete, artificial turf, etc.). We are looking for a highly reliable, detail-oriented individual to join as a long-term partner, not just a gig worker. While this role will start as part time, the plan is to increase full time as company grows and Assistant skills develop.



The Role:

This is a permanent, 20-hour-per-week retainer position. You will be paid a flat salary every two weeks for this half-time role. Your primary objective is to execute our specific, documented systems for content creation and local SEO maintenance. As you master the core tasks and increase speed, we will scale up the volume of articles and posts, and introduce new administrative tasks.



Note: The first 30 days of employment will be a probationary trial period. During this time, we will evaluate your ability to follow SOPs accurately, communicate clearly through daily EOD reports, and meet deadlines. If it is a good fit, the role becomes permanent.



Core Responsibilities:



SEO Content Creation: Generate articles using AI for speed, edit them thoroughly to remove "robotic" language, generate relevant images, and format/publish them using our website builder Snapps (white label of Duda).



Google Business Profiles (GBP): Create, edit, and schedule posts via LeadSnap. Upload and accurately geo-tag images to build out the media galleries.



Social Media: Repurpose GBP content or create new posts to schedule across multiple
 pages using Meta Business Suite.



Rank Tracking: Log into Serpfox weekly (via Bitwarden) to refresh and update ranking data for all client assets.



Daily Reporting: Submit a brief, bulleted End-of-Day (EOD)
 report detailing completed tasks with links to the live work for review.



Requirements:



Excellent written English with the ability to edit AI-generated text to sound natural and professional.



High attention to detail. You must be able to follow step-by-step video SOPs exactly as recorded. You must be comfortable asking for clarification via
 as needed.



Experience with website builders (Duda, WordPress, or similar).



Must be comfortable using a password manager (Bitwarden) for secure access.



Reliable internet connection (>10 Mbps) and a plan for backup power during brownouts.



Individuals only. If you are an agency sub-contracting work, do not apply.



How to Apply (READ CAREFULLY):

If you do not follow these instructions exactly, your application will not be considered.



Change the Subject Line of your reply to: "I am your [Your City Name] Content Pro"



Reply with the answers to these four questions:



Tech Check: Please provide a link to a screenshot of your internet speed test (speedtest.net) and a photo of your workspace. Do you have a backup power source? If so, what is it?



Tool Experience: Have you ever used Duda/Snapps or LeadSnap? If not, are you comfortable learning new software via video tutorials?



AI Writing: Which AI tools do you use for writing? How do you make sure the content doesn't sound like a robot?



Availability: Are you currently working any other jobs? If so, what are the hours?



Include a link to a 60-second voice recording (using Vocaroo or similar) introducing yourself and explaining why you are a good fit for this role.

title: Web Developer – "Kimkim Style" Platform for Bespoke Travel Expert
description:
Hello,



I am looking for a developer to create a travel platform inspired by the 
 model.



I am a Travel Planner expert in specific regions (China, USA, Cruises, Grece, Vietnam, Japan, Canada...etc). 

Like Kimkim, my website’s goal is NOT to sell standardized packages with "Book Now" buttons. 

Instead, it must act as a bridge between a traveler and my expertise.



Key elements I want to replicate from the Kimkim model:



Expert-Centric Homepage: The site must immediately showcase my authority. 

We sell "Expert Advice" first, "Travel" second.

Sample Itinerary Cards: Beautifully designed grid of "Inspiration Itineraries." 

When a user clicks, they see a detailed day-by-day preview (static) with a prominent "Customize this trip with [My Name]" button.

The "Matchmaking" Form: A clean, step-by-step funnel that asks the right questions (destination, travelers, interests, budget) to qualify the lead.

Trust & Personality: Dedicated "Meet your Expert" sections and traveler reviews to create a human connection before the first call.

Clean, Modern UI: White background, professional typography, and high-quality destination photography. The design must be "invisible" to let the expertise shine.



Technical Stack:

Platform: Webflow or WordPress (Custom build).

No complex booking engine or real-time pricing needed. I use my own professional software for the final quote.



How to apply:

Show me portfolios that share the Kimkim aesthetic (clean, grid-based, expert-focused).

Tell me how you would build the "Inspiration Itinerary" section so I can easily add new trips myself.



Start your reply with the word "SPECIALIST".

Best regards,

title: Remote Business Development Representative (BDR) / Cold Caller / Appointment Setter / Sales Development Representative
description:
About Us

StoryGen (www.storygen.agency/) is a fast-growing B2B lead generation agency that helps companies build predictable sales pipelines through outbound execution. Cold calling is our edge, and our BDRs are at the front line starting conversations, qualifying prospects, and booking meetings that turn into real revenue.



We work with fast-moving SaaS startups and established service businesses across digital marketing, IT services, fintech, staffing, and consulting. Joining StoryGen means real exposure to multiple industries, proven outbound systems, and daily conversations with decision-makers.



We’re looking for a results-driven Remote SDR to run outbound cold calling campaigns and consistently book qualified sales meetings for our clients.



This role is best suited for someone who:



- Enjoys being on the phone and speaking with decision-makers

- Performs well in a structured, metrics-driven environment

- Takes pride in clean execution, accurate reporting, and steady improvement

- You’ll turn real conversations into real opportunities and be held accountable for performance.



What You’ll Be Doing

- Make high-volume outbound cold calls to B2B decision-makers

- Follow proven scripts, call frameworks, and objection-handling methods

- Book and confirm qualified sales meetings for client campaigns

- Log calls, outcomes, and notes accurately in the CRM

- Send follow-ups, introductions, and calendar confirmations

- Re-engage warm leads to improve show rates and conversions

- Collaborate with Account Managers to refine messaging and targeting

- Share call insights and feedback to improve campaign performance



What We’re Looking For

- Previous BDR/SDR experience with a strong cold calling focus

- Proven ability to hit call activity and meeting-booking targets

- Clear, confident communicator who can handle objections professionally

- Highly organized and process-driven, especially with CRM usage

- Coachable, adaptable, and quick to learn new industries

- Positive, reliable, and performance-oriented team player

- Experience with HubSpot, Slack, Coda, Calendly, or Nooks is a plus



Compensation & Benefits

- Base Pay: USD $1,000 per month

- Commission: Uncapped, paid per qualified meeting held

- Schedule: Monday–Friday, 8:30 AM–6:00 PM (Eastern Time)

- Location: 100% Remote

- Work across multiple B2B industries and client campaigns

- Clear growth path to Senior SDR, Team Lead, and management roles

- Supportive, high-performance remote sales team



How to Apply

We use a skills-based assessment to keep our hiring process fair.



Please complete the assessment and submit the following:

- Your resume

- A link to your internet speed test

- A short Loom audio recording



Apply here:

title: Account Manager / Campaign Manager (Client Success & Strategy)
description:

We’re a fast-growing B2B lead generation agency that builds and manages high-performing outbound sales teams for our clients across multiple industries. Cold calling is our core specialty, powered by smart systems, AI-driven tools, and operations.



About the Role

We’re looking for a proactive Remote Account Manager to own client relationships from onboarding to campaign optimization. In this role, you’ll lead strategy, guide execution, and act as the main bridge between our clients and internal teams. Your mission: ensure every campaign is aligned, optimized, and driving measurable results.



What You’ll Do

- Be the primary point of contact for multiple client accounts, building trust and long-term partnerships.

- Lead client onboarding, strategy calls, and regular performance reviews.

- Create, test, and refine cold call scripts and outbound
 templates, leveraging live BDR feedback and campaign performance.

s.

title: Social Media Manager (with SEO Experience)
description:
Job Posting: Social Media Manager (with SEO Experience)

Company: On Track Learning (OTL)

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Position Type: Part-Time (20 hrs/week)



About Us

On Track Learning (OTL) is dedicated to helping students reach their academic and test prep goals through personalized tutoring and proven strategies. We’re looking for a creative, strategic, and data-driven Social Media Manager to lead our online presence and grow our community, starting with Instagram as our primary platform.



Role Overview

You’ll be responsible for building and executing a social media and content marketing strategy that drives brand visibility, engagement, and leads. This includes developing Instagram strategies, creating engaging content, managing community interactions, and applying SEO best practices to ensure our content reaches the right audience.



What You’ll Do

- Develop and execute a social media strategy for Instagram, with plans to expand to other platforms in the future.

- Create and manage content calendars (posts, stories, reels, infographics).

- Optimize captions, hashtags, and content using SEO and keyword research to improve visibility and reach.

- Monitor and engage with followers: reply to DMs, comments, and mentions.

- Track performance and provide regular reports with insights and recommendations for growth.

- Collaborate with the OTL team to align content with brand voice, seasonal campaigns, and student needs.

- Stay updated with social trends, Instagram algorithm changes, and competitor strategies.



What We’re Looking For

- The High-Output Professional: You are disciplined and hate "idle time." You treat every paid hour as an opportunity to move the needle, whether that’s designing a post, researching keywords, or engagement.

- Independent & Resourceful: You don’t need your hand held. You can take a goal and run with it, finding solutions and tools to get the job done efficiently.

- Seamless Collaborator: While you work independently, you are a proactive communicator. You keep the team in the loop and align your creative vision with OTL’s brand voice.

- SEO Fluency: You understand that social media is a search engine. You know how to use keywords to drive organic reach.

- Creative Toolkit: Skilled in Canva and mobile video editing (CapCut/InShot) for high-retention Reels.

- Tracking Ready: You are comfortable using time-tracking software and maximizing your productivity during your logged hours.



Our Standards for This Role

Efficiency is Key: We value transparency and work ethic. We are looking for a partner who takes pride in their productivity and uses their scheduled time to the fullest. If you are someone who naturally looks for the "next task" once one is finished, you’ll thrive here.



Compensation

- $6 USD per hour

- Part-time role (approx. 20 hours/week)

- Flexible schedule, with some overlap with US PST hours preferred

- Opportunity to grow with the team and take on more responsibility as OTL expands



Why Join OTL?

- Be part of a mission-driven team helping students achieve their goals.

- Work in a flexible, supportive environment where your creativity is valued.

- Have a direct impact on shaping OTL’s digital presence and growth.

- Long-term career growth opportunities as we scale our programs.



How to Apply

1. Send us your:

- Resume

- Portfolio (links to social media accounts or campaigns you’ve managed are important).

- A short note on one Instagram strategy or campaign you worked on, and the results it achieved.

2. Please visit our Instagram page and include a brief critique of our current Instagram in your message. 

3. Message us here with the subject line: “Social Media Manager Application – [Your Name]”



NOTE: Please only apply if you have SEO knowledge and experience.



Thank you!

? This Is NOT For

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

title: Construction CAD Technician/Project Engineer/Estimator
description:
Job Description:

As a Construction CAD Technician/Project Engineer/Estimator, you will play a vital role in ensuring the smooth operation of our construction projects by managing the procurement process. Your responsibilities will include:



1. Creating Submittal Logs: Develop and maintain comprehensive submittal logs to track the submission and approval of all project-related documents.

2. Creating Work Orders: Generate accurate and detailed work orders for subcontractors and suppliers, ensuring all necessary information is included.

3. Creating RFI Logs: Maintain a detailed Request for Information (RFI) log, ensuring all queries and responses are accurately recorded and communicated.

4. Creating Cabinet and Shop Drawings: 

5. Vendor Management: Identify, evaluate, and manage relationships with suppliers and subcontractors to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality materials and services.

6. Cost Management: Monitor and control project costs by negotiating favorable terms with suppliers, managing budgets, and ensuring cost-effective procurement practices.

7. Inventory Management: Oversee the inventory of construction materials and equipment, ensuring adequate stock levels and minimizing waste.

8. Compliance and Documentation: Ensure all procurement activities comply with relevant regulations and standards. Maintain accurate and up-to-date procurement records and documentation.

9. Collaboration: Work closely with project managers, site superintendents, engineers, and other tea ---------- mbers to align procurement activities with project timelines and requirements.

10. Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to improve procurement processes and implement best practices to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

11. Highly efficient at taking notes during meeting.



Requirements:

- A bachelor’s degree in engineering, architecture, supply chain management, or a similar field is preferred.

- Minimum of 4 years experience in the construction industry.

- Proven experience in construction coordination or a related role.

- Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy to ensure there are no mistakes in procurement activities.

- Strong organizational and time-management skills.

- Excellent negotiation and communication skills. Must be fluent in English (verbal and written).

- Proficiency in procurement software and tools.

- In-depth knowledge of construction materials, equipment, and industry standards.

- Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.



PLEASE READ & FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS:

If you're ready to take the next step in your construction career, we want to hear from you! To apply, don’t forget to follow these steps:

1.
 with 'HIRE ME - CAD Technician/Project Engineer/Estimator' in the subject line and send to 

2. Attach your updated Resume/CV in PDF format, detailing your work history.

3. Include a portfolio showcasing your work.

4. Record a one-minute Intro Video addressed to WBC, highlighting your background, skills, and relevant experiences.

5. Provide contact information for 2 professional references, including their Full Names, Job Positions, Relationships, working Philippine contact numbers, Date and Time of Availability.



Please be advised that only candidates who have submitted the specified requirements will be considered in this position.

title: 3D Environment & Character Systems Developer (Long-Term Project) Overview
description:
Overview



We are building a structured, episodic 3D visual project and are looking for a highly organized developer who can help create a reusable production pipeline while also supporting Patreon marketing and growth.



This is a long-term role focused on both technical production and digital monetization systems.



Primary areas of work include:



• 3D environment creation

• Lighting system design

• Camera preset systems

• Character rigging and morph variation

• Reusable animation templates

• Patreon content structuring and marketing support



The goal is to build scalable systems so future content becomes duplication and variation — not reinvention — while also building a stable, growing subscriber base.



This is not a short freelance task. We are building a production engine and a monetized content ecosystem.



---



## Important Content Notice



This project includes mature themes and adult-oriented content.



It is not suitable for applicants who are uncomfortable working with:



• Adult characters

• Romantic and intimate scene staging

• Mature narrative themes



All characters are adults. There is no illegal or prohibited material involved.



Please apply only if you are comfortable working on mature-themed 3D visual content and marketing such content responsibly.



---



## Responsibilities



### Phase 1 – Environment Systems



• Build modular interior and exterior locations

• Create standardized lighting presets (day, evening, night)

• Create reusable camera preset systems

• Establish anchor-point positioning systems for staging



### Phase 2 – Character Systems



• Develop shared base meshes and rig systems

• Create morph variations for distinct characters

• Ensure proper deformation, collision, and pose compatibility

• Calibrate shaders for multiple lighting environments



### Phase 3 – Motion Template Systems



• Create reusable animation templates

• Standardize camera movement language

• Build loop-based scene systems

• Maintain consistent rendering across locations



---



## Patreon & Marketing Responsibilities



In addition to production work, this role includes helping manage and grow our Patreon presence.



Responsibilities may include:



• Structuring content tiers (preview, standard, premium)

• Uploading and formatting posts consistently

• Writing or refining post descriptions

• Creating thumbnail crops and preview assets

• Scheduling releases

• Managing subscriber updates and messaging

• Supporting promotional strategies

• Suggesting growth tactics based on platform trends



The goal is to create a repeatable content publishing system that supports steady subscriber growth.



---



## Required Skills



• Strong experience in Blender and/or DAZ Studio

• Character rigging and morph systems

• Lighting design for cinematic rendering

• Camera framing and shot composition

• Scene organization and naming discipline

• Experience with Patreon or similar subscription platforms

• Basic marketing mindset (understanding audience retention and growth)



---



## Ideal Candidate



• Thinks in systems, not one-off scenes

• Organized with file structure and naming conventions

• Comfortable building reusable presets

• Comfortable working on mature-themed content

• Has experience managing Patreon or subscription-based content

• Available for long-term collaboration



---



## Work Style



• Structured milestone-based development

• Clear written briefs provided

• Weekly review cycles

• Emphasis on consistency and scalability



---



If applying, please include:



• Portfolio samples (environments and characters preferred)

• Software you use

• Weekly availability

• Experience with Patreon or subscription-based platforms

• Confirmation you are comfortable with mature-themed visual content

What You’ll Own:

- Conducting outbound conversations to understand current workflows and systems

- Identifying how documentation, reporting, and compliance are being tracked (often across spreadsheets and manual processes)

- Qualifying and scheduling deeper discovery calls when there’s strategic alignment



What We Provide:

- A highly targeted prospect list

- Clear personas and positioning

- Structured call framework and messaging

Why This Role Matters



Engineering firms managing local and state-funded projects often operate with fragmented documentation processes. As projects scale, manual tracking systems can slow teams down and increase compliance risk.



Your role is to uncover how firms are operating today, where friction exists, and which teams may be open to modernizing their approach.
